Beef fillet was also good, but nothing too exciting.; We were looking for a fine dine restaurant, this was recommended by our hotel staff, and surprisingly this was indeed a good experience. Price it's reasonable, portions are great, great service! The only improvement I see are the desserts, they are too heavy by my taste, but definitely does not affect overall experience.; The restaurant was an absolutely fantastic discovery having come here for dinner with a friend! We chose it judging by all the positive reviews & we weren't disappointed üòç Every dish that we ordered was absolutely exquisite!! We had the burrata as a starter, the dorade ceviche as a main and the seasonal crumble, as well S the mousse au chocolat for dessert - each and every one of them was a little wow experience ü§Ø The prices were fair for the outstanding quality - 27‚Ç¨ for a starter + a main dish or a main dish + a dessert; or 35‚Ç¨ for all the three courses. I had a white wine suggested which fit perfectly with the food and all in all, the service was so warm and welcoming, which is extremely refreshing in the world of grumpy Parisian waiters üòÖ The only thing to mention, is that it would be great to have some more qualitative tea instead of just Lipton in a tea bag üòè It's located in a little hidden street, so it's really calm & away from all the noise of the cars, while being super central, it's simply the perfect mix!!! We will be back for sure & I have already suggested it to other friends ‚ô•Ô∏è; It was a nice fixed price menu place. My favorites were the mushroom soup starter and the desserts. For my entr√©e I had the steak tartare, and I guess it's one of those things I can check off the list as having tried. They've got plenty of wines to choose from, if that's your thing.

name: Cozy Factory ( poke bowls & sandwich)
formatted_address: 36 Rue Saint-Andr√© des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
The pok√© was very fresh. I liked the portion size also. The staff was very friendly and patient. You can ask for the wifi code to save some data when visiting around paris. They also have a restroom too. Which is a nice addition for a small place. Nice place to rest when walking around paris.; Good poke restaurant, fresh products,  good service
Prices are correct: from 9.90 euros
Two sizes : L or XL
You can make your bowl as well choosing the size; Great food and good service! Not so nice to sit because it‚Äòs a small place; Lovely place to eat! Great service, friendly staff, so willing to help us even though we don't speak French very well. The food was delicious, very fresh and a lot of choice. Also the name fits well: cozy and pretty interior. Would definitely visit again!; Very cozy place with nice and fresh food
Recommended for a quick lunch

name: Caf√© Klin
reviews:
Highly recommend l!! A really nice caf√© with loads of veggie options. They also serve Natural wine and have a great selection of fresh juice and craft beer.
A must to try when you are around Republique area in Paris. 5 stars.; I am not vegan but I find the food in this little caf√© absolutely delicious. I had a taster meal (5 courses) and everything was fresh and tasty. Staff is very nice. You can even seat outside. I will come back; One of my best cafes for breakfast in the morning. An active atmosphere. And their service is good. And a special thanks to the restaurant manager. I will be back to visit again.; Cute interior, a bit dirty, the coffee was good. The selection of pastry was a bit small but it was ok.; An excellent cafe, super friendly staff. Highly recommended !

name: Caf√© Latin
formatted_address: 30 Rue Saint-Andr√© des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
The best meal in Paris! We had a fantastic dinner at Cafe Latin on a busy Saturday evening but were seated right away. Our waiter was super friendly, knowledgeable, and clearly passionate about the food.
The duck confit and veal kidney were the best dishes we‚Äôve had in France, ever! The waiter also recommended a lovely wine that paired perfectly with our meal. I really can't recommend this place enough. If you find yourself in Paris, go to Cafe Latin - you won't regret it!; We LOVED this place. Happened to stumble in and had an amazing experience. The cook is a former Michelin chef that opened his own place. The cheeseburger was to die for and the kidneys were exceptional if you're looking to go authentic. Waitstaff and owner were so friendly and made sure our meal was perfect! Highly recommend!; I had the steak tartare, one of the best one ai had. One of the owner is serving and is very friendly and you can see that he is passionate about his bistro. Check it out, worth the detour!; We enjoyed a very nice meal at this restaurant. It was a busy night but we were seated promptly. The food was well presented and very tasty. The service was professional and friendly. There was a lovely atmosphere and at all times we were treated as welcome guests.; 14‚Ç¨ for 3 slices of cheese and some random salad. Really? What a rip off. They weren‚Äôt good either.

name: Little Babel
reviews:
Visited twice while I was in Paris.

Service is some of the best I received while in Paris. Very welcoming and friendly. Great atmosphere and decor. And most importantly a lot of effort and love goes into their food.
Would recommend!; The food was absolutely delicious and we can confidently call it one of the best pizzas we‚Äôve ever eaten. The service was supreme and the atmosphere was cozy. We 100 percent recommend this place and would come back every time!!
merci beaucoup; Absolutely the best pizza we have ever eaten!  We are from Connecticut which is viewed as having the best pizza in the USA and this totally tops it!  Perfectly delicious!; Nestled in the heart of Paris, Little Babel Pizza is a culinary treasure. This quaint establishment, though small in size, delivers a gastronomic experience that is both delightful and memorable. Their pizza, crafted with a perfect blend of flavors and cooked to crispy perfection, stands out as a must-try for any food lover. But the delights don‚Äôt end there ‚Äì their pasta and spaghetti dishes are equally commendable, each plate offering a taste of authentic Italian cuisine.

What makes Little Babel Pizza truly special is the worthiness of the wait. Each dish is prepared with care, ensuring that every bite is a testament to their dedication to quality and taste. To top off the dining experience, their coffee is exceptional ‚Äì rich in flavor and the perfect endnote to a satisfying meal. Little Babel Pizza is more than just a restaurant; it‚Äôs an experience that encapsulates the essence of Parisian charm and culinary excellence.; AWESOME PIZZA!!! This is most likely the best pizza in Paris! We have been all over Italy and this is right up there with the best pizza in Italy. In a quiet cozy part of the city. The owners are super nice and fun! Its a must go to!

name: LES TRIPLETTES DE BELLEVILLE
reviews: We highly recommend this restaurant because the food and atmosphere are excellent plus the service is exceptional! Our server and the chef went above and beyond to ensure that our dining experience was five stars. Thank you very much üòä; Okay. I just arrived in Paris after being in Italy for 2 weeks, and this was honestly better than anything I had there! Don‚Äôt tell Italy, but this place is sooo good. I had the coquillettes pasta with ham. They use truffle gouda and it‚Äôs to die for! I ate the whole thing. Finished it with the chocolate cake. The server Juliette was very kind to me and gave me recommendations for things to do while I‚Äôm in Paris. Highly recommend! ; Went here for breakfast. The design looked quite cool and the food was pretty good but we noticed a lot of mouse / rat droppings on the sofa and and on the counters which put us off a lot also the toilet wasn't nice and didn't have any soap which didn't help with the cleanliness feeling.; The breakfast menu consisting of a hot drink, croissant, and fresh orange juice was great. Especially the croissant that was just fresh out of the issue. While the cafe au lait was delicious, the peppermint tea consisted of fresh mint leaves and a bag of green tea. This wasn't great for people who order mint tea specifically because they don't enjoy green tea.; Had a lovely time here. Two friends and I ordered a menu (Formule) and they took a bit too long. They forgot my starter and brought it after the main dish which was messed up too; the steak was half-raw when I like it done. So to compensate, they gave me free desert and only charged me for one dish. Altogether I really appreciate this gesture and I would return.

name: Dame Tartine
reviews:
We came across this place totally by chance but what a find. People are incredibly nice, welcoming. The food, homemade, is really good and the meat was excellent. Although area is very touristic, it is the exception and it feels like a local restaurant. Every time we went, most customers were french people which is a great sign. The terrasse experience is really nice; The food was great. I had the veal steak with mashed potatoes and it was awesome. Kids had the beef steak and loved it. Honestly can‚Äôt remember my wife dish name but looked great!
The staff were super friendly and spoke fluent English.; I ordered a beef steak and was surprised when they brought a medium rare. By default in every restaurant I've ever been it's medium.

Medium rare is still smth that I eat but it was unevenly fried and a half of the steak was completely raw. Although I was very hungry raw is not what I can eat.

The waitress didn't even bother to ask why I didn't finish my steak. Overall she looked tired, unhappy and at the same time busy - she was the only one to serve all the tables. It wasn't a peak hour and only about third of the tables is not less were occupied.; Great place with great food. I had the sea bass and a huge portion of profiteroles for dessert. So good.
The place is heaving with people in the evening, it‚Äôs got a very youthful vibe and I like that.
Great selection of drinks too.; Awful service, the guy was rude to customers and slammed our glasses when serving them to us.
Not to mention when my friend asked for the bill he loudly said that he should go inside to pay while shaking his head.
Do not recommend unless you‚Äôre a big fan of cheese and rude people.

name: L'Atelier de LiLi
reviews: The place is small and charming with very good food if you need something for a fast snack‚Ä¶ their concept is cute, like you are entering someone‚Äôs kitchen. A home made Mango juice was super, I like a lot their muffins, so far the best one I‚Äôve tried in Paris‚Ä¶other things we ordered were good as well.; Amazing macarons and coffee. The owners are so friendly, would love to come back next time I'm in town!; Great value, warm welcome as you are part of the family, comes much recommended !!!! Well done guys, see you soon !; The sweetest owners! You can tell the food is made with love üíúü•∞; Short story: despite a good dish the owner tried to steal money from us. She will be very kind to clients she likes probably but she decided to snap at us constantly for no reason. / Long story: The woman who runs this place scams people. All the bad reviews you see are people who have been scammed and who have been scolded at for no reason. She tried to steal 10 euros from us for the mess we left because we were eating with a 1 year old and 3 year old and they spilled crumbs (maybe don‚Äôt run a restaurant if you can‚Äôt handle it?). We were 3 adults sharing 2 expensive meals and an overpriced muffin and two coffees and she charged us 52 euros with an imaginary extra 10 euros for a ‚Äúcocktail‚Äù. We returned to get refunded and she even tried to justify it because of the crumbs. She said ‚ÄúI added 10 euros because of the mess you left‚Äù ‚Äî acknowledging this theft. Imagine you were charged 10 euros extra everywhere you ate because you or your kids left crumbs on the floor? Completely absurd. She chooses to run the place this way scamming those she doesn‚Äôt like. She was super nice to the table next to us and actually telling them she didn‚Äôt like our table‚Ä¶ ?! We even apologised and mentioned the food was good and she said she didn‚Äôt appreciate our ‚Äúpicnic‚Äù (because we shared ‚Ä¶.) and that the crumbs were not ‚Äúserious‚Äù ‚Äî I think some people should change careers if they can‚Äôt handle the most mundane happenings of a restaurant, and be the opposite of kind. Especially if you‚Äôre the owner.

name: Wonderland brunchy Notre Dame/ Restaurant Brunch
reviews:
Super good food ! Yummy and looks so pretty. We were well received and served with a smile (so important in Paris right ? üòá)
It‚Äôs a little more expensive than we thought but you get what you pay for. Around 18‚Ç¨ for a main. We shared pancakes after so it came out to about 28‚Ç¨ pp for a drink a main and a shared dessert.
Toilets clean, coffee is pretty good, I got a very original drawing on line which made me very happy !; Absolutely amazing brunch spot! We went here every day during our trip in Paris because it was so good. The staff was so kind and friendly to us, especially the server (wish we had asked her name). Highly recommend the eggs Benedict, purple pancakes, and purple french toast. If you want to avoid waiting, go on weekdays or get there when they open on weekends. We loved it!; Best impressions! Food is always delicious, my favorite place for brunch dishes in Paris! Located in the great spot as well! The service is very kind and friendly. Thank you for your always welcoming attitude and honesty.; Food was excellent! Everything that we tried was tasty. Portions were big. Staff was friendly and helpful. But it was 26 degrees outside, you can sit only inside and it was too hot.
All in all it was a very pleasant experience! Thank you!; Me and my friend had the purple french toast, which was amazing!! She already had it before and had to come back to get it.

Also the staff were so lovely and gave us great tips for Paris as a first-timer ü§ç

name: EatDay
reviews:
We decided to visit this restaurant based on the good reviews it had on the Fork. We were craving japanese food and noticed they had some special plates. It was really tasty and fresh and very well presented. Our favourite was the gold rolls with mango and the Sushi with cheese and the salad with shrimps.; When I got to this restaurant, it‚Äôs warm ,and food is delicious, must try the sushi ,that‚Äôs yummy; Service was horrible the entire night. We waited over an hour for our food and by the time we got it the entire restaurant was empty. The staff would yell at each other and ignore me. The food was decent, not amazing. Thankfully it was 40% off through The Fork. I‚Äôm definitely not going back and would advise others to avoid.; Really great discovery! You have a great amount of choice in terms of sushis and we were really surprised how tasty it was. You order your food with a tablet which makes it easier. The personnel was also nice. I really recommend to try this place!; Excellent Japanese restaurant at the heart of Paris not far From the center (Chatelet).
The food is very good, the sushi, the sashimi, the California rolls‚Ä¶ etc
Fresh ingredients and homemade!
Outstanding service and lovely staff!
I highly recommend this place

name: Le bon moment caf√©
reviews: What a beautiful cafe! The staff is super friendly and kind. The latte was delicious, and so were my pancakes! They reminded me of American pancakes, which are not easy to find in Paris. I definitely recommend. I can‚Äôt wait to go back and try more things on the menu!; We ate here recently for breakfast. It's a really cute caf√© in a very quiet street. My friend and I ordered pancakes, I ordered also the a√ßai bowl. The food was absolutely delicious, and the only fault I had was that the pancakes are so small and unfortunately not filling at all. They were great though but definitely need at least 50% more. The staff are very nice and attentive. The plates were beautifully presented. The coffee is exceptional here, my new favourite caf√© for coffee. Highly recommend this place.; I recently tried the passion fruit iced tea at this caf√©, and it was fantastic. Refreshing and full of flavor, it was the perfect drink for a warm day. The caf√©'s setting by the Seine and next to Notre-Dame makes it even more enjoyable. The beautiful surroundings add to the relaxing atmosphere. Highly recommend giving it a try!; One of the first places I visit when I arrive to my first visit to Paris. I needed to work something in my computer and it was great the atmosphere, very wholesome. It has an area for kids to read. The owners were so nice and welcoming. The coffee and the chocolate chip cookies were great (I am a fan of üç™). If I ever go back I will like to visit once again. I wish the best to this caf√©.; Really cute & lovely coffee shop! Loved the staff there, really nice! In terms of food, we took a carrot cake, a black sesame latte & mango&pineapple smoothie. Everything was really good! I would love to come back and try the other things there. In terms of space, there are not a lot of tables so it can be easily packed, not suitable for big groups. I would recommend coming there! ++ for the lovely menu which was probably handmade and then printed.

name: DICE Caff√®
vicinity: 11 Rue du Pas de la Mule, Paris
formatted_address: 11 Rue du Pas de la Mule, 75004 Paris, France
reviews:
This place is a hidden gem next to more well known restaurants. We were lucky enough to walk in, unlike most other spots in the area. The service is amazing and the food is incredible. It‚Äôs a small menu, but it‚Äôs perfect for a date night. The ambiance is superb. I would totally recommend this place to everyone, but we don‚Äôt want it to get overrun like everything else in this neighborhood. Go here before it gets too famous.; It was really nice lunch with two of my friends. Healthy and light, and I loved that there are selected menu for a few days. I have issues with choosing the menu, but there were not too many options, so it was easier. I had the haddock fish with aubergine caviar, and it was really tasty and good portion than it seemed. The place was cute and the staff was nice. I'd like to come back :); Had a great customer experience. Simple, tasteful menu. Good food, wine selection and friendly atmosphere. I'll be back!; 4,9/5
EXCELLENT ! EXCELLENT ! EXCELLENT !
Wandering the streets looking for a nice address, we found this cozy joint next to place des Vosges, with a sunday brunch menu !
Very nice and not-cramped restaurant, few tables with spacious seating, wood decor, simple and heartwarming !
The owner (Diego) is a super friendly Italian from Parma, he handles the bar, his wife is the kitchen boss (super friendly as well, graced me with the honour of best client of the week ;)
We tried the 3 brunch main courses, and they were all 3 DELICIOUS !
Eggs with salmon, potato galette with cream cheese.
My favourite was the bun with mozzarella and coppa di parma ; incredibly tasty
and the 3rd and most original was pupkin pancakes with cheese, topped with beets and salad !
Simple, tasty, and copious !
Their juices were really good too ; I tried the refreshing apple, cucumber, lemon shake !
A must try address, e !ven if to grab a simple coffee.; A lovely place. We stumbled upon it for lunch and for 23 EUR had a 3 course menu with generous portions. The food is delicious and the staff lovely. The place is also nicely decorated and definitely worth a visit :)

name: Crepolog
reviews:
Hi Crepolog!
Nice galettes. Very fast service. The ingredients were fresh, I was surprised by the oregano (great touch on the recipe in my opinion). Maybe one note would be the butter amount, which as we all know can never be enough!
Okay, another note for possible improvement: the menu. The font isn‚Äôt really readable, in my view at least :)
Plus points for the sitting, spacious and not crammed (üëç) and the location‚Äîconvenient!
I would like to leave 5 stars to award the work and encourage the future improvements. I would like to come by Crepolog again for a galette in the future again to update my review :); Some of the best food we had in Paris! The staff was very attentive and the crepes and galletes were delicious!; Not bad, exactly how I expected them to taste like; Cr√™pes are the focus of this place and they‚Äôre very good. I tried two sweet ones ‚Äì the traditional lemon, and the dark chocolate. Both were very good. I‚Äôm going to go back and try the savory ones. Also, the men there were very welcoming. It was a nice experience on a rainy day in Paris!; This lovely owner owned restaurant allows you to create your own galettes and crepes from a list of ingredients. The waiters are super helpful. We tried different galettes and dessert crepes all were excellent! The prices are reasonable.

name: Le P'tit Piano
reviews:
Great food and service! The staff were nice and friendly. We got their sirloin steak with shallot cream and one with morel (mushroom) sauce, and duck breast. We also got the creme brulee, lemon tart and chocolate fondant with ice cream for dessert.; We loved everything here!
The service was great and we were greeted by a smile as soon as we arrived.

Food came out super quickly and was delicious. Great portion as well, so great value for money. Cocktails were tasty and refreshing for these hot summer afternoons.

Ambience was one of the things I liked the most. Soothing and relaxing, allowing for you to properly enjoy your food and take a breath, despite being located in a busy street.

100% recommend.; We decided to try this place out after seeing all the fantastic reviews, but upon arrival, we almost thought we were at the wrong place‚Äîit looked almost like a PMU from the outside! However, stepping inside changed our minds instantly. The interior is surprisingly cute, and it was bustling with energy during our Saturday brunch visit.

There's even a piano set up for their piano nights, adding a charming touch. The staff was incredibly friendly, which made our experience even better.
The food? Absolutely delightful. I had the foie gras and salade p√©rigourdine as starters, which were hearty enough to be mains, followed by the succulent souris d‚Äôagneau. The portions were generous across the board, definitely making it worth the money.

I would heartily recommend this spot and affirm that it truly deserves its high ratings, especially for the quality of the cuisine.; Amazing little gem. Very good food. Very nice staff and they helped me with my gastric bypass needs. Food was delicious steak was a little undercooked because I asked for medium rare but I got rare. No big problem was tasty nonetheless!; Alfredo is great! The dishes he recommended were surprisingly good. We ordered the lamb, goat cheese salad, charcuterie board, and French onion soup. To top off a great dinner he treated us to mint shots that we loved. Give this place a try!

name: Les Fils √† Maman Grands-Boulevards
reviews: The vibe here is like travelling back in time to the 70s/80s with decor (cassette tape wall, kid and adult TV series posters and vintage signage) appointed from a time past. The origin story of the restaurant is featured in a spiral bound menu that was provided in addition to the fold-out brunch menu. The formule at 30 euros is a steal. In general, the restaurant offers great value for money. The egg/ham croissant was a 3 for me because of the scrambled egg quality (reminded me of cafeteria powdered eggs) and croissant quality (tough texture). The service is a 3 because the order had to be reconfirmed a few minutes after our drinks were served AND one of our drinks was served ‚Äúvirgin‚Äù in error. The ambience is fun and the guests appeared to be very pleased. Note: the table seating is very cozy; Delicious food and friendly, accommodating staff. Ambiance is nice as well, with plenty of interesting things to look at. We shared a charcuterie/appetizer platter, with deep fried croquettes of cheese, pulled pork and more, along with some sliced salami, pickles and some amazing "fries" made out of chickpeas. For mains, we had the chicken cordon bleu and some kind of mushroom and cheese pastry. They dont have English menus, but the staff was great about explaining things. Give the French IPA a try as well!; On our final night in Paris, my mother was really craving Chicken Cordon Bleu and we were fortunate enough to find it at Les Fils a Maman. Service was great and we really loved the fun, quirky atmosphere. I ordered the Filet Mignon (delish) and the Cosmo Spritzes were great as well!; Very pleasant dinner experience - they accommodate large groups with reservation. The cordon Bleu chicken deserves all good reviews it has. Other dishes are also tasty.; All demands and expectations have been fulfilled. Nice chicken fillet, outstanding homemade drinks. We had a wonderful time.

name: Little Parmentier
reviews:
I had the fish and chips and my wife had the Carnard.  Food was delicious but I am going to echo what others have said, the owner is super friendly, warm and welcoming.  I would gladly come back based on that alone.  Highly recommended for both food and atmosphere.; Am not sure I went to the right Little Parmentier if all the reviews are true!
The steak was rubbery, the salad was manky and the small glass of red was ‚Ç¨7. A real tourist trap! I shouldn't have entered when I saw the place completely empty!
Serves me right for placing my trust in these reviews!; Our first dinner experience in Paris and it was wonderful. The gentleman that was front of house was so nice and helpful. Food itself was also wonderful, cook on the beef was absolutely perfect.; The food is  very good and familiar.
The boss is nice and friendly and the ambiance is calm and relaxed...
The prices are moderate and we can choose some good artisanal beers. We feel at home!; One of the best restaurants in Paris

name: Sacr√© Frenchy !
reviews:
Food was excellent, very tasty dishes. The chicken was amazing, and worth sharing. The happy hour on cocktails was a good deal as well, and delicious cocktails.

Service was not great for our visit, cocktail forgotten, and a 45 minute wait for the main dish after starters. We noticed several other tables having quite some issues with service as well around us. It was not busy or full at the time. A great dining experience turned poor by long waits and off service.

That said, not so bad I wouldn‚Äôt try again, it could be an off day, but the food was great, and service was friendly despite the waits and inattentiveness.; This place was absolutely wonderful! Our waitress, Amelie, was incredibly kind and attentive, making our experience truly exceptional. The food was fantastic, and the cocktails were equally impressive.; I don‚Äôt normally leave a review, but I felt compelled. We had eight people and they accommodated us at the last minute. Our servers name was Emily and she was absolutely phenomenal from picking wine to suggesting entr√©es. The food came on time and it was fantastic. What a great dining Atmosphere experience. if you‚Äôre in this area, don‚Äôt look any further.; Very kid and tourist friendly. The staff were so sweet, and the food was wonderful. I highly recommend their seafood ceviche. Dessert was to die for too. Their cr√®me br√ªl√©e was the table‚Äôs favorite.; My wife and I had our first dinner in this last visit to Paris. My wife is not a ‚Äúlamb food fan‚Äù, and had a steak, while I ordered the ‚Äú7 hour lamb dish‚Äù.
The food was great, cooked to order, and very tasty. Service was great too. With that said, I would like to emphasize the ‚Äú7 hour lamb‚Äù dish that was probably the best lamb dish I had so far. It was adobe style, super duper tasty. It was so good my wife ate more of it than her steak. Since we came for only 3 days to Paris and did not want to go to the same place twice, we went to explore other places in the following g evening. We regret not coming back to have this lamb again. Other dinners were fine too, but this was the most remembered from this trip. Served with spinach warm side dish and (what I believe was) mashed cilantro root. It is a MUST HAVE dish!

name: Brunch Paris
reviews: Correct, lots of choice, good products and unlimited üòâto do for Brunch lovers; Several incredible addressesü•∞;

name: La Fontaine Cuvier Restaurant
reviews:
Everyone knows French food is delicious but I wasn't expecting to get fantastic burgers in Paris! Stopped in randomly for dinner and this burger and fries was perfection. There's a whisper of garlic on the fries that's soooo good and the caramelized onions in the burger were delicious. Definitely recommend.; I have eaten here twice in the last two nights and found the staff to be very friendly and the food was delicious . I had salmon in a crispy pastry with beautifully cooked vegetables in a sumptuous sauce and a medium rare beef dish with excellent fries and salad. The white wine and rose were wonderful too. Great atmosphere and music. I will be back :-); Great resto just next to the Jardin des plantes. Our 2nd time here and food was good and service right on.; We had amaizing evenings in this restaurant with real parisian view and vibe.
We had french fries and mousse au chocolat which was delicious but contained a little bit of lumps.
But we would definetely come back.; Delicious burgers. Close to the Jardin de Plants. The restaurant is on the corner of a street and easy to miss if you're coming from the north side. But if you do spot it, you'll will find a small restaurant that cooks your meal where you can see it from the outside terrace. The burgers are to die for, great taste. The lady serving us was very eager to help and explained everything to us in English. The restaurant is on a corner of a busy street though, which is not ideal, but probably worth it.

name: Restaurant Discovery Food
reviews:
I came here excited to try their food, but once I began ordering that changed (I‚Äôm only visiting so my French is very little) tried to order what I could In French and the rest id point, the lady was so rude mumbling under her breath like ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt speak French‚Äù very rudely which I understood Because I understand French. I so No, sorry. I continued to order and she continued to be very rude to me, so I just Left. Just because you feel miserable doesn‚Äôt mean you have to treat others horribly.; By far the best food place!! Here you can get freshly prepared dishes at fair prices. If you are looking for a delicious and healthy lunch, this restaurant is the best in the area. Moreover, the staff is super friendly!; It looks beautiful and tastes good. The seating is so small and it's crowded as there were only 2 people trying to do everything. Great service though. I bought a sandwich which tasted good. I'll try visiting again !; Finally a restaurant that understands what we really need in Paris!
Being able to eat a balanced diet, with a wide choice, for a reasonable price!
Thanks to the managers, the atmosphere is very pleasant and intimate, I recommend!

@LVS.kid; Excellent place, I highly recommend! Thank you to the very friendly and helpful duo of ladies who received us.

name: Kick Caf√©
reviews:
I visited this cafe in april 2022. As we got there 15 mins before they were closing, they only served us something to drink. The drinks were delicious, I also bought a txt album. Very friendly staff. Mark Tuan went there too!!!!!
I love the decorations, the atmosphere and the concept.; Came from uk for event this cafe was amazing food was delicious loved the drink designed by castle J will definitely return here when we come for our next concert; Nice kawaii coffeeshop. The back of the shop need to be more furnished seems a bit empty and not organized; Cute little caf√© and boutique k-pop themed. If you like color and sugar, this place is for you :); Really nice cafe! Cute decoration and the staff was very nice and spoke english very well! The drinks were delicious and I loved all the kpop decorations!

name: Caf√© Baby Foot
reviews:
One water (50cl)  and one orangina (23 cl ) 9 euros. Too expensive and so bad attention from the waiter. Never will come back.; Good food to a really cheap price; Priceless vestige of a Paris that almost disappeared. A thousand miles from faux-authentic marketing, this is a neighborhood caf√© where you immediately understand that you are not the umpteenth customer to be fleeced. It's precious. We just regret that it is not open more.; Very pleasant and original caf√© located a few steps from the station: Port-Royal...and the magnificent garden of the great Explorers...!
The owner is very welcoming and smiling and makes excellent croque-monsieur or sandwiches with unrivaled talent and know-how! ...
In addition, it is allowed to cultivate oneself and she sells second-hand books, all at a flat rate of ‚Ç¨2...allowing you to nourish your mind as well as your body...
Caf√© that deserves to be discovered for its original and diverse atmosphere...!
There is a real table football in the caf√© (the English say: "Table football" for table football...I think...)..an out of tune piano (for the moment)..guitars.... a slightly bohemian caf√©, in a way, as we like them on the Boul'mich to relax without problems...; Discovered by chance, an atypical place in the heart of Paris. Authentic, no fuss. If you're a fan of rigor and pseudo Parisian chic, don't worry, it's a real neighborhood bar.

name: Cozy Factory ( poke bowls & sandwich)
formatted_address: 36 Rue Saint-Andr√© des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
The pok√© was very fresh. I liked the portion size also. The staff was very friendly and patient. You can ask for the wifi code to save some data when visiting around paris. They also have a restroom too. Which is a nice addition for a small place. Nice place to rest when walking around paris.; Good poke restaurant, fresh products,  good service
Prices are correct: from 9.90 euros
Two sizes : L or XL
You can make your bowl as well choosing the size; Great food and good service! Not so nice to sit because it‚Äòs a small place; Lovely place to eat! Great service, friendly staff, so willing to help us even though we don't speak French very well. The food was delicious, very fresh and a lot of choice. Also the name fits well: cozy and pretty interior. Would definitely visit again!; Very cozy place with nice and fresh food
Recommended for a quick lunch

name: Caf√© Klin
reviews:
Highly recommend l!! A really nice caf√© with loads of veggie options. They also serve Natural wine and have a great selection of fresh juice and craft beer.
A must to try when you are around Republique area in Paris. 5 stars.; I am not vegan but I find the food in this little caf√© absolutely delicious. I had a taster meal (5 courses) and everything was fresh and tasty. Staff is very nice. You can even seat outside. I will come back; One of my best cafes for breakfast in the morning. An active atmosphere. And their service is good. And a special thanks to the restaurant manager. I will be back to visit again.; Cute interior, a bit dirty, the coffee was good. The selection of pastry was a bit small but it was ok.; An excellent cafe, super friendly staff. Highly recommended !

name: Caf√© Latin
formatted_address: 30 Rue Saint-Andr√© des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
The best meal in Paris! We had a fantastic dinner at Cafe Latin on a busy Saturday evening but were seated right away. Our waiter was super friendly, knowledgeable, and clearly passionate about the food.
The duck confit and veal kidney were the best dishes we‚Äôve had in France, ever! The waiter also recommended a lovely wine that paired perfectly with our meal. I really can't recommend this place enough. If you find yourself in Paris, go to Cafe Latin - you won't regret it!; We LOVED this place. Happened to stumble in and had an amazing experience. The cook is a former Michelin chef that opened his own place. The cheeseburger was to die for and the kidneys were exceptional if you're looking to go authentic. Waitstaff and owner were so friendly and made sure our meal was perfect! Highly recommend!; I had the steak tartare, one of the best one ai had. One of the owner is serving and is very friendly and you can see that he is passionate about his bistro. Check it out, worth the detour!; We enjoyed a very nice meal at this restaurant. It was a busy night but we were seated promptly. The food was well presented and very tasty. The service was professional and friendly. There was a lovely atmosphere and at all times we were treated as welcome guests.; 14‚Ç¨ for 3 slices of cheese and some random salad. Really? What a rip off. They weren‚Äôt good either.

name: Little Babel
reviews:
Visited twice while I was in Paris.

Service is some of the best I received while in Paris. Very welcoming and friendly. Great atmosphere and decor. And most importantly a lot of effort and love goes into their food.
Would recommend!; The food was absolutely delicious and we can confidently call it one of the best pizzas we‚Äôve ever eaten. The service was supreme and the atmosphere was cozy. We 100 percent recommend this place and would come back every time!!
merci beaucoup; Absolutely the best pizza we have ever eaten!  We are from Connecticut which is viewed as having the best pizza in the USA and this totally tops it!  Perfectly delicious!; Nestled in the heart of Paris, Little Babel Pizza is a culinary treasure. This quaint establishment, though small in size, delivers a gastronomic experience that is both delightful and memorable. Their pizza, crafted with a perfect blend of flavors and cooked to crispy perfection, stands out as a must-try for any food lover. But the delights don‚Äôt end there ‚Äì their pasta and spaghetti dishes are equally commendable, each plate offering a taste of authentic Italian cuisine.

What makes Little Babel Pizza truly special is the worthiness of the wait. Each dish is prepared with care, ensuring that every bite is a testament to their dedication to quality and taste. To top off the dining experience, their coffee is exceptional ‚Äì rich in flavor and the perfect endnote to a satisfying meal. Little Babel Pizza is more than just a restaurant; it‚Äôs an experience that encapsulates the essence of Parisian charm and culinary excellence.; AWESOME PIZZA!!! This is most likely the best pizza in Paris! We have been all over Italy and this is right up there with the best pizza in Italy. In a quiet cozy part of the city. The owners are super nice and fun! Its a must go to!

name: Le Petit Caf√©
reviews: You know that reputation the Parisians earned among Americans in the 1960's as being rude and having bad service? NOT TRUE ANYMORE, but if you feel like you missed out on your opportunity to experience the rudeness, come to Le Petit Caf√© (perhaps better named Le Petit Service) to get ignored! Otherwise, the food's great, if it ever arrives! ...and it's just steps from the Pantheon. Don't go there hungry!; Great staff here in this lovely surprise restaurant. We had the onion soup, and fish and chips. Both were spot on - the soup was loaded with cheese, steamy hot but not scalding. The fish were nicely battered and cooked properly so not greasy or oily. For once here in Paris, the chips (fries) were still hot. The staff seem run off their feet with the college crowd but they remained friendly and attentive. Overall, this was a nice dinning experience. The younger crowd can get loud and exuberant, so if you want a quiet dinner out, this might not be for you. For us, the staff and the food made up for any noise factor concerns.; We stopped in here for lunch. We ate the salmon salad, onion soup, and had some champagne.; Good food, the fries were especially good, fast service and the staff is accommodating to English speakers; My favorite place for a coffee in Paris! I visited a few times during my trip. Their coffee was very good. I tried their cafe frappe and it was great on a hot day. The hot latte was also great. Their mojitos are also nice, they have a happy hour! I also tried their burger, it was very good and a big portion. The atmosphere is amazing, the outside seating area is lovely, very quiet, no noise from the street. The staff was nice and friendly.

name: Dame Tartine
reviews:
We came across this place totally by chance but what a find. People are incredibly nice, welcoming. The food, homemade, is really good and the meat was excellent. Although area is very touristic, it is the exception and it feels like a local restaurant. Every time we went, most customers were french people which is a great sign. The terrasse experience is really nice; The food was great. I had the veal steak with mashed potatoes and it was awesome. Kids had the beef steak and loved it. Honestly can‚Äôt remember my wife dish name but looked great!
The staff were super friendly and spoke fluent English.; I ordered a beef steak and was surprised when they brought a medium rare. By default in every restaurant I've ever been it's medium.

Medium rare is still smth that I eat but it was unevenly fried and a half of the steak was completely raw. Although I was very hungry raw is not what I can eat.

The waitress didn't even bother to ask why I didn't finish my steak. Overall she looked tired, unhappy and at the same time busy - she was the only one to serve all the tables. It wasn't a peak hour and only about third of the tables is not less were occupied.; Great place with great food. I had the sea bass and a huge portion of profiteroles for dessert. So good.
The place is heaving with people in the evening, it‚Äôs got a very youthful vibe and I like that.
Great selection of drinks too.; Awful service, the guy was rude to customers and slammed our glasses when serving them to us.
Not to mention when my friend asked for the bill he loudly said that he should go inside to pay while shaking his head.
Do not recommend unless you‚Äôre a big fan of cheese and rude people.

name: Le kiosque "M√©nagerie" jardin des plantes
reviews:
During my visit to the food kiosk, I was pleasantly surprised by some aspects that I think are worth highlighting despite the negative reviews I had read before.

First of all, the variety of the menu is impressive. There is a wide choice of dishes, which allows you to satisfy different desires and tastes. I particularly enjoyed the toasted chicken sandwich, which was well seasoned and cooked to perfection. The freshness of the ingredients was also notable.

The service was friendly and welcoming. Although the booth was quite busy, the staff was professional and courteous. My meal was served in a timely manner, and I appreciated the team's efforts to ensure customers were satisfied.; Very pleasant setting. The kiosk is well placed, and I ate very well. Contrary to what I read in the comments, for my part everything went very well. The waiter who took my order was kind and smiling throughout our exchange. I was served quickly and in a polite manner. I recommend this kiosk.; Very very slow because it is disorganized, the service is shared between the menagerie and the rest of the park. the ‚Äúfresh daily‚Äù bagel bore the date of the day before and was dry and very lightly filled. In short, don't waste your time, go get a salad at the nearby supermarket, it will be better and cheaper.; Opinions are not taken into account but, it is not clean, very long and the only waiter works without health protection...And as a bonus, at 12:45 p.m. there are no more sandwiches...0; To flee. Waffles not made at home, very very expensive, that's why the terrace is empty, the sun is beating down but the young lady closes the parasols under the authority of her manager.
Going to a nearby Monoprix is ‚Äã‚Äãbetter.

name: Wonderland brunchy Notre Dame/ Restaurant Brunch
reviews:
Super good food ! Yummy and looks so pretty. We were well received and served with a smile (so important in Paris right ? üòá)
It‚Äôs a little more expensive than we thought but you get what you pay for. Around 18‚Ç¨ for a main. We shared pancakes after so it came out to about 28‚Ç¨ pp for a drink a main and a shared dessert.
Toilets clean, coffee is pretty good, I got a very original drawing on line which made me very happy !; Absolutely amazing brunch spot! We went here every day during our trip in Paris because it was so good. The staff was so kind and friendly to us, especially the server (wish we had asked her name). Highly recommend the eggs Benedict, purple pancakes, and purple french toast. If you want to avoid waiting, go on weekdays or get there when they open on weekends. We loved it!; Best impressions! Food is always delicious, my favorite place for brunch dishes in Paris! Located in the great spot as well! The service is very kind and friendly. Thank you for your always welcoming attitude and honesty.; Food was excellent! Everything that we tried was tasty. Portions were big. Staff was friendly and helpful. But it was 26 degrees outside, you can sit only inside and it was too hot.
All in all it was a very pleasant experience! Thank you!; Me and my friend had the purple french toast, which was amazing!! She already had it before and had to come back to get it.

Also the staff were so lovely and gave us great tips for Paris as a first-timer ü§ç

name: EatDay
reviews:
We decided to visit this restaurant based on the good reviews it had on the Fork. We were craving japanese food and noticed they had some special plates. It was really tasty and fresh and very well presented. Our favourite was the gold rolls with mango and the Sushi with cheese and the salad with shrimps.; When I got to this restaurant, it‚Äôs warm ,and food is delicious, must try the sushi ,that‚Äôs yummy; Service was horrible the entire night. We waited over an hour for our food and by the time we got it the entire restaurant was empty. The staff would yell at each other and ignore me. The food was decent, not amazing. Thankfully it was 40% off through The Fork. I‚Äôm definitely not going back and would advise others to avoid.; Really great discovery! You have a great amount of choice in terms of sushis and we were really surprised how tasty it was. You order your food with a tablet which makes it easier. The personnel was also nice. I really recommend to try this place!; Excellent Japanese restaurant at the heart of Paris not far From the center (Chatelet).
The food is very good, the sushi, the sashimi, the California rolls‚Ä¶ etc
Fresh ingredients and homemade!
Outstanding service and lovely staff!
I highly recommend this place

name: Caf√© Restaurant L‚ÄôArrosoir
reviews: Quite big portion for regular Asian. For me the dish is better with a bit of salt and pepper. 1 salad and 1 steak should be fine for 2 person. They offer free drinking water.; Lovely place under the arches of the Promenade Plantee. Good value, very friendly service and lovely food. The fried goats cheese is amazing. And so is the cr√®me camarel!; Excellent place to sit on the patio and enjoy a fantastic meal. Started with croque-monsieur on brushetta followed by a salad Cesar and croque-monsieur, salad. All with a paname barge du canal IPA to wash it down.; Very pleasant staff. Good location. Nice vibe. Bad food. It was unfortunately most unpleasant. Avoid unless you're starving.; Very nice place to eat. Food here is very fresh and good quality. Very good selection deserts and wine. Definitely worth to step in and try.

name: Le bon moment caf√©
reviews: What a beautiful cafe! The staff is super friendly and kind. The latte was delicious, and so were my pancakes! They reminded me of American pancakes, which are not easy to find in Paris. I definitely recommend. I can‚Äôt wait to go back and try more things on the menu!; We ate here recently for breakfast. It's a really cute caf√© in a very quiet street. My friend and I ordered pancakes, I ordered also the a√ßai bowl. The food was absolutely delicious, and the only fault I had was that the pancakes are so small and unfortunately not filling at all. They were great though but definitely need at least 50% more. The staff are very nice and attentive. The plates were beautifully presented. The coffee is exceptional here, my new favourite caf√© for coffee. Highly recommend this place.; I recently tried the passion fruit iced tea at this caf√©, and it was fantastic. Refreshing and full of flavor, it was the perfect drink for a warm day. The caf√©'s setting by the Seine and next to Notre-Dame makes it even more enjoyable. The beautiful surroundings add to the relaxing atmosphere. Highly recommend giving it a try!; One of the first places I visit when I arrive to my first visit to Paris. I needed to work something in my computer and it was great the atmosphere, very wholesome. It has an area for kids to read. The owners were so nice and welcoming. The coffee and the chocolate chip cookies were great (I am a fan of üç™). If I ever go back I will like to visit once again. I wish the best to this caf√©.; Really cute & lovely coffee shop! Loved the staff there, really nice! In terms of food, we took a carrot cake, a black sesame latte & mango&pineapple smoothie. Everything was really good! I would love to come back and try the other things there. In terms of space, there are not a lot of tables so it can be easily packed, not suitable for big groups. I would recommend coming there! ++ for the lovely menu which was probably handmade and then printed.

name: Cr√™perie Little Breizh
formatted_address: 11 Rue Gr√©goire de Tours, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
Maybe I was eating too fast but I got really full halfway through my first crepe. But I had already pre-ordered the dessert so I definitely overdid it with two crepes. The servers were very nice.; I personally loved this cozy little place. We randomly checked the map and saw its rating so gave it a try, that happened in June 2024 btw. We tried one savory and one sweet crepe and enjoyed both. It was super crowded so service was a little slow but people were quite nice and I felt that they tried their best.; We had ordered one savoury and one sweet crepes.  All is a delicious food.  The service is nice and friendly, but not many types of coffee to select; We had a delicious and delightful meal here - managed to sit down just before the dinner time rush, but the service was friendly and efficient at all times. We had two savoury and one dessert crepes - all were excellent! Compliments to the chef, would love to come back.; We came here on a Saturday afternoon. It wasn't full when we arrived but after we sat down the place started to fill up with people. We ordered the crepe with ham, cheese and egg and the crepe little Breizh crepe as well as a cider. You can't have crepes without cider in France.
The savoury ham, cheese and egg crepe was really crispy and savoury. I preferred the sweet crepe with ice cream and caramel more. It wasn't overly sweet. Everything went really well with the cider.
The service here is VERY nice. A lot of regulars come here and you can see the love and care that the owner has put into maintaining her relationships. Would recommend for crepes.

name: DICE Caff√®
vicinity: 11 Rue du Pas de la Mule, Paris
formatted_address: 11 Rue du Pas de la Mule, 75004 Paris, France
reviews:
This place is a hidden gem next to more well known restaurants. We were lucky enough to walk in, unlike most other spots in the area. The service is amazing and the food is incredible. It‚Äôs a small menu, but it‚Äôs perfect for a date night. The ambiance is superb. I would totally recommend this place to everyone, but we don‚Äôt want it to get overrun like everything else in this neighborhood. Go here before it gets too famous.; It was really nice lunch with two of my friends. Healthy and light, and I loved that there are selected menu for a few days. I have issues with choosing the menu, but there were not too many options, so it was easier. I had the haddock fish with aubergine caviar, and it was really tasty and good portion than it seemed. The place was cute and the staff was nice. I'd like to come back :); Had a great customer experience. Simple, tasteful menu. Good food, wine selection and friendly atmosphere. I'll be back!; 4,9/5
EXCELLENT ! EXCELLENT ! EXCELLENT !
Wandering the streets looking for a nice address, we found this cozy joint next to place des Vosges, with a sunday brunch menu !
Very nice and not-cramped restaurant, few tables with spacious seating, wood decor, simple and heartwarming !
The owner (Diego) is a super friendly Italian from Parma, he handles the bar, his wife is the kitchen boss (super friendly as well, graced me with the honour of best client of the week ;)
We tried the 3 brunch main courses, and they were all 3 DELICIOUS !
Eggs with salmon, potato galette with cream cheese.
My favourite was the bun with mozzarella and coppa di parma ; incredibly tasty
and the 3rd and most original was pupkin pancakes with cheese, topped with beets and salad !
Simple, tasty, and copious !
Their juices were really good too ; I tried the refreshing apple, cucumber, lemon shake !
A must try address, e !ven if to grab a simple coffee.; A lovely place. We stumbled upon it for lunch and for 23 EUR had a 3 course menu with generous portions. The food is delicious and the staff lovely. The place is also nicely decorated and definitely worth a visit :)

name: Crepolog
reviews:
Hi Crepolog!
Nice galettes. Very fast service. The ingredients were fresh, I was surprised by the oregano (great touch on the recipe in my opinion). Maybe one note would be the butter amount, which as we all know can never be enough!
Okay, another note for possible improvement: the menu. The font isn‚Äôt really readable, in my view at least :)
Plus points for the sitting, spacious and not crammed (üëç) and the location‚Äîconvenient!
I would like to leave 5 stars to award the work and encourage the future improvements. I would like to come by Crepolog again for a galette in the future again to update my review :); Some of the best food we had in Paris! The staff was very attentive and the crepes and galletes were delicious!; Not bad, exactly how I expected them to taste like; Cr√™pes are the focus of this place and they‚Äôre very good. I tried two sweet ones ‚Äì the traditional lemon, and the dark chocolate. Both were very good. I‚Äôm going to go back and try the savory ones. Also, the men there were very welcoming. It was a nice experience on a rainy day in Paris!; This lovely owner owned restaurant allows you to create your own galettes and crepes from a list of ingredients. The waiters are super helpful. We tried different galettes and dessert crepes all were excellent! The prices are reasonable.

name: Little Parmentier
reviews:
I had the fish and chips and my wife had the Carnard.  Food was delicious but I am going to echo what others have said, the owner is super friendly, warm and welcoming.  I would gladly come back based on that alone.  Highly recommended for both food and atmosphere.; Am not sure I went to the right Little Parmentier if all the reviews are true!
The steak was rubbery, the salad was manky and the small glass of red was ‚Ç¨7. A real tourist trap! I shouldn't have entered when I saw the place completely empty!
Serves me right for placing my trust in these reviews!; Our first dinner experience in Paris and it was wonderful. The gentleman that was front of house was so nice and helpful. Food itself was also wonderful, cook on the beef was absolutely perfect.; The food is  very good and familiar.
The boss is nice and friendly and the ambiance is calm and relaxed...
The prices are moderate and we can choose some good artisanal beers. We feel at home!; One of the best restaurants in Paris

name: Sacr√© Frenchy !
reviews:
Food was excellent, very tasty dishes. The chicken was amazing, and worth sharing. The happy hour on cocktails was a good deal as well, and delicious cocktails.

Service was not great for our visit, cocktail forgotten, and a 45 minute wait for the main dish after starters. We noticed several other tables having quite some issues with service as well around us. It was not busy or full at the time. A great dining experience turned poor by long waits and off service.

That said, not so bad I wouldn‚Äôt try again, it could be an off day, but the food was great, and service was friendly despite the waits and inattentiveness.; This place was absolutely wonderful! Our waitress, Amelie, was incredibly kind and attentive, making our experience truly exceptional. The food was fantastic, and the cocktails were equally impressive.; I don‚Äôt normally leave a review, but I felt compelled. We had eight people and they accommodated us at the last minute. Our servers name was Emily and she was absolutely phenomenal from picking wine to suggesting entr√©es. The food came on time and it was fantastic. What a great dining Atmosphere experience. if you‚Äôre in this area, don‚Äôt look any further.; Very kid and tourist friendly. The staff were so sweet, and the food was wonderful. I highly recommend their seafood ceviche. Dessert was to die for too. Their cr√®me br√ªl√©e was the table‚Äôs favorite.; My wife and I had our first dinner in this last visit to Paris. My wife is not a ‚Äúlamb food fan‚Äù, and had a steak, while I ordered the ‚Äú7 hour lamb dish‚Äù.
The food was great, cooked to order, and very tasty. Service was great too. With that said, I would like to emphasize the ‚Äú7 hour lamb‚Äù dish that was probably the best lamb dish I had so far. It was adobe style, super duper tasty. It was so good my wife ate more of it than her steak. Since we came for only 3 days to Paris and did not want to go to the same place twice, we went to explore other places in the following g evening. We regret not coming back to have this lamb again. Other dinners were fine too, but this was the most remembered from this trip. Served with spinach warm side dish and (what I believe was) mashed cilantro root. It is a MUST HAVE dish!

name: Breakfast in America - Latin Quarter
reviews:
Woah! I have never seen any Paris restaurant have so many American TV Show or Movie. I can tell what is their favorite show or movie. The sign on board was written in English which I was very surprise to see that. I mean I speak English.

The staff was great and friendly personality. The waitress was very good looking and beautiful.
She did a good job service the food and drink.
I enjoy eating American food again. I love burrito, homemade fries, and Hot chocolate.

Im glad they got a bathroom, but the sink was in a different area and right next to bathroom.; We loved their food! Their California French toast was amazing. Very nice staff, great service. Huge bonus‚Äîtheir tap water is ice cold and is divine (we have not found this anywhere else in Paris); Highly recommend ! I love this place. The food is excellent and the staff is awesome ! If you are looking for scrambled eggs , real bacon and sausage üòÅ , toast , fresh squeezed OJ , pancakes and French toast this is the place to visit. Love the Chicago Bears helmet sitting on the shelf. Shout out to Chef Jared Pierre from the "Chi".; Great experience and food at this diner.  Service was a dream and the food was excellent!  Would highly recommend to anyone in Paris.; We went on Sunday Brunch, which is very popular, and there was a long wait. That was expected and normal. Once inside the service was very slow. The food was ok. Not great not bad, just ok. The waiter forgot part of our order and we had to wait almost 40 minutes for them to bring it. They had to remind the kitchen about it. It is a very generous 3 stars because the food took way too long for being just ok, but the staff was very friendly. There are way better spots to eat while in Paris.

name: L'Atelier de LiLi
reviews: The place is small and charming with very good food if you need something for a fast snack‚Ä¶ their concept is cute, like you are entering someone‚Äôs kitchen. A home made Mango juice was super, I like a lot their muffins, so far the best one I‚Äôve tried in Paris‚Ä¶other things we ordered were good as well.; Amazing macarons and coffee. The owners are so friendly, would love to come back next time I'm in town!; Great value, warm welcome as you are part of the family, comes much recommended !!!! Well done guys, see you soon !; The sweetest owners! You can tell the food is made with love üíúü•∞; Short story: despite a good dish the owner tried to steal money from us. She will be very kind to clients she likes probably but she decided to snap at us constantly for no reason. / Long story: The woman who runs this place scams people. All the bad reviews you see are people who have been scammed and who have been scolded at for no reason. She tried to steal 10 euros from us for the mess we left because we were eating with a 1 year old and 3 year old and they spilled crumbs (maybe don‚Äôt run a restaurant if you can‚Äôt handle it?). We were 3 adults sharing 2 expensive meals and an overpriced muffin and two coffees and she charged us 52 euros with an imaginary extra 10 euros for a ‚Äúcocktail‚Äù. We returned to get refunded and she even tried to justify it because of the crumbs. She said ‚ÄúI added 10 euros because of the mess you left‚Äù ‚Äî acknowledging this theft. Imagine you were charged 10 euros extra everywhere you ate because you or your kids left crumbs on the floor? Completely absurd. She chooses to run the place this way scamming those she doesn‚Äôt like. She was super nice to the table next to us and actually telling them she didn‚Äôt like our table‚Ä¶ ?! We even apologised and mentioned the food was good and she said she didn‚Äôt appreciate our ‚Äúpicnic‚Äù (because we shared ‚Ä¶.) and that the crumbs were not ‚Äúserious‚Äù ‚Äî I think some people should change careers if they can‚Äôt handle the most mundane happenings of a restaurant, and be the opposite of kind. Especially if you‚Äôre the owner.

name: Brunch Paris
reviews: Correct, lots of choice, good products and unlimited üòâto do for Brunch lovers; Several incredible addressesü•∞;

name: Le Petit Plateau
reviews:
Great service, great staff, great view, great food!
It‚Äôs a Bingo for French food lovers with a twist!
I HIGHLY recommend the duck Shepherd pie üòã
They have a good selection of wine as well!; Wonderful little restaurant on the small Seine island, located just a few steps away from the Notre Dame cathedral and the Pont Neuf bridge. We had a wonderful evening, with the cook being away and the owner preparing great tasting ravioli for us. We loved the atmosphere. Thanks for having us!; Food was delicious, service from Vincent was amazing. He even played a Brazilian song for me and my wife. I highly recommend this place! 5 stars, for sure!; The food is very delicious. You wont regret it to try it when you come to Paris. Definitely I will be back to this cafe again in our next visit; The cutest little cafe ever! The food was delicious and we really enjoyed the lunch combo. Great place for lunch if you‚Äôre by the Notre dame area. Must try the mushroom soup!!

name: Les Enfants Rouges
reviews:
This is a cozy little, very compact restaurant in a busy little street of Paris. The food (in my opinion) is good but did not blow my mind nor did I have a gastronomical experience. Its just one of those places that gets popular I guess. The restaurant is really compact and space is scarce to move around. The service is very good, attentive, helpful and prompt. The five stars are for the great service really and not so much for the food - I have had better. Reservations are required in advance as it gets busy. It seems overpriced to me.; Our second time in Les Enfants Rouges was interesting. Definitely reserve your table in advance, the place is packed. Cozy atmosphere. Staff is super nice. Best dish-desert. Both Pavlova and Cheese cake were superb. Lamb chops were delicious. Neither of the entries deserve a mention, thus 4 stars.; Definitely a 5-star and particularly at the reasonable price. Dishes from Les Enfants Rouge and chef-patron Da√Ø Shinozuka. He takes classic French ingredients and adds Japanese flair. Each dish worked well with balanced, nuanced flavours that excited the palate. The rum baba is the best in the world. With one bottle of wine, the cost was just under ‚Ç¨100 a head.
The first time we came was about ten years ago. Standards have not dropped and its popularity is understandable - so book in advance. Five stars! (And the service was good too.); A must stop by place if you‚Äôre in Paris. Modern French cuisine, with a Japanese twist. Everything was absolutely delicious, and the dishes were art pieces. Very friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. Reservation recommended! Great selection of drinks including Japanese cocktails and sake üëå; Blown away by the quality of the lunch course, especially compared to the price. This place at least deserves a bib gourmand imho. The grapefruit lychee dessert was such an ideal assembly of tart, crisp, and sweet - and the textures! All very interesting flavour combinations from both Japanese and French influences. Highly recommended!

name: Breakfast in America - Marais
reviews:
I found this place while looking for a good Full English Breakfast in Paris. Spoiler alert: instead of finding an English breakfast, I found an American one.

The products don't exactly match the UK ones 100%, but I shouldn't have expected that anyway. The food was good and full of calories ‚Äî as it should be! ;) The burger and desserts were also nice, and the restaurant has a great American vibe. If that's what you like, you should definitely visit.; Potatoes were crispy, eggs scrambled perfectly, the banana french toast was delicioussss. Much needed breakfast satisfaction.; We went to a small, charming breakfast place with our baby. The staff was polite, friendly, and helpful. However, the prices were a bit high for some items. We had asked for coffee, and they brought it with milk. They also refilled the second cup for free. I think it was a nice gesture of good service to refill the coffee twice.; A small but very welcoming place to have American dinner.
A very fluke that our waiter forgot my milk for my coffee but totally understandable as the place was really busy and he was on his own I believe.
Overall our family would highly recommend this place if your looking for  English speaking breakfast and have a usual American breakfast; Good restaurant overall. Server was very nice and polite.
Quesadilla was a little overcooked and didn‚Äôt have much cheese.  Salad was very tasty and chicken bowl was good.

name: Coffee Club
reviews:
Came here for dinner since I wanted a ceasar salad. It was decent but a little pricy for what it offered. Also had a cocktail and that was good. There was a book event going on but I was just there for the food and there was no issues.; Nice little brunch place next to the Jardin du Luxembourg. There is a nice menu with diverse choices from burgers, to toasties, to classic American breakfasts. The taste is good but I didn‚Äôt feel it was anything crazy neither. Prices are alright and not too expensive neither which is nice.; The place is nice and the food is good. The staff is ok. It is overall a nice place, where you better take your time, and reasonably priced.

The French fries where really good.
Unfortunately, we had some half burnt pancakes and too cooked crispy chicken.

We were a party of 7 + a child, ate plentiful and paid around 280‚Ç¨.; I would rate this as a solid ‚Äúfine‚Äù. It‚Äôs a place that has potential, the atmosphere is good and the service is excellent.
But the food is really ‚Äúmid‚Äù,
It feels like they are charging as much as a normal portion but giving you kids portions. The food wasn‚Äôt even that good or that bad it‚Äôs just not really what you‚Äôre expecting with the menu, the prices and the American style.

I would stay away from the heuvis rancheros, the tortilla was impossible to cut through.; I don't get homesick as much as many American expats, but I have to admit this place rang some nice bells for me. High-quality American diner cooking, which I sometimes still crave.

Hamburgers without pretense, milkshakes that taste like real milkshakes, and much better fries than I'm accustomed to in Paris.

The service is very friendly, bordering on jovial.

All around, a solid spot.

name: Le Jardin des P√¢tes
reviews:
Well located by the jardin des plantes, this Italian restaurant serves creative fresh home made pastas dishes. üëå It's pretty tasty and good value for money. üòä; They run out of homemade pastas and have me corkscrew pastas. Without mentioning it.
The taste of the dish was innovative but not refined. Still I appreciate they're exploring.; A 3.5 to 4-star good local restaurant, with freshly made food. Unfortunately, the dishes were nothing to write home about. My veggie pasta was tasty but slightly overcooked & the sauce was a bit on the lighter side, and my friend's salmon barley pasta was ok but a bit too bland. Good thing is that the food came very fast. Slightly disappointing also is that, arriving at 7pm and leaving at 8.30pm the restaurant was still relatively empty (30-40% occupancy only).  That was a Wednesday evening. Is it a good or a bad sign?; I got salmon pasta, goat cheese, French cola and coffee. I paid 31 euros total. Prices are good, portions are large for Paris standards and food was delicious. First time I tried French cola and I like it. Pasta was fresh and good quality. Service is also really good. Employees know English.; The restaurant is cozy.
It is recommended to shares the dishes, as it allows you to try different types of homemade pasta at once, just like we did.
All of the three dishes were delightful and delicious.

name: Upper Caf√© Les Halles
reviews:
I was sitting with my friends and the waiter (a short, bald man)was extremely disrespectful. He told me to leave if I didn‚Äôt order something, even though my two friends were already drinking and consuming. I‚Äôve never encountered such poor service in my life. Very disappointed.; I am in a split mind about the place. The location is ideal, at the door of Les Halles,and the menu looked absolutely perfect, with real fish and chips, and special burgers.  However the food was not as good as it looked, and the one waiter, although very efficient,  was a bit loud and vulgar........; We ordered 2 salads and 2 cocktails, they were fresh and tasty!; The manager is so mean !! I will never come back again.
First, at 15 pm they stopped hot beverage.
Then when asking to put the tv sound for a CAN match, at first he doesn't even want to answer because as he said he didn't start working yet... and after he said that they put sound only for France and PSG matches üòè; The staff and overall service were OK, but fish and chips was mediocre with its not crunchy at all coating and unseasoned fish.

name: L'Arbre √† Cannelle
reviews:
It's all about the specials menu. Great food and people, highly recommend! FYI they have an English menu if you prefer. Take a walk/sit in the Jardin des Plantes and stop by for lunch. Excellent homemade desserts!; I visited this place recently with my boyfriend after a long, exhausted day, and it couldn't be more comfortable and extraordinary experience. The host was completely polite and kind and attentive. We just had an amazing experience here and totally recommend it to you! ü•∞
P.s. The food was delicious!!!; Came for lunch and was impressed. The food quality and flavor was absolutely outstanding. For a small cosy restaurant, I was blown away. The steak, I took bloody, was so delicious as well as the duck which was the meal of the day. The sauce and salad even though it wasn't the main star of the dish was just as delicious. Too bad I was running late and couldn't stay for dessert but I will return. Fantastic all round.; We came for breakfast and ordered the ‚Äúgrand d√©j,"  which includes pancakes, eggs, and a glass of orange juice (barely half a glass, in fact). Let‚Äôs just say that we weren't particularly impressed.; We visited the restaurant after the Natural History Museum. It is very local. All the workers are very friendly. We tried the onion soup and steak tartar. They were both amazing with a pair of caraf of their house wine. Prices are very reasonable. If you are around it is a nice place to stop by.

name: Les Ni√ßois
reviews:
We found this place randomly and it was a nice surprise
Great staff, good food and beer with a reasonable price
Definitely recommend; A mediocre food, combine but a worse service ever, a nasty woman, who refused t serve my table based on her mood. Menu  eclectic not original neither interesting, Overprice and not worth a penny, is a pity they waste such a good location; Quite unusual place, with a real p√©tanque playground and table soccer board game in the basement. The food is nice for lunch, and prices are reasonable. The waiters' kindness and waiting time are greatly varying. For 16 euros, you get a 2 course set (entry + main dish or main dish + desert), with quite good, nice and fresh food, well cooked and well presented. Soups are way too salty though. The interior design is based on French southern style, the city of Nice especially. The window-roof makes the place quite bright.; Good place for brunch but also tapas in the evening. Chill place, very friendly staff, tasty food. Highly recommended for a nice evening with friends (you can play the typical french "P√©tanque" downstairs) or for couples. Will definitely go again !; Small but rather cozy place. Service was good. Food was decent and a really good price for lunch set (according to Paris standards). I paid 16 euros for an appetizer and a main course. They also have a sand pit for petanque and a foosball table downstairs.

name: ESpot
reviews:
I recently visited LeSpot in Paris Rivoli, and it was an incredible experience! The atmosphere was vibrant and welcoming, making it the perfect place for gamers of all levels. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to assist with any questions or technical issues.
The variety of games available was impressive, catering to all tastes from classic arcade games to the latest releases. The equipment was top-notch, ensuring a smooth and enjoyable gaming session. I particularly enjoyed the multiplayer setups, which allowed for some fun and competitive gameplay with friends.
Overall, LeSpot is a fantastic destination for anyone looking to immerse themselves in the world of gaming. Whether you‚Äôre a casual player or a hardcore gamer, you‚Äôre sure to have a great time. Highly recommended!; Awesome spot! All the consoles and game choice selection you could want.
The PCs run incredibly smoothly, the connection is great. Everything is clean, properly taken care of, and the vibe and decor is next level!
K√©vin and the rest of the staff are super friendly and make the experience that much better.
Highly recommend!; BEST CYBERCAFE in Paris. Games run smoothly and no FPS drop. One downside is Espot Paris doesn‚Äôt have Faceit Anti-Cheat so CS2 players have to play on the Valve server (boring and less competitive). Hope you guys can install the Anti-cheat ‚ù§Ô∏è; My son and I have been visiting e-sport cafes all throughout Europe on our holiday, big and small, and had high expectations for the capital of France to set the standard.

First impressions, it looks like a really slick set up. Consoles with big screens greet you in a darkened fluro paradise. We wanted 5 hours each and were quoted a price higher than their day package. I had to point this out to have it adjusted. Hmmmm.

Place uses a login in system to a set of backend client of games with no modification or ability to add additional titles. Make sure you get the spelling of your gamertag correct otherwise you will have login issues, but you can use this to get into any PC which is nice.

The PC dungeon downstairs looks impressive until you look closer. Basic Logitech keyboards, some with num keypads some without, some with worn out keys, some with backlights not working, basic 5 button mice. It's fine though, you can move to your station of preference.

We then tried to shift the in game language for Dota 2 to english as we have done in every other place we have visited. Normally modifying your steam language will suffice, but this time it also needed to be also completed in game which requires a client restart. Staff tried to help, but were told this was not possible. Being able to set a game to your native language is a basic requirement in my opinion. Very frustrating.

Then the crashes. Oh my, the crashes. About every hour a hard crash occurred for both PCs, requiring login again to steam and game relaunch (photo attached). In a ranked game MOBA like Dota 2 this can be punishing. To have it happen so frequently speaks to backend problems.

To wrap up, staff were friendly but ultimately unhelpful. Setup and decor looks cool with decent machines but they are a little worn out.
Cost is very expensive for what you get, which in our case was a dismal experience. We've tried little back alley cafes to massive dedicated e-sport establishments, and unfortunately this one has been the worst so far.

Plenty of others to try in Paris, give this one a miss.; Friendly staff, good value, lots of games.

name: Les chouettes (Grand Duc)
reviews:
10/12/2024

The staff was super nice and the restaurant had a great feel and theme. The food was good but maybe not great though I think it might be a difference in the steak I grew up with vs here. Basically it's chewy and has been like this at multiple places. I'm betting that France has better laws on how cattle should be treated and better for cows may not equal more tender meat.

Anyway, I still loved the restaurant and would enjoy going back and trying other foods.; The brunch was quite enjoyable and priced at 35 euros. The food was delightful, and the ambiance was perfect. The restaurant wasn't overly crowded or noisy. We chose to sit outside, which was a lovely decision, making our Sunday very relaxing. However, the waiting time was a tad excessive. I'm not sure of the reason, but we waited for over 30 minutes for our food to arrive; Was all in all a pleasant except one of the dishes I was served gave me food poisoning and made me violently ill. I ordered sea bream carpaccio to start which did not taste fresh and scallop risotto for main which was pleasant. Around 20 minutes after the meal I become very unwell and was stuck in my bed for 2 days; Yes, the pictures look good but the food itself is horrible! I had so much high expectations for this place from the pictures I previously saw but ended up being disappointing. The food looks old and not fresh, tried the poulpe salad, not good, the octopus didn‚Äôt look fresh and the salad itself was not tasty. Next, the fish fillet with vegetables, the fish was ok but some vegetables went bad and had to spit it out as I didn‚Äôt want to end up with a food intoxication. To finish, the creme br√ªl√©e was ok but too much sugar on top or they didn‚Äôt take the time to burn it all and ended up with big pieces of raw sugar in the mouth. The staff was lovely and the space is really nice. It‚Äôs such a waste to serve such poor quality food in such a beautiful space. I would seriously invest in finding a better chef or whoever is responsible of the menu !; Went for my birthday as a surprise! And the Sunday brunch was absolutely amazing - the freshest seasonal vegetables, fish, the lemon cake - oh my! I also had some white wine - Chablis and tried their fois gras.
