However it is very pricey for the quality of the food!; This is a cosy place with a good selection of food. The cocktails are average. Do give it a try if you're in that area. Their menu option is the best.; Quieter local restaurant - food is fine and reliable. Ate here times in the past 4 months (May-September). French onion soup better than most on Montparnasse and staff work well as a team.
The BEST lemon cheesecake of my life, but it‚Äôs not always available.
It would be nicer if they would do something about the fact that the whole restaurant smells of cigarettes, given that the smoking veranda pulls all the smoke into the space.
Some days I didn‚Äôt come because I knew I wouldn‚Äôt be able to deal with the smoke that day.; The italian chef's specials are amazing, the sauce and the melted cheese were very tasty, I recommend, plus for the view ü§å

name: Coffee Club
reviews:
Came here for dinner since I wanted a ceasar salad. It was decent but a little pricy for what it offered. Also had a cocktail and that was good. There was a book event going on but I was just there for the food and there was no issues.; Nice little brunch place next to the Jardin du Luxembourg. There is a nice menu with diverse choices from burgers, to toasties, to classic American breakfasts. The taste is good but I didn‚Äôt feel it was anything crazy neither. Prices are alright and not too expensive neither which is nice.; The place is nice and the food is good. The staff is ok. It is overall a nice place, where you better take your time, and reasonably priced.

The French fries where really good.
Unfortunately, we had some half burnt pancakes and too cooked crispy chicken.

We were a party of 7 + a child, ate plentiful and paid around 280‚Ç¨.; I would rate this as a solid ‚Äúfine‚Äù. It‚Äôs a place that has potential, the atmosphere is good and the service is excellent.
But the food is really ‚Äúmid‚Äù,
It feels like they are charging as much as a normal portion but giving you kids portions. The food wasn‚Äôt even that good or that bad it‚Äôs just not really what you‚Äôre expecting with the menu, the prices and the American style.

I would stay away from the heuvis rancheros, the tortilla was impossible to cut through.; I don't get homesick as much as many American expats, but I have to admit this place rang some nice bells for me. High-quality American diner cooking, which I sometimes still crave.

Hamburgers without pretense, milkshakes that taste like real milkshakes, and much better fries than I'm accustomed to in Paris.

The service is very friendly, bordering on jovial.

All around, a solid spot.

name: Le Drop Caf√©
reviews: Wonderful staff. They encouraged us to try new drinks, helped us explore new flavors and practice our French in a friendly atmosphere. This bar is also in a great location for sightseeing. They have a ‚ÄúFrench toast‚Äù dessert that is excellent and goes great with a coffee or cocktail.; We stopped by after a long afternoon at the Mus√©e D‚ÄôOrsay. The staff were welcoming and spoke English. We had steak and it was tender and cooked perfectly. We also had the cr√®me br√ªle and it was heavenly. Highly recommend!; Very good location, amazing service by Max who gave us recommendations on what to eat and the linguine pasta was 10/10 and cr√®me br√ªl√©e was the best üëå; Lovely friendly staff, great food choice and reasonably priced.; Waited more than half an hour for our food (5 people's food) to arrive. The people who came later than us had their food earlier than us. The waiter or waitress didn't help to check the status of our food order before we asked one of them to check when our food will be done. Service was not great. The basket of bread only came when our food came.

name: Chez Nicos
reviews:
The staff was really nice, helped us with our order because we didn‚Äôt understand French.
The salt crepe was really really delicious! We‚Äôre used to sweet crepes, but the combination with the salty fillings was perfect. We were really full after üòÖ the crepe was very big and well served!
I really wanted the sweet crepe for dessert, but I couldn‚Äôt get anything after üòÇ
Highly recommend this place! It wasn‚Äôt expensive at all!

Edit: we came Back twice after this review and it exceeded our already high expectations. The nutella and banana crepe is to die for! ü§§; Made-on-demand crepe with lots of options for fillings. We went savory this time with ham and cheese, they were super generous with the filling. Thing with it having tomatoes though is the bottom gets a bit soggy. Nonetheless a very enjoyable and filling midnight snack.; Great crepe, I tried banana and nutella crepe. Really yummy üòã
Then I went ahead and had one more, dark chocolate with coconut. Equally good. I also had a coffee shot to have a good combination of sweet and bitter.; This is the most surprisingly tasty and filling meal. I went twice in one day because it was so good! Best food!! Wish I could go back it was that great. The chef crepe was my favorite. The Nutella banana was also great; We came to Paris for 6 days and we came to Nicos on our second day here. We came back today because the first time was that good (and we might be coming back tomorrow for lunch as well üòÇ). This time was even better. Freshly made salted crepes‚Ä¶ even more delicious than the first time. Very well served, we get out of here with our tummies full and happy.
The staff is very kind and thoughtful.
We will make sure to come back here next time we‚Äôre in Paris.

10/10!! Highly recommend.

name: Upper Caf√© Les Halles
reviews:
I was sitting with my friends and the waiter (a short, bald man)was extremely disrespectful. He told me to leave if I didn‚Äôt order something, even though my two friends were already drinking and consuming. I‚Äôve never encountered such poor service in my life. Very disappointed.; I am in a split mind about the place. The location is ideal, at the door of Les Halles,and the menu looked absolutely perfect, with real fish and chips, and special burgers.  However the food was not as good as it looked, and the one waiter, although very efficient,  was a bit loud and vulgar........; We ordered 2 salads and 2 cocktails, they were fresh and tasty!; The manager is so mean !! I will never come back again.
First, at 15 pm they stopped hot beverage.
Then when asking to put the tv sound for a CAN match, at first he doesn't even want to answer because as he said he didn't start working yet... and after he said that they put sound only for France and PSG matches üòè; The staff and overall service were OK, but fish and chips was mediocre with its not crunchy at all coating and unseasoned fish.

name: Le Petit Plateau
reviews:
Great service, great staff, great view, great food!
It‚Äôs a Bingo for French food lovers with a twist!
I HIGHLY recommend the duck Shepherd pie üòã
They have a good selection of wine as well!; Wonderful little restaurant on the small Seine island, located just a few steps away from the Notre Dame cathedral and the Pont Neuf bridge. We had a wonderful evening, with the cook being away and the owner preparing great tasting ravioli for us. We loved the atmosphere. Thanks for having us!; Food was delicious, service from Vincent was amazing. He even played a Brazilian song for me and my wife. I highly recommend this place! 5 stars, for sure!; The food is very delicious. You wont regret it to try it when you come to Paris. Definitely I will be back to this cafe again in our next visit; The cutest little cafe ever! The food was delicious and we really enjoyed the lunch combo. Great place for lunch if you‚Äôre by the Notre dame area. Must try the mushroom soup!!

name: Les P√©pites, maison d'artisans - Restaurant Paris 15
reviews:
Les P√©pites, Maison d'Artisans is a fantastic spot for a satisfying lunch. I visited during lunchtime and was immediately greeted by the friendly owner and waiter, who made me feel welcome. The atmosphere was relaxed and inviting, perfect for a midday break.

For lunch, I enjoyed a Grilled Cheese Pastrami, an omelette, and a tartlette for dessert. The Grilled Cheese Pastrami was delicious, with the perfect combination of melted cheese and flavorful pastrami. The omelette was light and fluffy, just right for a lunchtime dish. The tartlette was a delightful way to finish the meal, with its balanced sweetness and fresh ingredients.

I reserved my table through TheFork and received a 20% discount, which was a great bonus. Overall, Les P√©pites offers excellent food and warm service, making it an ideal choice for lunch in Paris. Highly recommended!; Amazing brunch! One of my favorite restaurants in Paris. Amazing quality, good food and they are really friendly. 100% recommended; Really beautiful rooms to hire, expat friendly. Very warm welcome and excellent food and drinks. There's always something exciting going on here so you have to keep an eye out not to miss anything. Parking is really good here too.; Very kind staff and also good foods.
It seems that they are selling the eco-friendly products.
The taste of pasta isn‚Äôt strong, rather a little bit weak but I like that.; Amazing Brunch !!! (Check my insta food account @_takeyourseat_ ) üíó

name: Cr√™pe Station
reviews:
**Hole-in-the-wall**

Place is very small so order for take out!!

Food was Delicious!! They have both savory and sweet crepes along with hotdogs and paninis!

I ordered the
-Bombay Crepe (savory) - non spicy, eggs, chicken, sauteed bell peppers, cheddar cheese
-and the build your own Bubble Waffle with Nutella, crunch and banana 10/10!!
That was for both me and my fiance and we are satisfied!! It only took like 5 mins for them to make and bring out! I will definitely come again before my trip ends!

They have English speaking crew but definitely learn some french!

10/23/24
Opens at 11am
No bathrooms
Small sitting area (order for take out)
No parking enjoy the walk
Literal hole in the wall; We went to this place to get some dinner for evening. Sadly the waffles were not available, but they had other options that did not disappoint. We ordered a hotdog and some crepes to go. The wait was less than 10 minutes for the food to get prepared. It was presented in some nice paper containers and a bag to carry the food back to the hotel. I appreciate when businesses use environmental friendly materials like paper and not styrofoam.

The crepes were delicious and the hotdog was a hit for my son. I would definitely eat here again when I‚Äôm in Paris again.; Roaming the streets of Paris, exhausted us.
Finally found this little place in the crowded lanes of Paris.
The guy was amazingly friendly. Humble and patiently explained all the items
We ordered XL Tachos and Crepe.
Frankly it was just average food. Nothing special.
It just did the job.; Really nice Crepe! I chose the Kentucky one! Good price for a really tasty crepe! Also, I took the milkshake and it was one of the greatest I have drunk! The employee was very kind! I would recommend it to everyone!; Tiny but cozy crepe place! We went twice already, once for dinner and another time for dessert. You can choose your own toppings. Service is quick and polite. The crepes itself are fresh and crispy. Loved every bite! We plan to go again for another dessert crepe üòÅ

name: Bambini Paris
vicinity: Palais De Tokyo, 13 Avenue du Pr√©sident Wilson, Paris
formatted_address: Palais De Tokyo, 13 Av. du Pr√©sident Wilson, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
We saw mixed reviews, but after our visit, we really don‚Äôt understand why. The staff were all SUPER friendly. The food was absolutely delicious. However, the main course arrived extremely fast‚Äîwithin just 10 minutes. That was a bit of a shame, as it made the overall experience feel a bit rushed. But aside from that, everything was great. The location is excellent, and the atmosphere is very cozy.

We will definitely be back! Can't wait üòä; The sea brass was so good and the rigatoni pasta as well. We had the truffle pizza I just wish it was more cheese than sauce ratio but it was over wall great. The server was so kind I forgot his name but would definitely recommend it. Beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower. Cute aesthetic to take picture as well. Perfect ambiance, enough spaces between seats. Private, romantic, friendly ‚ù§Ô∏è; This place always hits! The atmosphere is great the service is great, the staff is amazing, I the food is delicious.
I went on a rainy day, and the hostess took our jacket and umbrellas and took us to our seats. It‚Äôs just a pleasant experience.; The food is excellent, and the ambiance is perfect. However, the service at the table leaves much to be desired. While the staff is friendly, they seem to be responsible for too many tables, making the experience feel rushed and chaotic, almost like a canteen. As a result, key details are missed, like serving wine with dinner, and it takes far too long to get their attention. Even when you do, it feels like they don‚Äôt have the time to properly listen to your request.‚Äù; Such an experience having dinner in Bambini. The vibes were superb. The staff were amazing and the food was second to none ü§© even the drinks are crafted with excellence. We will 100% be back on our next trip to Paris

We were 30 minutes late (Paris trafficü•≤) and the staff still accommodated us as we rang ahead. Thank you so much for that üôèüèª

name: Sadelle's at Kith Paris
reviews:
Come here for the vibes and it will deliver.

However, the value you get for the amount spent ie bang for your buck, isn‚Äôt satisfactory.

French toast was basic, borderline bland. Decent texture but flavor wasn‚Äôt heightened. Appreciate the swiftness of orders though as I asked the staff for a quick bite as I was in between meetings.

Staff needs to be trained more to be honest. The eagerness is there so they have the right mindset but I couldn‚Äôt tell there was a leader or master orchestrator of operations ergo affecting efficiency in timing and delivery of orders.; It‚Äôs a beautiful small place with charming interior. However, service isn‚Äôt organized enough. They served people who came after us before they served us and they took forever for any request even a glass of water!! Also the staff aren‚Äôt welcoming at all. When it comes to the food, it wasn‚Äôt tasty nor fresh. The french toast was like soaked in oil since the last night or reheated. It was hard and dry from inside. Omelette was ok not the best. Cappuccino was the only delicious order.
Also, it‚Äôs a small cafe so most of the tables are pretty closed to each others with no privacy, you‚Äôre like sitting with the next table and they‚Äôre sitting with you as well!!; Beautiful spot for breakfast/brunch. Reservations are not required though, to avoid waiting, it‚Äôs recommended to come right when they open.

Recommended dishes:
-Avocado Toast
- French Toast; Fun place to grab a bite to eat or drink!

This cafe is inside the Kith store making the location very cool. They offer many different breakfast and lunch options. The coffees come with the Kith name on top making it perfect for pictures.

The staff are very nice. You can also get ice cream from the ice cream shop inside.

I highly recommend checking this cafe out!; At first I thought the place is just for aesthetics but the food is actually quite good. French toast is amazing big enough for 2! The coffee is good too. The interior and atmosphere are amazing. Come early if you don‚Äôt want to wait. There will be a queue and we were waiting for an hour! Definitely will come back

name: Cafe Louise
reviews:
We came here for brunch on a Sunday. It‚Äôs ‚Ç¨38 per person, including a juice (freshly squeezed or detox juice), a coffee, a choice of either waffle or savory tart, and bottomless fruits and desserts from the buffet table. The warm and friendly staff made the already fantastic meal even better. Highly recommended.; Great place for Sunday brunch, had a good Parisian breakfast. Fresh juice, coffee as well.
Dessert was divine, came here with family. The service is slow but quite enjoyable.; We loved Louise! Such Parisian atmosphere and interior. Excellent service and amazing food. Right on the middle of the famous Boulevard Saint-Germain across the street from famous cafes. So lucky we found it!; Visited Caf√© Louise twice last weekend and we were very delighted.
The staff was super nice, professional and funny and the food was delicious. Highly recommended!!; Had a uniquely French lunch - "grilled cheese" and champagne, sitting outside, taking in the atmosphere, and watching the crowd walk (fast) by.

name: Terry's Caf√©
reviews:
I found this adorable cafe in my neighborhood when I visited Paris. The dishes are fresh and tasty. The steak was especially good. The staff were courteous with great service. Highly recommended!; It‚Äôs the kind of restaurants that offer 10 pages menu with many different types of cuisine, so, many of the food is frozen food and not homemade.
The snails are almost tasteless, no butter neither sauce.
The hamburger XXL was okay, but not worth the 28‚Ç¨! The cr√®me br√ªl√©e was not br√ªl√©e and soggy. The tiramisu is good tho.
The service is very good, and the staff so nice.
However it is very pricey for the quality of the food!; This is a cosy place with a good selection of food. The cocktails are average. Do give it a try if you're in that area. Their menu option is the best.; Quieter local restaurant - food is fine and reliable. Ate here times in the past 4 months (May-September). French onion soup better than most on Montparnasse and staff work well as a team.
The BEST lemon cheesecake of my life, but it‚Äôs not always available.
It would be nicer if they would do something about the fact that the whole restaurant smells of cigarettes, given that the smoking veranda pulls all the smoke into the space.
Some days I didn‚Äôt come because I knew I wouldn‚Äôt be able to deal with the smoke that day.; The italian chef's specials are amazing, the sauce and the melted cheese were very tasty, I recommend, plus for the view ü§å

name: Le Corner
reviews:
this place was absolutely amazing. i found it online and decided to give it a go. the food was flavorful and hearty, i had the duck breast which was cooked to a perfect medium and paired very well with the soft baguette. the real star of the show was our waiter. when we first came in he greeted us, he sang songs, and was overall super energetic and kind. after finishing our meal me and my mom left early to go and catch the eiffel tower sparkling, leaving my father to pay at the restaurant. our waiter was so concerned that we had a fight and dramatically left that he gave my dad chocolates (pictured in the photos below) and offered him a amaretto. quality service really goes a long way and le corner fully delivered. go here!!; Filet de rumps track was EXTREMELY GOOD. The waiter was so nice, we came after 10pm, the kitchen was still open and he was very friendly during our whole time here. The table next to us ordered the burgers and they also looked very good.; This restaurant has a lovely atmosphere. The food was impeccable. We were two people and shared an entr√©e, had mains, finished with a dessert and had a bottle of wine. The whole meal was under 85‚Ç¨ which is fantastic. All waiters, especially Amir, were great. Smiling and making us feel at home.  We finished our Paris trip here and it was a great way to wrap up our visit to this beautiful city.; Went here for dinner.
Ordered the escargot which was amazing.
The waiter recommended the entrecote de boeuf which was lovely.
The waiter also suggested some nice red wine which went very well.
The service was excellent, despite my terrible french, the waiter helped me as lot.
Overall, great experience, amazing food, wine and service.
Merci.; Staff were lovely, attentive, informative and friendly, the food was all excellent and we couldn‚Äôt fault it. Starter, main and dessert were all delicious!
We even had three desserts because we couldn‚Äôt decide and all three were delicious! We spent under ‚Ç¨100 and that got us both two glasses of wine, a bottle of still water, a starter, main and dessert each, plus another dessert as mentioned!
Simply incredible.
Also upon ordering wine I‚Äôm not expert and the waiter helped me decide. He suggested a red and it was absolutely delicious! They then also wrote it down so I could buy it when I get home.
We would highly recommend it and we would happily return over and over again. We will be suggesting to our friends who visit Paris.
Faultless.

name: Le Drop Caf√©
reviews: Wonderful staff. They encouraged us to try new drinks, helped us explore new flavors and practice our French in a friendly atmosphere. This bar is also in a great location for sightseeing. They have a ‚ÄúFrench toast‚Äù dessert that is excellent and goes great with a coffee or cocktail.; We stopped by after a long afternoon at the Mus√©e D‚ÄôOrsay. The staff were welcoming and spoke English. We had steak and it was tender and cooked perfectly. We also had the cr√®me br√ªle and it was heavenly. Highly recommend!; Very good location, amazing service by Max who gave us recommendations on what to eat and the linguine pasta was 10/10 and cr√®me br√ªl√©e was the best üëå; Lovely friendly staff, great food choice and reasonably priced.; Waited more than half an hour for our food (5 people's food) to arrive. The people who came later than us had their food earlier than us. The waiter or waitress didn't help to check the status of our food order before we asked one of them to check when our food will be done. Service was not great. The basket of bread only came when our food came.

name: Frame
reviews: I had a delightful dining experience here during my recent Paris visit. The restaurant is a beautifully decorated space with a warm and inviting ambiance, ideal for a memorable evening. The menu seems thoughtfully curated, bursting with flavor, and pairs perfectly with the restaurant‚Äôs vibrant atmosphere. Conveniently located just steps from the Eiffel Tower and connected to the Pullman Hotel, it‚Äôs the perfect spot for both tourists and locals alike. A must-visit for those seeking great food in a prime location.; An amazing restaurant with a perfect location if you get a nice table you can have a nice view with Eiffel Tower. The steak was delicious and juicy, it was cooked perfectly. They also had one of the best services, the service was fast and professional. I really enjoyed the food and the service. Thank you üôè; It was a very nice experience. the food was really good, i had a beef fillet and as an entry we shared a burrata. the burrata was way too small to share and so was my meat. the portion was pretty small for that price and on the side was only one pasta. the taste was amazing tho...; Good quality buffet, lot of choices! Service is on point, many thanks Dave for your kindness and professionalism! Great environment as well with the Eiffel Tower nearby!; Outstanding restaurand! Verry professional and attentive staff! Mr. Simon was super great and made sure we felt home, he gave us an experience of a life time! Steak was grilled to perfection! Ambiance was at it's finest! I Highly recomand this place for the best fine dining experience in France Paris!

name: Le Village
reviews:
The food is average, coffee is good. The toilet room was dirty, no soap, no paper, but it‚Äôs not a cheap place)))
The cafe is located in a quiet street, among boutiques. At lunchtime they will let you in if you will eat. prices are high, service is ok; It's not cheap, but you're eating in a caf√© in Paris in the stylish pedestrian street that has boutiques from Chanel and Dior, so just enjoy.  Food was pretty good, the steak tartare offered better value than the petit filet, which lived up to its billing.  Chips and salad good.  Service was efficient.; Awesome place with great food and pretty much the only place with good service we experienced in 3 days in paris. Chich and trendy decor, nested in a cute arcade between the Dior and Chanel store, Well thought out and presented dishes, encompassing a range of tastes and flavours from around the world. They were also very accommodating with our 4 year old and made a dish for her that wasn't on the menu. Not cheap but it is what it is.; Place is nice but the food was terrible and expensive, 12‚Ç¨ for a plate of scrambled eggs that appeared to be soup with a small bread that was hard as a rock, the coffee was worst than instant coffee and it came from a machine not from an espresso machine which for 8‚Ç¨ is a scam.

The service is ok, nothing surprising just regular Paris service.

The place is in a nice spot but definitely not worth the price, you pay top money and get low quality.; Tucked in an alley next to Dior. Freshest seafood I‚Äôve had in Paris and this place has outdoor seating and indoor seating. We had Thai salad with prawns very fresh. We also had Brunch with smoked salmon with avocado salad also very fresh with the fluffiest scrambled eggs. The menu is simple with other salad options, rigatoni, artichoke salad, tuna tartare, beef tartare, club sandwich (looks yummy) and desserts. Service is professional and friendly. No cheese options though as I always want a plate of cheese while in Paris.

name: Coffee Club
reviews:
Came here for dinner since I wanted a ceasar salad. It was decent but a little pricy for what it offered. Also had a cocktail and that was good. There was a book event going on but I was just there for the food and there was no issues.; Nice little brunch place next to the Jardin du Luxembourg. There is a nice menu with diverse choices from burgers, to toasties, to classic American breakfasts. The taste is good but I didn‚Äôt feel it was anything crazy neither. Prices are alright and not too expensive neither which is nice.; The place is nice and the food is good. The staff is ok. It is overall a nice place, where you better take your time, and reasonably priced.

The French fries where really good.
Unfortunately, we had some half burnt pancakes and too cooked crispy chicken.

We were a party of 7 + a child, ate plentiful and paid around 280‚Ç¨.; I would rate this as a solid ‚Äúfine‚Äù. It‚Äôs a place that has potential, the atmosphere is good and the service is excellent.
But the food is really ‚Äúmid‚Äù,
It feels like they are charging as much as a normal portion but giving you kids portions. The food wasn‚Äôt even that good or that bad it‚Äôs just not really what you‚Äôre expecting with the menu, the prices and the American style.

I would stay away from the heuvis rancheros, the tortilla was impossible to cut through.; I don't get homesick as much as many American expats, but I have to admit this place rang some nice bells for me. High-quality American diner cooking, which I sometimes still crave.

Hamburgers without pretense, milkshakes that taste like real milkshakes, and much better fries than I'm accustomed to in Paris.

The service is very friendly, bordering on jovial.

All around, a solid spot.

name: Bleu Olive
reviews: Cute place for students, fast and courteous service. But, overpriced. The food is nothing special. The coffee is good though.; First things first, The coffee is very good. I had a V60 pour over with beans from Peru, this roast was wonderful and I would have ordered another if I could handle the caffeine. The service was exallent, they were helpful explained everything even when it was very busy. The food is limited so mostly snacks, but they have a breakfast plate with cheese, avocado, ham and bread. I would definitely come back for the coffee.; No coffee is worth this place, hesitated to write a review, thought the waitress was just having a bad day, but this experience made me feel so bad I felt other customers should be informed. She snapped at me for asking a dietary question as she was saying I shouldn‚Äôt ask any questions since everything is on the menu and she has too many things to do at the moment, we waited patiently for our coffee, after 3 other groups of people who came in after us got served, we asked about our coffees, their response was beyond acceptable, we asked our money back and they accused us of being rude, we saw another costumer asking if he could add a scone to his order; since he already paid she said he can‚Äôt change his order anymore ~ not sure if anyone felt welcome here; My go-to in this neighborhood, always tasty and the staff are lovely! They also let you use your laptop (except from noon until 3pm) which I really appreciate; A small, cozy and friendly-feeling cafe. Popped in for a light breakfast which was both tasty and good value, and it arrived within just a few minutes. The granola was particularly enjoyable. Plenty of tea blends to choose from, too.

name: Au Coin Gourmand
reviews:
Cute little shop that does mostly take away.  Their food is excellent, sandwiches tasty and fresh, pastries are great and service is friendly.  English speaking.  Definately worth a stop on your trip to Paris.  We got lunch here 3 times.  Each time was delicious.; Wow ü§©delicious croissants and treats. Beautiful atmosphere and excellent friendly service I highly recommend well worth a visit during your stay in Paris; Beautiful place,delicious food, and friendly stuffs.; We found this by accident, it was our first taste in Paris. My mom and sister and I were originally going to eat at another location but that place wasn‚Äôt open yet.
The owner set the tone for the rest of our trip with her kindness, amazing baked items and ready made food. I would kill to have a similar place back in California. She knew we were tourists looking unsure and she made us feel so at ease. Helping me figure out the euro coins, bringing us free pastries at the end. It turns out that none of the other bakeries we tried came close. Their espresso brew was delicious, so much flavor. We also shared a simple salmon/green bean salad that was seasoned perfectly.  They had a lot of savory sandwiches and a fresh rotation of scrumptious salads, the prices were very good too.
Thank you to the owner for being so helpful and warm.; The service here was great and very friendly. Croissant was one of the best we had in the city! With enough space to dine in, it was comfortable having breakfast with two kids. Highly recommended!

name: Petite For√™t
reviews: So happy to have found this wonderful, much needed, welcoming space for moms and babies in the middle of the hectic (not always child-friendly) city of Paris. Lots of room, clean space, friendly staff, cute children‚Äôs products. And the coffee is always great!!! I also cannot wait to try the classes once my baby is a bit older. Thank you for creating this haven for parents and kids!!!; The perfect cafe if you're in central Paris with small children. Gives the children a chance to run around, play, relax with books and enjoy a meal. Staff very friendly. The menu is a little limited for savoury meals.; Great little cafe if you have little ones. The staff are incredibly friendly! The coffee was good and the food was fantastic. We had a salad and a pesto pasta, while our 1-year-old loved the tomato pasta. The baby change and bathroom facilities are great, especially for kids.; There's no other place like Petite For√™t in Paris. Kids and families are not only welcome but it's a paradise, especially made for them. You can enjoy a hot (!) drink and a cake with delicious berries while the little ones play with the many beautiful and high quality, wooden toys, books etc. There're several stokke highchairs with different seats (yes, infant seats as well!) to make it more comfortable for everyone, playmat for the littlest, lots of space for the kiddos to play and move around, proper parking space for the pushchairs, delicious tea, coffee and cakes on the (expanding) menu, healthy snack and drinks for the children and honestly, I could just keep going on. The founders, Laura and Kaja are very kind and attentive who created the most amazing place for families. Did I mention¬† there's a bf pillow, changing table, several children's size toilets, all in a beautiful, clean and hygienic bathroom? Seriously, the list goes on.; I had the luck to find this lovely caf√© just after they opened. Inside it‚Äôs spacious and full of light, and very family/child friendly. I enjoyed the small touches, like how pretty all of their ceramics (plates/bowls/cups) are. Both my latte and cinnamon brioche were delicious. I‚Äôm curious to see what kind of ateliers they will offer in the future - I‚Äôll definitely be back!

name: The Family
reviews:
I visited "The Family" restaurant with my family and was delighted by the experience. From the moment we entered, we were warmly welcomed by a big, fluffy teddy bear holding the menu written on a charming chalkboard. This adorable touch instantly made us feel at home.
The food was well presented, with generous portions that were just right. Most importantly, the taste did not disappoint. Each dish was flavorful and satisfying, making our dining experience truly enjoyable. "The Family" restaurant certainly lives up to its name, providing cozy and inviting atmosphere perfect for a family outing.; So I Google a place to have a reasonable steak, so many great reviews about this place and I need to add mine as well. The service was fantastic, spoken English, had an English menu on a chalkboard which is pretty awesome and check out this food in the pictures. I can see why people come back to this place for sure. Well done, Bravo!!! üëçüçªüëèüëèüëè

Both Deviled Eggs salad and Steak were üëçüëçüëç; Felix was the BEST waiter!! Super attentive, very funny and so kind!! Made great wine recommendations and the food was phenomenal! Highly recommend stopping by The Family on your next trip to Paris!; Nice staffs, even though I don't speak French.
Reasonable price. Tasty food.
The onion soup was a bit salty.
Feeling full and no room to order dessert.
Happy dinner in French!; The best linguine I have ever had.  The chorizo made it perfect. Fantastic service. Only in Paris three nights and ate there twice because it was so good. The rest of my family had the steak and they all raved about that too.

name: VALMA
reviews: We are so lucky to have Valma a few steps from our home. Delicious food, friendly staff, cozy atmosphere. The menu is simple and changes weekly and constantly, pleasantly surprises us. We come here regularly and plan to brings friends, family, and visitors alike. Highly recommend this hidden gem.; Walked in excited and left super annoyed.ü§¨The restaurant had easily 8 tables open, maybe 6 with customers and when the person in the cashier understood we spoke English she told us that all the remaining tables were reserved. Seriously!?! Typical rude Parisian restaurant workers ! AVOID THEM!!!; Cool place for a Sunday brunch, the quality of the food is excellent and simple with good portion, the taste is good, not phenomenal , the juices were very good and original, but it is a bit small and when it gets busy, it gets loud.; Great food and great staff! Highly recommend. Made to feel very welcome; Very nice place for a brunch during weekend. Food is very good, kept simple. Kids friendly place. Best to book.

name: Mignon Caf√©
reviews:
Oh my god, the food here is so good!! The 25‚Ç¨ brunch is well worth it. Incredible value. I had the house lemonade, a latt√©, the avocado tartine, the overnight porridge (a lovely delicate mixture of soaked oats, chia seed and fresh fruit), and a slice of apple caramel cake to finish. The cake was the highlight, though everything was delish. The waitress told me that everything is handmade, and you can definitely taste that in the food.; So delicious - the flavors of the avocado toast with sesame sprinkle all over!! And the pesto was incredible. The eggs - boiled on top of the toast or salad - very fresh and yummy!! We loved the waffle with fruit and enjoyed the juices - Fresh squeezed Ginger, Carrot, Lemon. Apple, Ginger, Lemon..and more!!! Great prices and super friendly staff.; Great carrot cake.
Coffee, really not good at all. I had a coffee earlier the day at the excellent Casa (specialty coffee Paris XII).
Well, the contrast was sad.

Also we waited about ten minutes with few clients for our drinks and the waitress mixed up the cakes also.

Improve the coffee and service and you'll improve your rating.; The best brunch I‚Äôve ever had! Ok, to be honest, I haven‚Äôt had many brunches in my life so far‚Ä¶ and it was my first time in Paris as well. But it was so delicious I don‚Äôt know if anything can be better‚Ä¶ freshly squeezed orange juice - great taste, not acidic, superb pro matcha, overnight porridge I never thought could be so special, extraordinary avocado toast (of those I‚Äôve had quite a lot, so trust me that this one was top notch), and waffle, the waffle!!! with salted caramel‚Ä¶ oh my mouth, stomach, eyes, everything, so happy, super full for 25‚Ç¨‚Ä¶ I didn‚Äôt eat until dinner‚Ä¶ Merci!!! I need to learn French!; Small but lovely place. Very nice service, great selection of food, coffee and tea. Coffee comes with a choice of plant-based milk if you prefer a vegan option.

We had the chai and coffee latte, and a granola, which was awesome. The bowls and toasts looked awesome, too.

Can recommend!

name: Maison Milie
reviews:
Big surprise!
I find expect much from this place but I couldn't be more wrong! I think it was one of the best shaksuka I've tried! A bit different then the classic one but full of taste and veggies.

The place is very cozy, not too crowded. The dishswere served quickly and the staff was very nice. I highly recommend trying out for a quick lunch.; The service and location are excellent. I loved the presentation of the food as well as the staff. The food was savory and the experience is second to none. The price point is perfect and I will be back soon.; Good brunch. The Matcha is really tasty. The food is good but nothing special. The cafe is in a really good place if you want to visit the Sacr√©-Couer Basilica.; Ordered a mocaccino and iced americano. Drinks are good but they charged 3 extra euros for a ‚Äúcaf√© frapp√©‚Äù when I ordered and received an ice americano. Refused to compensate despite it being on the receipt. Granted they don‚Äôt understand English so avoid if tourist.; Cute cafe in Paris!

Friendly staff made the experience even better. Great food & coffee.

Perfect spot for a cosy weekend brunch!

name: Koff Burger Montmartre
reviews:
This place is by far one of the best burger places! I almost thought we were back in the states! The burger and hot dog were amazing! Definitely can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. I was surprised that there wasn‚Äôt more people in here. We‚Äôll be returning here if we come back to Paris.; Puts 5 guys to shame.

Absolutely 5 stars burger.
Definitely wish I could be back to try the other burger variations.

Went with cheeseburger & wasn't disappointed; I came across KOFF while strolling around Montmartre and was glad I found it. My daughter and I had lunch there and everything was delicious. I had the hamburger which was cooked perfectly medium as I ordered. The fries were among the best I‚Äôve had during my stay. I highly recommend this place.; The food was super tasty and the service was very friendly and attentive.; Yes I was an American that went to an American burger place in France... It was one of the few places open and we figured wth. We were so glad we did! Definitely come here! This was probably one of the best burgers I have had in my life! The fries were excellent too. The service is lacking and it seemed like only two people were working and one disappeared and the other had to pick up the slack. We are also still learning how service really works in France so it may have been a cultural disconnect. But even with that, just go you will not be disappointed. I got the mcFly and my sisters got the bacon cheeseburger, do not expect American level bacon, it was still fantastic though. I don't think you could get a bad burger here.

name: Lunch&CO Restaurant
reviews: Aucun avis disponible

name: Un Air de Famille
formatted_address: 26 R. du Ch√¢teau Landon, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: Really cozy , beautiful and welcoming people at the restaurant, I ate my first desert in Paris and it was goood; Kids friendly great food healthy; Very pleasant place and very nice staff especially for the child care part.; Taste good, all aspects are pretty good; Amazing place and excellent food!

name: All Good Things Paris
reviews:
Spent time browsing through so many other brunch options in Montemarte and settled on this last minute

Came early on a Friday morning, one of their first customers. Their coffee was surprisingly really good! We ordered an americano and latte. My husband and I don‚Äôt drink coffee often but we loved it here. It came with pain au chocolate which were divine with our espressos. We also had the croque madame, good balance of meat, cheese and sunny side up egg but the toast underneath was a little dry. Still good nonetheless. Our waitress was so nice and sweet. Loved the atmosphere of this restaurant! Clean bathrooms.; Location top and staff amazing and super friendly! We had a brunch this morning and WOW! Food is super tasty ! We will definitely come back! Ps: un gracias especial a Federico, que ha sido s√∫per simp√°tico y habla un italiano perfecto! üòâüòâüòâ
A big thanks to everyone.. we will definitely come back! Giulia & Sara from Italy üáÆüáπ; Second visit, the first being brunch.
Very friendly and the place was buzzing for dinner tonight. The host and staff were attentive and even helped with our struggles with french yet made us feel at ease. The menu was available online in English which was greatly appreciated. Food was excellent and the staff even went a little more than needed with service. I Enjoyed three courses and would happily eat here again.; Great place, amazing service, cute interior, very good food. We had the Eggs Benedict with Cheddar and Ham (‚Ç¨15) and it‚Äôs just like you‚Äôd wish them. They have full brunch menu for ‚Ç¨25 with drinks included. There‚Äôs space for improvement for the Home Made Iced Tea, though. The taste is very faded, basically flavoured water and does not correspond to the price (‚Ç¨5). Still this place gets 5 stars from me for everything else.; Went on a Sunday morning for a buffet. It was excellent, pic below is part of what they offered, there was more ‚Ä¶.The food was perfect from the eggs right down to the hot chocolate. 10/10, the price was worth the experience and quality of food and service. Bravo

name: The Family
reviews:
I visited "The Family" restaurant with my family and was delighted by the experience. From the moment we entered, we were warmly welcomed by a big, fluffy teddy bear holding the menu written on a charming chalkboard. This adorable touch instantly made us feel at home.
The food was well presented, with generous portions that were just right. Most importantly, the taste did not disappoint. Each dish was flavorful and satisfying, making our dining experience truly enjoyable. "The Family" restaurant certainly lives up to its name, providing cozy and inviting atmosphere perfect for a family outing.; So I Google a place to have a reasonable steak, so many great reviews about this place and I need to add mine as well. The service was fantastic, spoken English, had an English menu on a chalkboard which is pretty awesome and check out this food in the pictures. I can see why people come back to this place for sure. Well done, Bravo!!! üëçüçªüëèüëèüëè

Both Deviled Eggs salad and Steak were üëçüëçüëç; Felix was the BEST waiter!! Super attentive, very funny and so kind!! Made great wine recommendations and the food was phenomenal! Highly recommend stopping by The Family on your next trip to Paris!; Nice staffs, even though I don't speak French.
Reasonable price. Tasty food.
The onion soup was a bit salty.
Feeling full and no room to order dessert.
Happy dinner in French!; The best linguine I have ever had.  The chorizo made it perfect. Fantastic service. Only in Paris three nights and ate there twice because it was so good. The rest of my family had the steak and they all raved about that too.

name: Kick Caf√©
reviews:
I visited this cafe in april 2022. As we got there 15 mins before they were closing, they only served us something to drink. The drinks were delicious, I also bought a txt album. Very friendly staff. Mark Tuan went there too!!!!!
I love the decorations, the atmosphere and the concept.; Came from uk for event this cafe was amazing food was delicious loved the drink designed by castle J will definitely return here when we come for our next concert; Nice kawaii coffeeshop. The back of the shop need to be more furnished seems a bit empty and not organized; Cute little caf√© and boutique k-pop themed. If you like color and sugar, this place is for you :); Really nice cafe! Cute decoration and the staff was very nice and spoke english very well! The drinks were delicious and I loved all the kpop decorations!

name: Friends & Family Restaurant
reviews:
Restaurant is so aptly named as the atmosphere is cosy with tables of patrons chatting happily away. The waiter is very friendly. Even though he can barely speak English but still tries to communicate as much as he can. The menu is very simple. You either choose 2 courses pairing the mains with entrees or dessert for 28 Euros or all 3 courses for 36 Euros. All the items in each course is written in French onto the chalkboard. So i presume it is changed regularly. Though I can't understand French,  its easily overcome with Google Lens . The entree of squid and chorizo sausages in an orange thick soup was a pleasant surprise. For the mains I tried beef tatare for the first time and it tastes good. Ended meal with a chocolate mousse with sea salt. The waiter was a one man show handling many tables so each course took some time to arrive which was understandable. Hope the restaurant can find some help soon for this kind gentleman :); Great casual spot.
Came for a Thursday night dinner. Service was very good and the staff is very nice. The place is quiet and chill and away of the street‚Äôs bustle.
Buratta and the apricot crumble were the highlight of the evening.
Beef fillet was also good, but nothing too exciting.; We were looking for a fine dine restaurant, this was recommended by our hotel staff, and surprisingly this was indeed a good experience. Price it's reasonable, portions are great, great service! The only improvement I see are the desserts, they are too heavy by my taste, but definitely does not affect overall experience.; The restaurant was an absolutely fantastic discovery having come here for dinner with a friend! We chose it judging by all the positive reviews & we weren't disappointed üòç Every dish that we ordered was absolutely exquisite!! We had the burrata as a starter, the dorade ceviche as a main and the seasonal crumble, as well S the mousse au chocolat for dessert - each and every one of them was a little wow experience ü§Ø The prices were fair for the outstanding quality - 27‚Ç¨ for a starter + a main dish or a main dish + a dessert; or 35‚Ç¨ for all the three courses. I had a white wine suggested which fit perfectly with the food and all in all, the service was so warm and welcoming, which is extremely refreshing in the world of grumpy Parisian waiters üòÖ The only thing to mention, is that it would be great to have some more qualitative tea instead of just Lipton in a tea bag üòè It's located in a little hidden street, so it's really calm & away from all the noise of the cars, while being super central, it's simply the perfect mix!!! We will be back for sure & I have already suggested it to other friends ‚ô•Ô∏è; It was a nice fixed price menu place. My favorites were the mushroom soup starter and the desserts. For my entr√©e I had the steak tartare, and I guess it's one of those things I can check off the list as having tried. They've got plenty of wines to choose from, if that's your thing.

name: Mignon Caf√©
reviews:
Oh my god, the food here is so good!! The 25‚Ç¨ brunch is well worth it. Incredible value. I had the house lemonade, a latt√©, the avocado tartine, the overnight porridge (a lovely delicate mixture of soaked oats, chia seed and fresh fruit), and a slice of apple caramel cake to finish. The cake was the highlight, though everything was delish. The waitress told me that everything is handmade, and you can definitely taste that in the food.; So delicious - the flavors of the avocado toast with sesame sprinkle all over!! And the pesto was incredible. The eggs - boiled on top of the toast or salad - very fresh and yummy!! We loved the waffle with fruit and enjoyed the juices - Fresh squeezed Ginger, Carrot, Lemon. Apple, Ginger, Lemon..and more!!! Great prices and super friendly staff.; Great carrot cake.
Coffee, really not good at all. I had a coffee earlier the day at the excellent Casa (specialty coffee Paris XII).
Well, the contrast was sad.

Also we waited about ten minutes with few clients for our drinks and the waitress mixed up the cakes also.

Improve the coffee and service and you'll improve your rating.; The best brunch I‚Äôve ever had! Ok, to be honest, I haven‚Äôt had many brunches in my life so far‚Ä¶ and it was my first time in Paris as well. But it was so delicious I don‚Äôt know if anything can be better‚Ä¶ freshly squeezed orange juice - great taste, not acidic, superb pro matcha, overnight porridge I never thought could be so special, extraordinary avocado toast (of those I‚Äôve had quite a lot, so trust me that this one was top notch), and waffle, the waffle!!! with salted caramel‚Ä¶ oh my mouth, stomach, eyes, everything, so happy, super full for 25‚Ç¨‚Ä¶ I didn‚Äôt eat until dinner‚Ä¶ Merci!!! I need to learn French!; Small but lovely place. Very nice service, great selection of food, coffee and tea. Coffee comes with a choice of plant-based milk if you prefer a vegan option.

We had the chai and coffee latte, and a granola, which was awesome. The bowls and toasts looked awesome, too.

Can recommend!

name: Tribu Coffee R√©cr√©atif
formatted_address: 183 Rue du Faubourg Poissonni√®re, 75009 Paris, France
reviews: A fun, friendly environment! They have coffee, tea, snacks for kids as well as a great play area with lots of toys and books. They allow laptops as well so I got to get some work done while my family played in the play area. And Ines was really kind as well!; Great little place to come pass an hour or two, with or without kids! The cafe is clean and has a great energy; friendly, welcoming, come-as-you-are vibe. There are so many events for kids and families in their two rooms in the back and downstairs, plus the space in general is made for little ones running around. Can't wait to come back!; Such a great spot for families! We‚Äôre lucky we live steps away as we just had a baby. The owners are so lovely, the coffee & sweets are delicious, and their activities, like yoga, are so great to have in the neighbourhood.; came here as I was looking for a place to let my 11 month old baby have a safe space to roam while this mum gets to drink a warm cup of coffee. Super good atmosphere, quite a good selection of toys to play with, toilet is clean as well. Felt really safe to let my child play here, owners are super friendly as well! Definitely will be back again; Great little place, we had some time to kill before our eurostar train and this was conveniently located. The menu isn't very large (sweets only) but what we tried was very good (matcha white chocolate cookie and chocolate hazelnut cookie). Prices a little steep - 5 euros for very small latte, 4 euros cookie each but I guess you are also paying for the playarea. It felt a little cold inside too.

name: FLUFFY'S - Bakery et brunch
reviews: Good brunch and breakfast spot! I had a brioche style bun with two eggs and one with bacon - it was tasty! The cappuccino was tasty as well. Unfortunately not all options from the menu were available at 09.00am, would have loved to try other ones as well. The menu is available in French but the kind service team helped with choosing.; Amazing place with very good staff. I was impressed. They prepared special gift for my daughter‚Äôs birthday. Fluffy pancakes and avocado toast-must try.Thank you so much; Fluffy has delicious pastry with the perfect texture. Normally, cinnamon rolls are hard to make and they can be dry. However, the one here was soft and moist. Overall, it‚Äôs a great brunch place and cafe. Moreover, the staff were friendly, accommodating and helpful (You wouldn‚Äôt have to lift a finger üòâ).; Stumbled across this gem, glad we did. Owner (lady in photo) kindly explained the French menu to us - we opted for the classics. Heads up sausage / ham in Paris could mean bacon, in this case ours was done perfectly. The croque madame was lovely as well. The cafe uses bread done the Japanese way ‚Äî a favourite of ours. Coffee could afford to be stronger. Overall fabulous. We will return!; Just love this place! Wanted to go there for some time and it was exactly as I expected it to be - fluffy, yummy, and amazing. The food was great, the staff was super friendly and we had a great Sunday brunch. Highly recommend the spinach Fluffy... Was so good!

name: Maison Milie
reviews:
Big surprise!
I find expect much from this place but I couldn't be more wrong! I think it was one of the best shaksuka I've tried! A bit different then the classic one but full of taste and veggies.

The place is very cozy, not too crowded. The dishswere served quickly and the staff was very nice. I highly recommend trying out for a quick lunch.; The service and location are excellent. I loved the presentation of the food as well as the staff. The food was savory and the experience is second to none. The price point is perfect and I will be back soon.; Good brunch. The Matcha is really tasty. The food is good but nothing special. The cafe is in a really good place if you want to visit the Sacr√©-Couer Basilica.; Ordered a mocaccino and iced americano. Drinks are good but they charged 3 extra euros for a ‚Äúcaf√© frapp√©‚Äù when I ordered and received an ice americano. Refused to compensate despite it being on the receipt. Granted they don‚Äôt understand English so avoid if tourist.; Cute cafe in Paris!

Friendly staff made the experience even better. Great food & coffee.

Perfect spot for a cosy weekend brunch!

name: Ernestine Caf√©
formatted_address: 72 Rue Joseph de Maistre, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
**5 Stars - Amazing Spot!**

Loved my visit to Ernestine Cafe! The coffee was rich and flavorful, and the pastries were fresh and delicious. The cozy atmosphere and friendly staff make it a perfect place to relax or catch up with friends. Will definitely be back!üíñü§© highly recommend; Was just walking by and decided to give the cafe a chance, I‚Äôm so glad I did!

The cozy interior is very charming, they host a lot of children workshops here in a separate playroom open for them to play in while their parents enjoy their meal / drink. There‚Äôs a large window looking into the playroom so parents can watch their kids but also have a bit of space to themselves, very family friendly and innovative. The atmosphere is very pleasant and welcoming; there‚Äôs mostly locals who stop by here but Ernestine Cafe is also very tourist friendly because the workers speak and understand English well.

The menu is diverse and creative, with all the food being made in house. They have a restroom in the back which makes it convenient to spend some time here. I ordered their brunch and left quiet full and content, will definitely stop by the next time I‚Äôm in Paris!; Ernestine is the caf√© I always wanted. It has delicious and wonderful caf√© options, the food is copious and nicely priced, there are ateliers and storytelling in English and French, and I feel relaxed and at home there. More importantly, so does my baby. Also, Yannis has an intuitive and sentimental capital that really lends the sense there is a love of children; it is not an attention confined to merely the children's section.; It is a very cosy and charming cafe with a special area for children. While our one year daughter is playing we can enjoy excellent macchiato. Don't miss this place if you have young kids and like very good coffee.; Super cosy and relaxing shop.

name: LE CHIEN DE LA LUNE
reviews:
I had made a reservation for a group of 28 people, mostly US students. We had hummus, couscous or chakchuka--an excellent vegetarian option, with merguez (spicy sausages) added on request--, panna cotta infused with fennel (a superb dessert) and chocolate mousse. Service was fast although the place was busy on a Friday evening, with a young waitress who speaks excellent English. Prices were inexpensive for a Parisian restaurant and the chef, Christian, is very friendly. I will certainly return with friends anytime.; The concept is nice, but you notice the place is new and just starting. The wine was to expensive for the qualtiy in my experience.
In the weekend you can't take the menu option, this is only durning the week. Unfortantly it isn't obviouse. They aren't many other things to chose from. We could chose from the burger or a vegertarian dishe. Both were ok, but not what we where hoping for.
You can sit outside but the neighborhood isn't cosy.; Cute place, had a nice lunch here. A little bit outside from the central but I prefer because it‚Äôs nicer and quiet.; Google really worries me, I stopped for lunch and here is big brother watching over my shoulder! Now the restaurant was very good, both in taste and value not to mention a friendly staff. I'll stop over again anytime.; Great ! A good place to have a drink by nibbling something. I recommand.

name: Le P'tit Piano
reviews:
Great food and service! The staff were nice and friendly. We got their sirloin steak with shallot cream and one with morel (mushroom) sauce, and duck breast. We also got the creme brulee, lemon tart and chocolate fondant with ice cream for dessert.; We loved everything here!
The service was great and we were greeted by a smile as soon as we arrived.

Food came out super quickly and was delicious. Great portion as well, so great value for money. Cocktails were tasty and refreshing for these hot summer afternoons.

Ambience was one of the things I liked the most. Soothing and relaxing, allowing for you to properly enjoy your food and take a breath, despite being located in a busy street.

100% recommend.; We decided to try this place out after seeing all the fantastic reviews, but upon arrival, we almost thought we were at the wrong place‚Äîit looked almost like a PMU from the outside! However, stepping inside changed our minds instantly. The interior is surprisingly cute, and it was bustling with energy during our Saturday brunch visit.

There's even a piano set up for their piano nights, adding a charming touch. The staff was incredibly friendly, which made our experience even better.
The food? Absolutely delightful. I had the foie gras and salade p√©rigourdine as starters, which were hearty enough to be mains, followed by the succulent souris d‚Äôagneau. The portions were generous across the board, definitely making it worth the money.

I would heartily recommend this spot and affirm that it truly deserves its high ratings, especially for the quality of the cuisine.; Amazing little gem. Very good food. Very nice staff and they helped me with my gastric bypass needs. Food was delicious steak was a little undercooked because I asked for medium rare but I got rare. No big problem was tasty nonetheless!; Alfredo is great! The dishes he recommended were surprisingly good. We ordered the lamb, goat cheese salad, charcuterie board, and French onion soup. To top off a great dinner he treated us to mint shots that we loved. Give this place a try!

name: Les Fils √† Maman Grands-Boulevards
reviews: The vibe here is like travelling back in time to the 70s/80s with decor (cassette tape wall, kid and adult TV series posters and vintage signage) appointed from a time past. The origin story of the restaurant is featured in a spiral bound menu that was provided in addition to the fold-out brunch menu. The formule at 30 euros is a steal. In general, the restaurant offers great value for money. The egg/ham croissant was a 3 for me because of the scrambled egg quality (reminded me of cafeteria powdered eggs) and croissant quality (tough texture). The service is a 3 because the order had to be reconfirmed a few minutes after our drinks were served AND one of our drinks was served ‚Äúvirgin‚Äù in error. The ambience is fun and the guests appeared to be very pleased. Note: the table seating is very cozy; Delicious food and friendly, accommodating staff. Ambiance is nice as well, with plenty of interesting things to look at. We shared a charcuterie/appetizer platter, with deep fried croquettes of cheese, pulled pork and more, along with some sliced salami, pickles and some amazing "fries" made out of chickpeas. For mains, we had the chicken cordon bleu and some kind of mushroom and cheese pastry. They dont have English menus, but the staff was great about explaining things. Give the French IPA a try as well!; On our final night in Paris, my mother was really craving Chicken Cordon Bleu and we were fortunate enough to find it at Les Fils a Maman. Service was great and we really loved the fun, quirky atmosphere. I ordered the Filet Mignon (delish) and the Cosmo Spritzes were great as well!; Very pleasant dinner experience - they accommodate large groups with reservation. The cordon Bleu chicken deserves all good reviews it has. Other dishes are also tasty.; All demands and expectations have been fulfilled. Nice chicken fillet, outstanding homemade drinks. We had a wonderful time.

name: La Cr√™perie d'Am√©lie
reviews:
this place took my heart‚ù§Ô∏è the coffee is perfect for my taste, and they have 3 kinds of vegan milk)
they also serve good food, bobble tea, matcha and gelato !; The best crepe in the world , that was delicious. We order a Nutella crepe with chocolate and coffee ice cream omg delicious. And also we order coconut ice was like I was young. Amazing; I tried this place on my last morning in Paris and it was by far the best place to have breakfast! The yogurt parfait was made the same day and was very delicious. The egg sandwich was another hit for me as well as the cappuccino! If I ever come back to Paris I will definitely be coming to this place!; A fairly quiet place in the heart of Montmartre, with quite generous and very very tasty menus. Really easy to order your menu with tablets displayed at the entrance,and such a beautiful,quite and warm place to eat.

We decided to repeat and we went today again for the second time on our first visit to Paris (even though being 1h walkingüòÇ) I will recommend it to my friends and family for sure!

We ordered a bacon smash burger,a hot dog and nuggets both days and they were delicious. All of them served by the staff on table on the second floor.

At last,I would like to thank the person in charge (as he already left when we finished) as he recognized us and gave us churros dessert for free to taste them,really good also.

We were really satisfied with your glad and helpful service and will repeat if we come back,thanks a lot!; Perfect crepe for breakfast with fresh orange juice, hot chocolate and coffee - five stars for faty the chef

name: Koff Burger Montmartre
reviews:
This place is by far one of the best burger places! I almost thought we were back in the states! The burger and hot dog were amazing! Definitely can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. I was surprised that there wasn‚Äôt more people in here. We‚Äôll be returning here if we come back to Paris.; Puts 5 guys to shame.

Absolutely 5 stars burger.
Definitely wish I could be back to try the other burger variations.

Went with cheeseburger & wasn't disappointed; I came across KOFF while strolling around Montmartre and was glad I found it. My daughter and I had lunch there and everything was delicious. I had the hamburger which was cooked perfectly medium as I ordered. The fries were among the best I‚Äôve had during my stay. I highly recommend this place.; The food was super tasty and the service was very friendly and attentive.; Yes I was an American that went to an American burger place in France... It was one of the few places open and we figured wth. We were so glad we did! Definitely come here! This was probably one of the best burgers I have had in my life! The fries were excellent too. The service is lacking and it seemed like only two people were working and one disappeared and the other had to pick up the slack. We are also still learning how service really works in France so it may have been a cultural disconnect. But even with that, just go you will not be disappointed. I got the mcFly and my sisters got the bacon cheeseburger, do not expect American level bacon, it was still fantastic though. I don't think you could get a bad burger here.

name: Sacr√© Frenchy !
reviews:
Food was excellent, very tasty dishes. The chicken was amazing, and worth sharing. The happy hour on cocktails was a good deal as well, and delicious cocktails.

Service was not great for our visit, cocktail forgotten, and a 45 minute wait for the main dish after starters. We noticed several other tables having quite some issues with service as well around us. It was not busy or full at the time. A great dining experience turned poor by long waits and off service.

That said, not so bad I wouldn‚Äôt try again, it could be an off day, but the food was great, and service was friendly despite the waits and inattentiveness.; This place was absolutely wonderful! Our waitress, Amelie, was incredibly kind and attentive, making our experience truly exceptional. The food was fantastic, and the cocktails were equally impressive.; I don‚Äôt normally leave a review, but I felt compelled. We had eight people and they accommodated us at the last minute. Our servers name was Emily and she was absolutely phenomenal from picking wine to suggesting entr√©es. The food came on time and it was fantastic. What a great dining Atmosphere experience. if you‚Äôre in this area, don‚Äôt look any further.; Very kid and tourist friendly. The staff were so sweet, and the food was wonderful. I highly recommend their seafood ceviche. Dessert was to die for too. Their cr√®me br√ªl√©e was the table‚Äôs favorite.; My wife and I had our first dinner in this last visit to Paris. My wife is not a ‚Äúlamb food fan‚Äù, and had a steak, while I ordered the ‚Äú7 hour lamb dish‚Äù.
The food was great, cooked to order, and very tasty. Service was great too. With that said, I would like to emphasize the ‚Äú7 hour lamb‚Äù dish that was probably the best lamb dish I had so far. It was adobe style, super duper tasty. It was so good my wife ate more of it than her steak. Since we came for only 3 days to Paris and did not want to go to the same place twice, we went to explore other places in the following g evening. We regret not coming back to have this lamb again. Other dinners were fine too, but this was the most remembered from this trip. Served with spinach warm side dish and (what I believe was) mashed cilantro root. It is a MUST HAVE dish!

name: Le Gourbi Palace
reviews: Amazing charm local little spot to have a enjoy a beer listening to live music. A gem ! Family and kids friendly!; Stellar little spot full of charm and good times. Relaxed atmosphere and interesting space. Good selection and decent prices!; Eat and drink with the locals. Very friendly staff, small but interesting menu and great food.; Pleasant honest and friendly. Best Mojito in Paris ? üòâ; Top

name: VALMA
reviews: We are so lucky to have Valma a few steps from our home. Delicious food, friendly staff, cozy atmosphere. The menu is simple and changes weekly and constantly, pleasantly surprises us. We come here regularly and plan to brings friends, family, and visitors alike. Highly recommend this hidden gem.; Walked in excited and left super annoyed.ü§¨The restaurant had easily 8 tables open, maybe 6 with customers and when the person in the cashier understood we spoke English she told us that all the remaining tables were reserved. Seriously!?! Typical rude Parisian restaurant workers ! AVOID THEM!!!; Cool place for a Sunday brunch, the quality of the food is excellent and simple with good portion, the taste is good, not phenomenal , the juices were very good and original, but it is a bit small and when it gets busy, it gets loud.; Great food and great staff! Highly recommend. Made to feel very welcome; Very nice place for a brunch during weekend. Food is very good, kept simple. Kids friendly place. Best to book.

name: Les Enfants Rouges
reviews:
This is a cozy little, very compact restaurant in a busy little street of Paris. The food (in my opinion) is good but did not blow my mind nor did I have a gastronomical experience. Its just one of those places that gets popular I guess. The restaurant is really compact and space is scarce to move around. The service is very good, attentive, helpful and prompt. The five stars are for the great service really and not so much for the food - I have had better. Reservations are required in advance as it gets busy. It seems overpriced to me.; Our second time in Les Enfants Rouges was interesting. Definitely reserve your table in advance, the place is packed. Cozy atmosphere. Staff is super nice. Best dish-desert. Both Pavlova and Cheese cake were superb. Lamb chops were delicious. Neither of the entries deserve a mention, thus 4 stars.; Definitely a 5-star and particularly at the reasonable price. Dishes from Les Enfants Rouge and chef-patron Da√Ø Shinozuka. He takes classic French ingredients and adds Japanese flair. Each dish worked well with balanced, nuanced flavours that excited the palate. The rum baba is the best in the world. With one bottle of wine, the cost was just under ‚Ç¨100 a head.
The first time we came was about ten years ago. Standards have not dropped and its popularity is understandable - so book in advance. Five stars! (And the service was good too.); A must stop by place if you‚Äôre in Paris. Modern French cuisine, with a Japanese twist. Everything was absolutely delicious, and the dishes were art pieces. Very friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. Reservation recommended! Great selection of drinks including Japanese cocktails and sake üëå; Blown away by the quality of the lunch course, especially compared to the price. This place at least deserves a bib gourmand imho. The grapefruit lychee dessert was such an ideal assembly of tart, crisp, and sweet - and the textures! All very interesting flavour combinations from both Japanese and French influences. Highly recommended!

name: La ferme de Charles
reviews:
üëç Absolutely satisfied with my experience at La Ferme de Charles! When it's good, it's GOOD. The welcoming staff had such warm smiles, which was really delightful üòä The decor creates an authentic atmosphere - love the cozy simplicity! Opted for the lamb with seasonal veggies, the daily special, and it was a delightful choice. So delicious! Overall, a great find with excellent value for money right in the heart of Paris üçΩÔ∏èüëå; It's a bit difficult to gice a 2 star rating but I have to be honest.
The food was really average/bad.
Appetizer Fried parmesan rice balls were ok
Terrine was ok
Main: beef roti salad is extremely bad: super dry beef and week old potatoes
Dish of the day was fish and fish was old frozen fish
BUT SERVICE was really nice. The waiters were super kind.
They offered to serve another dish since i didnt touch mine and i kindly refused.
So they offered the dessert fruit salad (unfortunately it was apple sauce with canned fruits)
But appreciated the gesture for sure.
Since fixe menu was quite reasonable...can't complain much
Unfortunately i will not take the chance to go back...; We are a family of 5 from the US.  We went for an all-you-can-eat brunch on the weekend.  It was pretty cold out (March), so we got a table indoors, and sat next to the windows.  The decor was cozy.  The furniture was all wood, and had antiques with a farm theme.

The vibe is v. family friendly and local.  We arrived early.  The dining space filled up pretty quickly, and included a mix of families and groups of adults.  Aside from us, the clientele was all locals.

The food was great.  It included a large variety of dishes, so you're sure to find something you like.  On the day we went, there was poached and smoked salmon, mussels, a couple of chicken dishes, and a large roast beef.  In addition, there were homemade country style cold-cuts, pickled vegetables, and cheese (the cheeses were great!).  There were a lot of vegetable dishes, including a potato cheese gratin that was the best I've ever had.  The kind of thing you just can't stop eating.  To round things out, there was a fresh fruit and desert table.  I had some apple tarte, a crepe and an excellent double-expresso.

We were there for an a bit more than an hour.  The staff was great, v. friendly and helpful.  The bathroom was clean.  It's too bad we only found this place at the end of our trip, we would definitely have come again.; Pretty nice and the staff is super nice! Kitchen was closed and the chef took extra time to make a planche mixte. Thanks again.; Friendly stuff, original atmosphere, but one sort of beer, I would not recommend Cordon bleu and French fries. Tartar is good one.

name: Lunch&CO Restaurant
reviews: Aucun avis disponible

name: Paris Tours With Kids
reviews: This child centered personalized tour was the highlight of our trip. Our guide was kind, patient and child oriented, she engaged the kids in history related to their experiences and kept us at a child friendly pace. When the kids began to wilt she found places for them to sit and told them great stories about the art in front of them. We would‚Äôve just walked by so many small details of this historic place. Thanks to our guide Dominique we didn‚Äôt wait in lines, we learned so much and the kids have a very positive association with art and museums.; Amazing experience! We had Maeva as our guide and she was fantastic. We all learned so much, but my 7 year old was really excited to learn about the Mona Lisa. We went though most of the areas, played some scavenger hut games, and other interactive ways to learn about the history and art. Maeva made it fun and relatable for her, but actually we all learned so much. I wised I had another tour just to see more of the thousands of exhibits. It was absolutely worth the extra cost! Highly recommend!; We booked our tour to the Louvre very last minute and Lara had tickets available so it tells you the kind of organisation they are. Lara coordinated and accommodated anything we needed and then assigned us to Stephanie on the day who was just brilliant! Has inmense knowledge and anecdotes to keep us and especially our 8 year old thoroughly engaged. Last but not the least the skip the lines were incredibly beneficial! Just fantastic!!; Amazing experience, I was initially nervous about our visit to the Louvre with 3 kids, but the visit visit guided by Agathe exceeded our expectations! Thank you so much for making our girls enjoy a 3 hours tour, through fun facts and games to keep them interested! I highly recommend families to enjoy the Paris tours with kids!; We loved our tours with Dominique! She was amazing with kids. Our kids were a little young (6 and 4) for the places we went---Versailles and Musee d'Orsay--but Dominique was so patient, was willing to crouch down to talk at their level (literally), etc. She moved us along at the pace we needed, which was sometimes slow (needing to stop to have a snack) and sometimes brisk when my 4 year old was nearing the end of her attention span. I'm so grateful to Paris Tours with Kids and especially Dominique for making those places special.

name: April cafe - coffee shop - caf√© poussette - Paris 10eme
reviews:
Pooping 5* parties is a guilty pleasure, but here I have to put my earthly blood just aside to endorse the 5* rating. This place is an oasis of peace, ans most critically, the coffee is good. The cake and smoothie too are up to the task. The drivers of this peace train are suitably calm and methodical. Not a place for rushing, but why rush to leave the peace train?; Absolutely beautiful place to enjoy a coffee and cake with a little one. Everything we ate was delightful and my 2 yo son played the whole time in a peaceful and safe environment.
I will definitely come back again!; This little French Coffee shop is absolutely amazing.  It's warm, inviting and the staff is friendly.  The coffee and pastries were amazing.  I had loads of fun making my tasty delights.; Nice and cozy place with friendly staff. We had a chai latte and a cappuccino. Both were very good.; With two friends, I visited this cafe by accident on a Sunday afternoon when we were looking for a spot to work.

The host is really warm and wonderful to talk to. We also managed to exchange our recipes as well. We didn't eat much but the grilled cheese sandwich and the banana cake was great.

name: Un Air de Famille
formatted_address: 26 R. du Ch√¢teau Landon, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: Really cozy , beautiful and welcoming people at the restaurant, I ate my first desert in Paris and it was goood; Kids friendly great food healthy; Very pleasant place and very nice staff especially for the child care part.; Taste good, all aspects are pretty good; Amazing place and excellent food!

name: All Good Things Paris
reviews:
Spent time browsing through so many other brunch options in Montemarte and settled on this last minute

Came early on a Friday morning, one of their first customers. Their coffee was surprisingly really good! We ordered an americano and latte. My husband and I don‚Äôt drink coffee often but we loved it here. It came with pain au chocolate which were divine with our espressos. We also had the croque madame, good balance of meat, cheese and sunny side up egg but the toast underneath was a little dry. Still good nonetheless. Our waitress was so nice and sweet. Loved the atmosphere of this restaurant! Clean bathrooms.; Location top and staff amazing and super friendly! We had a brunch this morning and WOW! Food is super tasty ! We will definitely come back! Ps: un gracias especial a Federico, que ha sido s√∫per simp√°tico y habla un italiano perfecto! üòâüòâüòâ
A big thanks to everyone.. we will definitely come back! Giulia & Sara from Italy üáÆüáπ; Second visit, the first being brunch.
Very friendly and the place was buzzing for dinner tonight. The host and staff were attentive and even helped with our struggles with french yet made us feel at ease. The menu was available online in English which was greatly appreciated. Food was excellent and the staff even went a little more than needed with service. I Enjoyed three courses and would happily eat here again.; Great place, amazing service, cute interior, very good food. We had the Eggs Benedict with Cheddar and Ham (‚Ç¨15) and it‚Äôs just like you‚Äôd wish them. They have full brunch menu for ‚Ç¨25 with drinks included. There‚Äôs space for improvement for the Home Made Iced Tea, though. The taste is very faded, basically flavoured water and does not correspond to the price (‚Ç¨5). Still this place gets 5 stars from me for everything else.; Went on a Sunday morning for a buffet.
