It was excellent, pic below is part of what they offered, there was more ‚Ä¶.The food was perfect from the eggs right down to the hot chocolate. 10/10, the price was worth the experience and quality of food and service. Bravo

name: Restaurant Discovery Food
reviews:
I came here excited to try their food, but once I began ordering that changed (I‚Äôm only visiting so my French is very little) tried to order what I could In French and the rest id point, the lady was so rude mumbling under her breath like ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt speak French‚Äù very rudely which I understood Because I understand French. I so No, sorry. I continued to order and she continued to be very rude to me, so I just Left. Just because you feel miserable doesn‚Äôt mean you have to treat others horribly.; By far the best food place!! Here you can get freshly prepared dishes at fair prices. If you are looking for a delicious and healthy lunch, this restaurant is the best in the area. Moreover, the staff is super friendly!; It looks beautiful and tastes good. The seating is so small and it's crowded as there were only 2 people trying to do everything. Great service though. I bought a sandwich which tasted good. I'll try visiting again !; Finally a restaurant that understands what we really need in Paris!
Being able to eat a balanced diet, with a wide choice, for a reasonable price!
Thanks to the managers, the atmosphere is very pleasant and intimate, I recommend!

@LVS.kid; Excellent place, I highly recommend! Thank you to the very friendly and helpful duo of ladies who received us.

name: Kick Caf√©
reviews:
I visited this cafe in april 2022. As we got there 15 mins before they were closing, they only served us something to drink. The drinks were delicious, I also bought a txt album. Very friendly staff. Mark Tuan went there too!!!!!
I love the decorations, the atmosphere and the concept.; Came from uk for event this cafe was amazing food was delicious loved the drink designed by castle J will definitely return here when we come for our next concert; Nice kawaii coffeeshop. The back of the shop need to be more furnished seems a bit empty and not organized; Cute little caf√© and boutique k-pop themed. If you like color and sugar, this place is for you :); Really nice cafe! Cute decoration and the staff was very nice and spoke english very well! The drinks were delicious and I loved all the kpop decorations!

name: The Family
reviews:
I visited "The Family" restaurant with my family and was delighted by the experience. From the moment we entered, we were warmly welcomed by a big, fluffy teddy bear holding the menu written on a charming chalkboard. This adorable touch instantly made us feel at home.
The food was well presented, with generous portions that were just right. Most importantly, the taste did not disappoint. Each dish was flavorful and satisfying, making our dining experience truly enjoyable. "The Family" restaurant certainly lives up to its name, providing cozy and inviting atmosphere perfect for a family outing.; So I Google a place to have a reasonable steak, so many great reviews about this place and I need to add mine as well. The service was fantastic, spoken English, had an English menu on a chalkboard which is pretty awesome and check out this food in the pictures. I can see why people come back to this place for sure. Well done, Bravo!!! üëçüçªüëèüëèüëè

Both Deviled Eggs salad and Steak were üëçüëçüëç; Felix was the BEST waiter!! Super attentive, very funny and so kind!! Made great wine recommendations and the food was phenomenal! Highly recommend stopping by The Family on your next trip to Paris!; Nice staffs, even though I don't speak French.
Reasonable price. Tasty food.
The onion soup was a bit salty.
Feeling full and no room to order dessert.
Happy dinner in French!; The best linguine I have ever had.  The chorizo made it perfect. Fantastic service. Only in Paris three nights and ate there twice because it was so good. The rest of my family had the steak and they all raved about that too.

name: Friends & Family Restaurant
reviews:
Restaurant is so aptly named as the atmosphere is cosy with tables of patrons chatting happily away. The waiter is very friendly. Even though he can barely speak English but still tries to communicate as much as he can. The menu is very simple. You either choose 2 courses pairing the mains with entrees or dessert for 28 Euros or all 3 courses for 36 Euros. All the items in each course is written in French onto the chalkboard. So i presume it is changed regularly. Though I can't understand French,  its easily overcome with Google Lens . The entree of squid and chorizo sausages in an orange thick soup was a pleasant surprise. For the mains I tried beef tatare for the first time and it tastes good. Ended meal with a chocolate mousse with sea salt. The waiter was a one man show handling many tables so each course took some time to arrive which was understandable. Hope the restaurant can find some help soon for this kind gentleman :); Great casual spot.
Came for a Thursday night dinner. Service was very good and the staff is very nice. The place is quiet and chill and away of the street‚Äôs bustle.
Buratta and the apricot crumble were the highlight of the evening.
Beef fillet was also good, but nothing too exciting.; We were looking for a fine dine restaurant, this was recommended by our hotel staff, and surprisingly this was indeed a good experience. Price it's reasonable, portions are great, great service! The only improvement I see are the desserts, they are too heavy by my taste, but definitely does not affect overall experience.; The restaurant was an absolutely fantastic discovery having come here for dinner with a friend! We chose it judging by all the positive reviews & we weren't disappointed üòç Every dish that we ordered was absolutely exquisite!! We had the burrata as a starter, the dorade ceviche as a main and the seasonal crumble, as well S the mousse au chocolat for dessert - each and every one of them was a little wow experience ü§Ø The prices were fair for the outstanding quality - 27‚Ç¨ for a starter + a main dish or a main dish + a dessert; or 35‚Ç¨ for all the three courses. I had a white wine suggested which fit perfectly with the food and all in all, the service was so warm and welcoming, which is extremely refreshing in the world of grumpy Parisian waiters üòÖ The only thing to mention, is that it would be great to have some more qualitative tea instead of just Lipton in a tea bag üòè It's located in a little hidden street, so it's really calm & away from all the noise of the cars, while being super central, it's simply the perfect mix!!! We will be back for sure & I have already suggested it to other friends ‚ô•Ô∏è; It was a nice fixed price menu place. My favorites were the mushroom soup starter and the desserts. For my entr√©e I had the steak tartare, and I guess it's one of those things I can check off the list as having tried. They've got plenty of wines to choose from, if that's your thing.

name: Caf√© Klin
reviews:
Highly recommend l!! A really nice caf√© with loads of veggie options. They also serve Natural wine and have a great selection of fresh juice and craft beer.
A must to try when you are around Republique area in Paris. 5 stars.; I am not vegan but I find the food in this little caf√© absolutely delicious. I had a taster meal (5 courses) and everything was fresh and tasty. Staff is very nice. You can even seat outside. I will come back; One of my best cafes for breakfast in the morning. An active atmosphere. And their service is good. And a special thanks to the restaurant manager. I will be back to visit again.; Cute interior, a bit dirty, the coffee was good. The selection of pastry was a bit small but it was ok.; An excellent cafe, super friendly staff. Highly recommended !

name: Tribu Coffee R√©cr√©atif
formatted_address: 183 Rue du Faubourg Poissonni√®re, 75009 Paris, France
reviews: A fun, friendly environment! They have coffee, tea, snacks for kids as well as a great play area with lots of toys and books. They allow laptops as well so I got to get some work done while my family played in the play area. And Ines was really kind as well!; Great little place to come pass an hour or two, with or without kids! The cafe is clean and has a great energy; friendly, welcoming, come-as-you-are vibe. There are so many events for kids and families in their two rooms in the back and downstairs, plus the space in general is made for little ones running around. Can't wait to come back!; Such a great spot for families! We‚Äôre lucky we live steps away as we just had a baby. The owners are so lovely, the coffee & sweets are delicious, and their activities, like yoga, are so great to have in the neighbourhood.; came here as I was looking for a place to let my 11 month old baby have a safe space to roam while this mum gets to drink a warm cup of coffee. Super good atmosphere, quite a good selection of toys to play with, toilet is clean as well. Felt really safe to let my child play here, owners are super friendly as well! Definitely will be back again; Great little place, we had some time to kill before our eurostar train and this was conveniently located. The menu isn't very large (sweets only) but what we tried was very good (matcha white chocolate cookie and chocolate hazelnut cookie). Prices a little steep - 5 euros for very small latte, 4 euros cookie each but I guess you are also paying for the playarea. It felt a little cold inside too.

name: Le Hang'art
formatted_address: 61-63 Quai de la Seine, 75019 Paris, France
reviews:
Love this place, laid back and very friendly. Huge portions with swift service. Probably our best experiance so far eating out in Paris.

Would 100% recommend. 4.8/5; Spacious repurposed building where the furniture is school desks. Good food and service. I thought the king prawns on my tagliatelle were a bit mushy but otherwise liked it all. Reasonable prices. Loved the banoffee; Well located by the canal, this restaurant is very baby/kid friendly! üë∂ They have high chairs, toys, books and a dedicated area for kids! However you need to pay 8‚Ç¨ to access this area.. The food in general is simple and good, nothing extraordinary but for a high volume restaurant it's fine!; Fun and hip little place, very atmospheric, welcoming staff, food was yummy, overall really great experience!; I came to Paris to eat but with the rain and some fatigue I tried staying closer to my hotel. This was down the street and it‚Äôs had a few things going for it: an menu that had a few intriguing dishes, a hip looking crowd, and the guy that met me at the door was pretty inviting.

I ended getting a cuttlefish and potato salad with an onion dressing and a vegetarian lasagne. Both dishes really hit it out of the park for me. I‚Äôm normally leaning carnivore, but had been overdoing it on the trip so far, and so I was happily surprised that the veg lasagne was possible the best veg one I‚Äôve ever had.

I was also peaking at the tables by me and the burrata avocado tomato salad also looked great, and the frites looked home made and home style with skins and plenty of dark bits on the edges.

name: Mignon Caf√©
reviews:
Oh my god, the food here is so good!! The 25‚Ç¨ brunch is well worth it. Incredible value. I had the house lemonade, a latt√©, the avocado tartine, the overnight porridge (a lovely delicate mixture of soaked oats, chia seed and fresh fruit), and a slice of apple caramel cake to finish. The cake was the highlight, though everything was delish. The waitress told me that everything is handmade, and you can definitely taste that in the food.; So delicious - the flavors of the avocado toast with sesame sprinkle all over!! And the pesto was incredible. The eggs - boiled on top of the toast or salad - very fresh and yummy!! We loved the waffle with fruit and enjoyed the juices - Fresh squeezed Ginger, Carrot, Lemon. Apple, Ginger, Lemon..and more!!! Great prices and super friendly staff.; Great carrot cake.
Coffee, really not good at all. I had a coffee earlier the day at the excellent Casa (specialty coffee Paris XII).
Well, the contrast was sad.

Also we waited about ten minutes with few clients for our drinks and the waitress mixed up the cakes also.

Improve the coffee and service and you'll improve your rating.; The best brunch I‚Äôve ever had! Ok, to be honest, I haven‚Äôt had many brunches in my life so far‚Ä¶ and it was my first time in Paris as well. But it was so delicious I don‚Äôt know if anything can be better‚Ä¶ freshly squeezed orange juice - great taste, not acidic, superb pro matcha, overnight porridge I never thought could be so special, extraordinary avocado toast (of those I‚Äôve had quite a lot, so trust me that this one was top notch), and waffle, the waffle!!! with salted caramel‚Ä¶ oh my mouth, stomach, eyes, everything, so happy, super full for 25‚Ç¨‚Ä¶ I didn‚Äôt eat until dinner‚Ä¶ Merci!!! I need to learn French!; Small but lovely place. Very nice service, great selection of food, coffee and tea. Coffee comes with a choice of plant-based milk if you prefer a vegan option.

We had the chai and coffee latte, and a granola, which was awesome. The bowls and toasts looked awesome, too.

Can recommend!

name: FLUFFY'S - Bakery et brunch
reviews: Good brunch and breakfast spot! I had a brioche style bun with two eggs and one with bacon - it was tasty! The cappuccino was tasty as well. Unfortunately not all options from the menu were available at 09.00am, would have loved to try other ones as well. The menu is available in French but the kind service team helped with choosing.; Amazing place with very good staff. I was impressed. They prepared special gift for my daughter‚Äôs birthday. Fluffy pancakes and avocado toast-must try.Thank you so much; Fluffy has delicious pastry with the perfect texture. Normally, cinnamon rolls are hard to make and they can be dry. However, the one here was soft and moist. Overall, it‚Äôs a great brunch place and cafe. Moreover, the staff were friendly, accommodating and helpful (You wouldn‚Äôt have to lift a finger üòâ).; Stumbled across this gem, glad we did. Owner (lady in photo) kindly explained the French menu to us - we opted for the classics. Heads up sausage / ham in Paris could mean bacon, in this case ours was done perfectly. The croque madame was lovely as well. The cafe uses bread done the Japanese way ‚Äî a favourite of ours. Coffee could afford to be stronger. Overall fabulous. We will return!; Just love this place! Wanted to go there for some time and it was exactly as I expected it to be - fluffy, yummy, and amazing. The food was great, the staff was super friendly and we had a great Sunday brunch. Highly recommend the spinach Fluffy... Was so good!

name: Maison Milie
reviews:
Big surprise!
I find expect much from this place but I couldn't be more wrong! I think it was one of the best shaksuka I've tried! A bit different then the classic one but full of taste and veggies.

The place is very cozy, not too crowded. The dishswere served quickly and the staff was very nice. I highly recommend trying out for a quick lunch.; The service and location are excellent. I loved the presentation of the food as well as the staff. The food was savory and the experience is second to none. The price point is perfect and I will be back soon.; Good brunch. The Matcha is really tasty. The food is good but nothing special. The cafe is in a really good place if you want to visit the Sacr√©-Couer Basilica.; Ordered a mocaccino and iced americano. Drinks are good but they charged 3 extra euros for a ‚Äúcaf√© frapp√©‚Äù when I ordered and received an ice americano. Refused to compensate despite it being on the receipt. Granted they don‚Äôt understand English so avoid if tourist.; Cute cafe in Paris!

Friendly staff made the experience even better. Great food & coffee.

Perfect spot for a cosy weekend brunch!

name: F√©d√©ration internationale des caf√©s des enfants
vicinity: 92 bis Quai de la Loire, Paris
formatted_address: 92 bis Quai de la Loire, 75019 Paris, France
reviews: Very special place for kids! ‚ù§Ô∏è; The ideal place to get together with your children and adults.; Perfect for taking a breather

name: LES TRIPLETTES DE BELLEVILLE
reviews: We highly recommend this restaurant because the food and atmosphere are excellent plus the service is exceptional! Our server and the chef went above and beyond to ensure that our dining experience was five stars. Thank you very much üòä; Okay. I just arrived in Paris after being in Italy for 2 weeks, and this was honestly better than anything I had there! Don‚Äôt tell Italy, but this place is sooo good. I had the coquillettes pasta with ham. They use truffle gouda and it‚Äôs to die for! I ate the whole thing. Finished it with the chocolate cake. The server Juliette was very kind to me and gave me recommendations for things to do while I‚Äôm in Paris. Highly recommend! ; Went here for breakfast. The design looked quite cool and the food was pretty good but we noticed a lot of mouse / rat droppings on the sofa and and on the counters which put us off a lot also the toilet wasn't nice and didn't have any soap which didn't help with the cleanliness feeling.; The breakfast menu consisting of a hot drink, croissant, and fresh orange juice was great. Especially the croissant that was just fresh out of the issue. While the cafe au lait was delicious, the peppermint tea consisted of fresh mint leaves and a bag of green tea. This wasn't great for people who order mint tea specifically because they don't enjoy green tea.; Had a lovely time here. Two friends and I ordered a menu (Formule) and they took a bit too long. They forgot my starter and brought it after the main dish which was messed up too; the steak was half-raw when I like it done. So to compensate, they gave me free desert and only charged me for one dish. Altogether I really appreciate this gesture and I would return.

name: LE CHIEN DE LA LUNE
reviews:
I had made a reservation for a group of 28 people, mostly US students. We had hummus, couscous or chakchuka--an excellent vegetarian option, with merguez (spicy sausages) added on request--, panna cotta infused with fennel (a superb dessert) and chocolate mousse. Service was fast although the place was busy on a Friday evening, with a young waitress who speaks excellent English. Prices were inexpensive for a Parisian restaurant and the chef, Christian, is very friendly. I will certainly return with friends anytime.; The concept is nice, but you notice the place is new and just starting. The wine was to expensive for the qualtiy in my experience.
In the weekend you can't take the menu option, this is only durning the week. Unfortantly it isn't obviouse. They aren't many other things to chose from. We could chose from the burger or a vegertarian dishe. Both were ok, but not what we where hoping for.
You can sit outside but the neighborhood isn't cosy.; Cute place, had a nice lunch here. A little bit outside from the central but I prefer because it‚Äôs nicer and quiet.; Google really worries me, I stopped for lunch and here is big brother watching over my shoulder! Now the restaurant was very good, both in taste and value not to mention a friendly staff. I'll stop over again anytime.; Great ! A good place to have a drink by nibbling something. I recommand.

name: Le P'tit Piano
reviews:
Great food and service! The staff were nice and friendly. We got their sirloin steak with shallot cream and one with morel (mushroom) sauce, and duck breast. We also got the creme brulee, lemon tart and chocolate fondant with ice cream for dessert.; We loved everything here!
The service was great and we were greeted by a smile as soon as we arrived.

Food came out super quickly and was delicious. Great portion as well, so great value for money. Cocktails were tasty and refreshing for these hot summer afternoons.

Ambience was one of the things I liked the most. Soothing and relaxing, allowing for you to properly enjoy your food and take a breath, despite being located in a busy street.

100% recommend.; We decided to try this place out after seeing all the fantastic reviews, but upon arrival, we almost thought we were at the wrong place‚Äîit looked almost like a PMU from the outside! However, stepping inside changed our minds instantly. The interior is surprisingly cute, and it was bustling with energy during our Saturday brunch visit.

There's even a piano set up for their piano nights, adding a charming touch. The staff was incredibly friendly, which made our experience even better.
The food? Absolutely delightful. I had the foie gras and salade p√©rigourdine as starters, which were hearty enough to be mains, followed by the succulent souris d‚Äôagneau. The portions were generous across the board, definitely making it worth the money.

I would heartily recommend this spot and affirm that it truly deserves its high ratings, especially for the quality of the cuisine.; Amazing little gem. Very good food. Very nice staff and they helped me with my gastric bypass needs. Food was delicious steak was a little undercooked because I asked for medium rare but I got rare. No big problem was tasty nonetheless!; Alfredo is great! The dishes he recommended were surprisingly good. We ordered the lamb, goat cheese salad, charcuterie board, and French onion soup. To top off a great dinner he treated us to mint shots that we loved. Give this place a try!

name: Dame Tartine
reviews:
We came across this place totally by chance but what a find. People are incredibly nice, welcoming. The food, homemade, is really good and the meat was excellent. Although area is very touristic, it is the exception and it feels like a local restaurant. Every time we went, most customers were french people which is a great sign. The terrasse experience is really nice; The food was great. I had the veal steak with mashed potatoes and it was awesome. Kids had the beef steak and loved it. Honestly can‚Äôt remember my wife dish name but looked great!
The staff were super friendly and spoke fluent English.; I ordered a beef steak and was surprised when they brought a medium rare. By default in every restaurant I've ever been it's medium.

Medium rare is still smth that I eat but it was unevenly fried and a half of the steak was completely raw. Although I was very hungry raw is not what I can eat.

The waitress didn't even bother to ask why I didn't finish my steak. Overall she looked tired, unhappy and at the same time busy - she was the only one to serve all the tables. It wasn't a peak hour and only about third of the tables is not less were occupied.; Great place with great food. I had the sea bass and a huge portion of profiteroles for dessert. So good.
The place is heaving with people in the evening, it‚Äôs got a very youthful vibe and I like that.
Great selection of drinks too.; Awful service, the guy was rude to customers and slammed our glasses when serving them to us.
Not to mention when my friend asked for the bill he loudly said that he should go inside to pay while shaking his head.
Do not recommend unless you‚Äôre a big fan of cheese and rude people.

name: Les Fils √† Maman Grands-Boulevards
reviews: The vibe here is like travelling back in time to the 70s/80s with decor (cassette tape wall, kid and adult TV series posters and vintage signage) appointed from a time past. The origin story of the restaurant is featured in a spiral bound menu that was provided in addition to the fold-out brunch menu. The formule at 30 euros is a steal. In general, the restaurant offers great value for money. The egg/ham croissant was a 3 for me because of the scrambled egg quality (reminded me of cafeteria powdered eggs) and croissant quality (tough texture). The service is a 3 because the order had to be reconfirmed a few minutes after our drinks were served AND one of our drinks was served ‚Äúvirgin‚Äù in error. The ambience is fun and the guests appeared to be very pleased. Note: the table seating is very cozy; Delicious food and friendly, accommodating staff. Ambiance is nice as well, with plenty of interesting things to look at. We shared a charcuterie/appetizer platter, with deep fried croquettes of cheese, pulled pork and more, along with some sliced salami, pickles and some amazing "fries" made out of chickpeas. For mains, we had the chicken cordon bleu and some kind of mushroom and cheese pastry. They dont have English menus, but the staff was great about explaining things. Give the French IPA a try as well!; On our final night in Paris, my mother was really craving Chicken Cordon Bleu and we were fortunate enough to find it at Les Fils a Maman. Service was great and we really loved the fun, quirky atmosphere. I ordered the Filet Mignon (delish) and the Cosmo Spritzes were great as well!; Very pleasant dinner experience - they accommodate large groups with reservation. The cordon Bleu chicken deserves all good reviews it has. Other dishes are also tasty.; All demands and expectations have been fulfilled. Nice chicken fillet, outstanding homemade drinks. We had a wonderful time.

name: Koff Burger Montmartre
reviews:
This place is by far one of the best burger places! I almost thought we were back in the states! The burger and hot dog were amazing! Definitely can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. I was surprised that there wasn‚Äôt more people in here. We‚Äôll be returning here if we come back to Paris.; Puts 5 guys to shame.

Absolutely 5 stars burger.
Definitely wish I could be back to try the other burger variations.

Went with cheeseburger & wasn't disappointed; I came across KOFF while strolling around Montmartre and was glad I found it. My daughter and I had lunch there and everything was delicious. I had the hamburger which was cooked perfectly medium as I ordered. The fries were among the best I‚Äôve had during my stay. I highly recommend this place.; The food was super tasty and the service was very friendly and attentive.; Yes I was an American that went to an American burger place in France... It was one of the few places open and we figured wth. We were so glad we did! Definitely come here! This was probably one of the best burgers I have had in my life! The fries were excellent too. The service is lacking and it seemed like only two people were working and one disappeared and the other had to pick up the slack. We are also still learning how service really works in France so it may have been a cultural disconnect. But even with that, just go you will not be disappointed. I got the mcFly and my sisters got the bacon cheeseburger, do not expect American level bacon, it was still fantastic though. I don't think you could get a bad burger here.

name: Little Parmentier
reviews:
I had the fish and chips and my wife had the Carnard.  Food was delicious but I am going to echo what others have said, the owner is super friendly, warm and welcoming.  I would gladly come back based on that alone.  Highly recommended for both food and atmosphere.; Am not sure I went to the right Little Parmentier if all the reviews are true!
The steak was rubbery, the salad was manky and the small glass of red was ‚Ç¨7. A real tourist trap! I shouldn't have entered when I saw the place completely empty!
Serves me right for placing my trust in these reviews!; Our first dinner experience in Paris and it was wonderful. The gentleman that was front of house was so nice and helpful. Food itself was also wonderful, cook on the beef was absolutely perfect.; The food is  very good and familiar.
The boss is nice and friendly and the ambiance is calm and relaxed...
The prices are moderate and we can choose some good artisanal beers. We feel at home!; One of the best restaurants in Paris

name: Sacr√© Frenchy !
reviews:
Food was excellent, very tasty dishes. The chicken was amazing, and worth sharing. The happy hour on cocktails was a good deal as well, and delicious cocktails.

Service was not great for our visit, cocktail forgotten, and a 45 minute wait for the main dish after starters. We noticed several other tables having quite some issues with service as well around us. It was not busy or full at the time. A great dining experience turned poor by long waits and off service.

That said, not so bad I wouldn‚Äôt try again, it could be an off day, but the food was great, and service was friendly despite the waits and inattentiveness.; This place was absolutely wonderful! Our waitress, Amelie, was incredibly kind and attentive, making our experience truly exceptional. The food was fantastic, and the cocktails were equally impressive.; I don‚Äôt normally leave a review, but I felt compelled. We had eight people and they accommodated us at the last minute. Our servers name was Emily and she was absolutely phenomenal from picking wine to suggesting entr√©es. The food came on time and it was fantastic. What a great dining Atmosphere experience. if you‚Äôre in this area, don‚Äôt look any further.; Very kid and tourist friendly. The staff were so sweet, and the food was wonderful. I highly recommend their seafood ceviche. Dessert was to die for too. Their cr√®me br√ªl√©e was the table‚Äôs favorite.; My wife and I had our first dinner in this last visit to Paris. My wife is not a ‚Äúlamb food fan‚Äù, and had a steak, while I ordered the ‚Äú7 hour lamb dish‚Äù.
The food was great, cooked to order, and very tasty. Service was great too. With that said, I would like to emphasize the ‚Äú7 hour lamb‚Äù dish that was probably the best lamb dish I had so far. It was adobe style, super duper tasty. It was so good my wife ate more of it than her steak. Since we came for only 3 days to Paris and did not want to go to the same place twice, we went to explore other places in the following g evening. We regret not coming back to have this lamb again. Other dinners were fine too, but this was the most remembered from this trip. Served with spinach warm side dish and (what I believe was) mashed cilantro root. It is a MUST HAVE dish!

name: L'Atelier de LiLi
reviews: The place is small and charming with very good food if you need something for a fast snack‚Ä¶ their concept is cute, like you are entering someone‚Äôs kitchen. A home made Mango juice was super, I like a lot their muffins, so far the best one I‚Äôve tried in Paris‚Ä¶other things we ordered were good as well.; Amazing macarons and coffee. The owners are so friendly, would love to come back next time I'm in town!; Great value, warm welcome as you are part of the family, comes much recommended !!!! Well done guys, see you soon !; The sweetest owners! You can tell the food is made with love üíúü•∞; Short story: despite a good dish the owner tried to steal money from us. She will be very kind to clients she likes probably but she decided to snap at us constantly for no reason. / Long story: The woman who runs this place scams people. All the bad reviews you see are people who have been scammed and who have been scolded at for no reason. She tried to steal 10 euros from us for the mess we left because we were eating with a 1 year old and 3 year old and they spilled crumbs (maybe don‚Äôt run a restaurant if you can‚Äôt handle it?). We were 3 adults sharing 2 expensive meals and an overpriced muffin and two coffees and she charged us 52 euros with an imaginary extra 10 euros for a ‚Äúcocktail‚Äù. We returned to get refunded and she even tried to justify it because of the crumbs. She said ‚ÄúI added 10 euros because of the mess you left‚Äù ‚Äî acknowledging this theft. Imagine you were charged 10 euros extra everywhere you ate because you or your kids left crumbs on the floor? Completely absurd. She chooses to run the place this way scamming those she doesn‚Äôt like. She was super nice to the table next to us and actually telling them she didn‚Äôt like our table‚Ä¶ ?! We even apologised and mentioned the food was good and she said she didn‚Äôt appreciate our ‚Äúpicnic‚Äù (because we shared ‚Ä¶.) and that the crumbs were not ‚Äúserious‚Äù ‚Äî I think some people should change careers if they can‚Äôt handle the most mundane happenings of a restaurant, and be the opposite of kind. Especially if you‚Äôre the owner.

name: EatDay
reviews:
We decided to visit this restaurant based on the good reviews it had on the Fork. We were craving japanese food and noticed they had some special plates. It was really tasty and fresh and very well presented. Our favourite was the gold rolls with mango and the Sushi with cheese and the salad with shrimps.; When I got to this restaurant, it‚Äôs warm ,and food is delicious, must try the sushi ,that‚Äôs yummy; Service was horrible the entire night. We waited over an hour for our food and by the time we got it the entire restaurant was empty. The staff would yell at each other and ignore me. The food was decent, not amazing. Thankfully it was 40% off through The Fork. I‚Äôm definitely not going back and would advise others to avoid.; Really great discovery! You have a great amount of choice in terms of sushis and we were really surprised how tasty it was. You order your food with a tablet which makes it easier. The personnel was also nice. I really recommend to try this place!; Excellent Japanese restaurant at the heart of Paris not far From the center (Chatelet).
The food is very good, the sushi, the sashimi, the California rolls‚Ä¶ etc
Fresh ingredients and homemade!
Outstanding service and lovely staff!
I highly recommend this place

name: Les Enfants Perdus
reviews: we came here three times during our stay in the area. the food is absolutely exquisite. everything is cooked to perfection. service is great. i came and got the exact same meal every night, the veal. i tried veal at two other expensive restaurants, and they were not as good as the one here. the pain perdu is also the best desert..EVER. we will miss this place and will be back next time we‚Äôre in Paris.; Great food with a very cozy atmosphere and  dim lightning. Perfect to catch up with a friend or a date!; A very cosy restaurant, very welcoming and friendly staff. Food is great, I had the beef tartare and foie gras and both are amazing. I wish I could try the escargots but it‚Äôs not the seasons.; Les Enfants Perdus is a hidden gem! The salmon and lasagna were amazing. Perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. Great ambiance and service too. Highly recommend; Services and ambience are very nice!!!! But it‚Äôs a bit packed, literally we touched the people‚Äôs arms next to our table. Food is good.

name: Le Gourbi Palace
reviews: Amazing charm local little spot to have a enjoy a beer listening to live music. A gem ! Family and kids friendly!; Stellar little spot full of charm and good times. Relaxed atmosphere and interesting space. Good selection and decent prices!; Eat and drink with the locals. Very friendly staff, small but interesting menu and great food.; Pleasant honest and friendly. Best Mojito in Paris ? üòâ; Top

name: Les Enfants Rouges
reviews:
This is a cozy little, very compact restaurant in a busy little street of Paris. The food (in my opinion) is good but did not blow my mind nor did I have a gastronomical experience. Its just one of those places that gets popular I guess. The restaurant is really compact and space is scarce to move around. The service is very good, attentive, helpful and prompt. The five stars are for the great service really and not so much for the food - I have had better. Reservations are required in advance as it gets busy. It seems overpriced to me.; Our second time in Les Enfants Rouges was interesting. Definitely reserve your table in advance, the place is packed. Cozy atmosphere. Staff is super nice. Best dish-desert. Both Pavlova and Cheese cake were superb. Lamb chops were delicious. Neither of the entries deserve a mention, thus 4 stars.; Definitely a 5-star and particularly at the reasonable price. Dishes from Les Enfants Rouge and chef-patron Da√Ø Shinozuka. He takes classic French ingredients and adds Japanese flair. Each dish worked well with balanced, nuanced flavours that excited the palate. The rum baba is the best in the world. With one bottle of wine, the cost was just under ‚Ç¨100 a head.
The first time we came was about ten years ago. Standards have not dropped and its popularity is understandable - so book in advance. Five stars! (And the service was good too.); A must stop by place if you‚Äôre in Paris. Modern French cuisine, with a Japanese twist. Everything was absolutely delicious, and the dishes were art pieces. Very friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. Reservation recommended! Great selection of drinks including Japanese cocktails and sake üëå; Blown away by the quality of the lunch course, especially compared to the price. This place at least deserves a bib gourmand imho. The grapefruit lychee dessert was such an ideal assembly of tart, crisp, and sweet - and the textures! All very interesting flavour combinations from both Japanese and French influences. Highly recommended!

name: La Cr√™perie d'Am√©lie
reviews:
this place took my heart‚ù§Ô∏è the coffee is perfect for my taste, and they have 3 kinds of vegan milk)
they also serve good food, bobble tea, matcha and gelato !; The best crepe in the world , that was delicious. We order a Nutella crepe with chocolate and coffee ice cream omg delicious. And also we order coconut ice was like I was young. Amazing; I tried this place on my last morning in Paris and it was by far the best place to have breakfast! The yogurt parfait was made the same day and was very delicious. The egg sandwich was another hit for me as well as the cappuccino! If I ever come back to Paris I will definitely be coming to this place!; A fairly quiet place in the heart of Montmartre, with quite generous and very very tasty menus. Really easy to order your menu with tablets displayed at the entrance,and such a beautiful,quite and warm place to eat.

We decided to repeat and we went today again for the second time on our first visit to Paris (even though being 1h walkingüòÇ) I will recommend it to my friends and family for sure!

We ordered a bacon smash burger,a hot dog and nuggets both days and they were delicious. All of them served by the staff on table on the second floor.

At last,I would like to thank the person in charge (as he already left when we finished) as he recognized us and gave us churros dessert for free to taste them,really good also.

We were really satisfied with your glad and helpful service and will repeat if we come back,thanks a lot!; Perfect crepe for breakfast with fresh orange juice, hot chocolate and coffee - five stars for faty the chef

name: Les Ni√ßois
reviews:
We found this place randomly and it was a nice surprise
Great staff, good food and beer with a reasonable price
Definitely recommend; A mediocre food, combine but a worse service ever, a nasty woman, who refused t serve my table based on her mood. Menu  eclectic not original neither interesting, Overprice and not worth a penny, is a pity they waste such a good location; Quite unusual place, with a real p√©tanque playground and table soccer board game in the basement. The food is nice for lunch, and prices are reasonable. The waiters' kindness and waiting time are greatly varying. For 16 euros, you get a 2 course set (entry + main dish or main dish + desert), with quite good, nice and fresh food, well cooked and well presented. Soups are way too salty though. The interior design is based on French southern style, the city of Nice especially. The window-roof makes the place quite bright.; Good place for brunch but also tapas in the evening. Chill place, very friendly staff, tasty food. Highly recommended for a nice evening with friends (you can play the typical french "P√©tanque" downstairs) or for couples. Will definitely go again !; Small but rather cozy place. Service was good. Food was decent and a really good price for lunch set (according to Paris standards). I paid 16 euros for an appetizer and a main course. They also have a sand pit for petanque and a foosball table downstairs.

name: Foufou
reviews:
I went on a cold Friday in October/24, good food, service and atmosphere too, high point for the musical soundtrack! I enjoyed it! Congratulations to the team that makes this place a great suggestion for a happy hour.; We had breakfast here today.  Service is great & food was very fresh.  We had avocado toast, eggs, bacon, & pancakes.  They serve a nice cabbage salad with the avocado toast.  Good vibe & good American music playing. Def recommend!; Very good breakfast here!
We enjoyed our avocado toast and baguette with jam.
Very nice, English speaking staff üòÅ; Popped by a few times for an espresso! Lovely spot in the marais to sit for a bit and people watch. Staff are nice and I like that it‚Äôs by a little park!; Went for happy hour and was so pleasantly surprised by the aubergine with tahina!
Just wanted a veggie snack and I did not expect it to be warm, with depth of flavors and textures - and also, how pretty it looked! They have many other snack options but I would come back just for that.
They also made any cocktail a mocktail during happy hour for 6‚Ç¨ which was nice.

Great option for happy hour if you want something other than cheese & charcuterie boards.

name: Pomme Home Famille
reviews:
Wonderful place to do yoga and meditation sonore. Very friendly staff. One of the best places to do yoga in Paris.; Pomme Maison is truly the ideal place for your Pilates classes, yoga and many other disciplines for both adults and children.
You can also sit in the beautifully decorated coffee area, have a good coffee prepared by Minerve and above all don't forget to ask for the delicious cookie next to your drink ü•§üç™; Very warm place for women and young mothers who want to do gentle activities.
Varied yoga sessions accessible to all, pilates teacher Mathilde at the top!; Since July 2023, I have been going to Pomme. I tried yoga and Pilates and since September I have been going 3 times a week. Very good teachers, caring and competent in a gentle atmosphere. Having lived in the neighborhood for a long time, thank you to Minerve for this place of relaxation and exchange.; It's a magical place, much more powerful and stronger than a simple caf√© or a yoga room. As a young mother I discovered a bubble of oxygen in my daily life, fleeting encounters with other mothers but which give the strength to face the sometimes difficult daily life with a baby. Precious moments of sharing, kindness, benevolence that I underestimated the need for. And yet I was going backwards... The workshops with babies and other mothers are all great, don't hesitate for a second and push the door!!!

name: Caf√© de l‚Äô√âglise
reviews:
Amazing! Came here twice!!! Must stop to eat and drink! The best crispy goat cheese salad I‚Äôve ever had!! Fantastic espresso martini, wine selection and spritz‚Äôs . The staff is very accommodating and pleasant.
Huge French soup portion for lunch served with warm bread.; Great service, excellent food and good atmosphere. Highly recommend! We had the Church board as a light dinner and French toast and pancakes for dessert, all tasted terrific.; Used this place on our last day in Paris to enjoy a leisurely meal before catching the Eurostar home. The cafe is a short distance from Gare du Nord, has a great view of the Church and is popular with Parisiens. The waiter was very attentive and took our orders, even in our school level French. The Cheese and Cold meat selection was ample and tasty. The Croque Madame and Chicken Croque with a side of Frites also went down a storm. The was no pressure to leave the table and we enjoyed the people watching.; We chanced upon this restaurant while looking for a place for French cuisine near our hotel. We had the best meal throughout our trip in Paris here. The food was served nice and hot. The portion was huge and generous too. We ordered french onion soup, escargot, duck confit and mac & cheese with beef. Special mention to the staff who served us this evening, both the lady and the gentlemen were friendly and polite. They were very observant and paid attention to us, ensuring that we finish our entree before serving us with our mains. We had a great time here!; We had such a nice experience here we went back for dinner after having breakfast there with our family of six (parents + four kids). The food is typical brasserie food at good prices and the service is the nicest in all of Paris! They will make you feel like a local and their warmth will make the experience memorable. We were in a rush for breakfast and they delivered high quality food very quickly. So impressed and so happy to have found this great local spot!

name: Zo√© Bouillon
reviews: Fantastic little bouillon with a local vibe and delicious food. We had the vegetarian blanquette on a cold wintery day and it was pure comfort. Their savory cakes are the perfect accompaniment and the desserts are delish and not too sweet. The staff is friendly and the care they put in their cuisine is apparent. We‚Äôll definitely be back repeatedly!; This is the perfect spot for lunch in this neighborhood! So many delicious options and the staff was so helpful translating the menu into English for me. I would definitely come back here for a delicious, easy lunch (and for the adorable dog who seems to own the restaurant haha).; Very good, hearty meal. Couldn‚Äôt finish all they gave us but really wanted to. Home cooked family style meal. served on plates and bowls. not sure what all the cardboard reviews are about.; this was a little gem during my several month stay in the Belleville neighborhood. I quickly became a regular. It has the warmth & soul of a family run restaurant with healthy reasonably priced meals. (I usually took out the stew) The proprietor helped me with my struggling French as well.. (though I always just said yes to everything she asked) Extra toppings? oui bien sur!  :); Easy, cosy and very good food. Family and kids friendly place, it's just few minutes from Buttes Chaumont Park. The menu is simple, tasty and everything is home made.

name: Les chouettes (Grand Duc)
reviews:
10/12/2024

The staff was super nice and the restaurant had a great feel and theme. The food was good but maybe not great though I think it might be a difference in the steak I grew up with vs here. Basically it's chewy and has been like this at multiple places. I'm betting that France has better laws on how cattle should be treated and better for cows may not equal more tender meat.

Anyway, I still loved the restaurant and would enjoy going back and trying other foods.; The brunch was quite enjoyable and priced at 35 euros. The food was delightful, and the ambiance was perfect. The restaurant wasn't overly crowded or noisy. We chose to sit outside, which was a lovely decision, making our Sunday very relaxing. However, the waiting time was a tad excessive. I'm not sure of the reason, but we waited for over 30 minutes for our food to arrive; Was all in all a pleasant except one of the dishes I was served gave me food poisoning and made me violently ill. I ordered sea bream carpaccio to start which did not taste fresh and scallop risotto for main which was pleasant. Around 20 minutes after the meal I become very unwell and was stuck in my bed for 2 days; Yes, the pictures look good but the food itself is horrible! I had so much high expectations for this place from the pictures I previously saw but ended up being disappointing. The food looks old and not fresh, tried the poulpe salad, not good, the octopus didn‚Äôt look fresh and the salad itself was not tasty. Next, the fish fillet with vegetables, the fish was ok but some vegetables went bad and had to spit it out as I didn‚Äôt want to end up with a food intoxication. To finish, the creme br√ªl√©e was ok but too much sugar on top or they didn‚Äôt take the time to burn it all and ended up with big pieces of raw sugar in the mouth. The staff was lovely and the space is really nice. It‚Äôs such a waste to serve such poor quality food in such a beautiful space. I would seriously invest in finding a better chef or whoever is responsible of the menu !; Went for my birthday as a surprise! And the Sunday brunch was absolutely amazing - the freshest seasonal vegetables, fish, the lemon cake - oh my! I also had some white wine - Chablis and tried their fois gras. Everything was  excellent presented and tasted great. Our waiter was very kind and spoke bothe French and English. The spot wasn't as packed as many of the other restaurants in le marais which made it even more special. And the decor is perfect for a special event.

name: Le Centenaire
reviews:
Wonderful neighborhood spot to have a hearty french breakfast and people watch plus a great view of the Eiffel Tower at anytime during the day.
Our server was super friendly, attentive and allowed us to practice our French.
Everything was freshly made and delicious!; Lovely atmospheric small restaurant/cafe.
Tasty, simple French cuisine at very reasonable prices. Friendly attentive staff. Highly recommended.; Such a wonderful evening here! Incredible service provided by Yannick and co! I had the steak which was cooked to perfection!Also at the moment they have oysters at the weekend that are absolutely divine! This is my new go to by R√©publique!; Great place to have  a true French Bistro experience. We had the cheese plate and Veggie salad. Delicious!; Overall it was not a bad experience visiting this restaurant. But not the best. Service - normal.
Dishes - big portions, personally everything was too greasy for me. But everything was good in view of the prices.

name: Twinkie Breakfast & Lunch
reviews: Overall this is a nice place but too expensive for brunch. Most items on the menu are over 30‚Ç¨ and while the portions are not small it does not feel like good value for money. We had the Avo toast and the eggs Benedict. Both were very tasty and they offer gluten free bread. The service was a bit slow but friendly. While I enjoyed the meal I wouldn‚Äôt come back at that price.; Twinkie Breakfast & Lunch is a charming and welcoming spot. The American-style food was average, but the cafe itself, coupled with friendly service, made for a pleasant experience. A special shoutout to the adorable Pomeranian that added a unique touch to the ambiance! A nice place to relax and enjoy a meal, even if the dishes aren‚Äôt particularly standout. Worth a visit for the furry friend!; Loved the food and the vibe! Best meal in Paris!! A tad over priced but worth it.; So, Twinkies is nice.  I think they cater to the American crowd, but the only thing American here were the prices.  Some of the meals were 29 euro.  We've been really wowed with many of the meals in Paris and this just hit flat.  The cafe does have dogs though, which is nice.  It just didn't live to the hype for me.  Also, the pancake is cornmeal?  Did not feel it.; Such a good breakfast place! I got the avo toast and a pancake, and they were both AMAZING!! The bread was so fresh and the avocado was seasoned nicely. The pancake was super fluffy and delicious. I also got a vanilla iced coffee and it was very nice but didn‚Äôt really taste like coffee much.

name: Aux Deux Ecus
formatted_address: 1 Pl. des Deux Ecus, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
We just pass by and decide to have a lunch. Waiter, Jose, was amazing and rest of staff too. We took daily menu and all dishes was super tasty. We were surprised with salad which was amazing. We have nice time there and hope to come back.; In an adventure to find desert after a long travel day. We stumbled upon this place. They had their menu posted outside so we were able to explore before we walked in.

It was a cold night so we chose to sit inside, but many parties were sitting outside.

Thank God our server spoke English, this was a huge plus.

We started with a Mojito and a Sex on the Beach. Drinks were strong and refreshing. For dessert I ordered the "Brioche perdue" (French Toast) and Honey had the "Cr√™pe miel" (Honey Crepe).

My goodness! I melted after the first bite of the "Brioche perdue". It was so light and bursting with subtle sweet flavors. Honey said her crepe was light, good mixture of fluffy and crispy, and the honey was a perfect addition of sweetness.

We didn't have any food, but the desert and the drinks are worth the trip.; Good brunch and lovely service.

Visited in May 2024; Me and my friend have had a tasty brunch over here. Quiche and other food was very tasty but the cups were poorly cleaned. Unfortunately they dont have bags for leftovers. However they provided their apologies for that and asked several times whether everything was fine.; We came across this restaurant quite by chance.  A really pleasant atmosphere, a varied menu of food and drinks. We really appreciate the water and chips we got from home. Also, very friendly staff and the best burger we've tried so far in Paris.  Any recommendation from us!  Keep it up, you're great!

name: Santa Lyna
reviews:
I loved this place! I had the Chicken Waffle, the almond butter chai latte, and fresh OJ. Highly recommend - I even tried their sister restaurant the day after, which was just as good. The service was great ‚Äî thanks so much to Gabriel and Cesar. Will definitely be back.; No reservations. You have to stand in line

Some interesting twist to you‚Äôre usual brunch favorites. They look good & taste even better

It does get very very busy on weekends. So if you‚Äôre a tourist take time into account; No reservation. Expect stand in a line for at least 20 Minutes. Great decor, funky vibe, fancy brunch, instagramable food and huge portions.; Great place, nice vibes and good food. The portions were really big for the price! Also the iced strawberry matcha was super good. I loved the chicken waffle it was amazing!; The vibes were absolutely amazing. Great food, amazing concept, diverse menu, cool decor and great staff. Everyone was very accommodating, even to special requests. Overall we all had a great time here 2 days in a row. That‚Äôs how great it was. (Side note the music was amazing too).

name: Aire de jeux pour enfants du Jardin Villemin
reviews: Convenient location next to Gare de l‚ÄòEst, making it a nice stop for families waiting on a train. The play equipment is basic but varied and there‚Äôs a well-kept park next to it. Lots of benches to sit on.; Great place for kids bw 2 to 6 took my son there right next to gare dl est; A great space close to the Gare l'est, free toilets too.; Very nice park with plenty of stuff for the children to do and have plenty of fun.; Kids

name: Neni Paris
reviews:
What a great find! Right opposite Gare de nord. Up above the hustle and bustle of the busy Paris streets below, a gorgeous haven of beautiful interiors with delicious food! Fabulous combination! All the dishes were delicious. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend.; Went this week for an early lunch with a colleague.
Location is great, especially if somebody has to catch a train from gare du Nord
The food was delicious ‚Äì every dish we chose was full of flavor and a different experience. we chose tapas style by taking several starters: Falafel, artichoke, fish carpaccio, and a side of potato skins.
This was not my first time ‚Äì each time the food has been great.
The service has varied in the past, but it was very good on this most recent visit

The photo was taken from the window so I could help my colleague find the restau.
For first time visitors it can be hard to find as it is inside the hotel

Reservation was v easy to make through their website online; Our whole family of eight enjoyed a delicious meal this evening. The waiter was excellent, funny, charming, prompt and made us all laugh with his personality. We had the best chicken shawarma we've ever had and the kids who had the kebab felt the same. The meal was finished with an unexpected complimentary dessert plate.  The best food we've had in Paris over our 2 weeks stay.; It's SO good! I had very limited time and they recommended what would be the quickest - salmon - and I don't know how, but it was just amazing. Very beautiful, very chill, extremely reasonable prices! I wish I has more time and I will definitely come back üòç It's also quite easy to find - go to the big gate, then up the stairs, then to the left and here you are :) You can also ask for something to go; The whole experience was just amazing, starting from the very professional and polite staff‚Ä¶ to the super tasty food! Mauricio was extremely nice with us and his recommendations made our dinner even more exceptional üëèüèª

We had the entrec√¥te and there were delicious, juicy as it supposed to be and just perfect! üòç üî•

We will be definitely back, as soon as possible ü´∂üèª

name: LES FARFADETS PARIS
reviews:
Their salads are fantastic whether you're vegetarian or not!; Very good and cheap food. Friendly staff; üëç; I had a sandwich and a salmon quiche.
the sandwich was good, but the bread seemed industrial to me.

Likewise, for the quiche: bad surprise I came across a bacon quiche when I had ordered a salmon one... a slight disappointment especially since the quiche dough was much too soft to have taken out of the oven.; Having been faithful almost every day I can guarantee you that this place is just great, varied products and very, very good! I'm going to miss the leprechaun! Your former neighbor üòã

name: Restaurant Discovery Food
reviews:
I came here excited to try their food, but once I began ordering that changed (I‚Äôm only visiting so my French is very little) tried to order what I could In French and the rest id point, the lady was so rude mumbling under her breath like ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt speak French‚Äù very rudely which I understood Because I understand French. I so No, sorry. I continued to order and she continued to be very rude to me, so I just Left. Just because you feel miserable doesn‚Äôt mean you have to treat others horribly.; By far the best food place!! Here you can get freshly prepared dishes at fair prices. If you are looking for a delicious and healthy lunch, this restaurant is the best in the area. Moreover, the staff is super friendly!; It looks beautiful and tastes good. The seating is so small and it's crowded as there were only 2 people trying to do everything. Great service though. I bought a sandwich which tasted good. I'll try visiting again !; Finally a restaurant that understands what we really need in Paris!
Being able to eat a balanced diet, with a wide choice, for a reasonable price!
Thanks to the managers, the atmosphere is very pleasant and intimate, I recommend!

@LVS.kid; Excellent place, I highly recommend! Thank you to the very friendly and helpful duo of ladies who received us.

name: La Fontaine Cuvier Restaurant
reviews:
Everyone knows French food is delicious but I wasn't expecting to get fantastic burgers in Paris! Stopped in randomly for dinner and this burger and fries was perfection. There's a whisper of garlic on the fries that's soooo good and the caramelized onions in the burger were delicious. Definitely recommend.; I have eaten here twice in the last two nights and found the staff to be very friendly and the food was delicious . I had salmon in a crispy pastry with beautifully cooked vegetables in a sumptuous sauce and a medium rare beef dish with excellent fries and salad. The white wine and rose were wonderful too. Great atmosphere and music. I will be back :-); Great resto just next to the Jardin des plantes. Our 2nd time here and food was good and service right on.; We had amaizing evenings in this restaurant with real parisian view and vibe.
We had french fries and mousse au chocolat which was delicious but contained a little bit of lumps.
But we would definetely come back.; Delicious burgers. Close to the Jardin de Plants. The restaurant is on the corner of a street and easy to miss if you're coming from the north side. But if you do spot it, you'll will find a small restaurant that cooks your meal where you can see it from the outside terrace. The burgers are to die for, great taste. The lady serving us was very eager to help and explained everything to us in English. The restaurant is on a corner of a busy street though, which is not ideal, but probably worth it.

name: Candle Kids
reviews:
This is by far the best coffee shop in town!!!
Staff is super friendly, food is delicious and coffee is just amazing.
Highly recommended.; Adorable coffeeshop with a lot of space and tables both inside and outside. There are two zones for laptops. The coffee is great. Cinnamon roll is recommended!; good neighborhood coffee shop in the 20th arrondissement! we got the hojicha latte & cardamom bun ‚Äî both really good!! great place to catch up with friends.even though the place is full (even outside), the people really come and go so it‚Äôs easy to grab a table in just a few minutes wait!; Great coffee place, can recommend üëç
One of the ¬´¬†new style¬†¬ª chic Parisian cafes that you see here and there, and everywhere if you know what to look for. Which is good.; Friendly and warm little cafe in Belleville! This has been my go-to coffee shop during my stay in Paris, hands down! Best coffee and its made with L-O-V-E.  Fresh OJ, wonderful pastries and a lively environment to read or just people watch. Also, the cutest dogs hang out there. I highly recommend.

name: Caf√© Klin
reviews:
Highly recommend l!! A really nice caf√© with loads of veggie options. They also serve Natural wine and have a great selection of fresh juice and craft beer.
A must to try when you are around Republique area in Paris. 5 stars.; I am not vegan but I find the food in this little caf√© absolutely delicious. I had a taster meal (5 courses) and everything was fresh and tasty. Staff is very nice. You can even seat outside. I will come back; One of my best cafes for breakfast in the morning. An active atmosphere. And their service is good. And a special thanks to the restaurant manager. I will be back to visit again.; Cute interior, a bit dirty, the coffee was good. The selection of pastry was a bit small but it was ok.; An excellent cafe, super friendly staff. Highly recommended !

name: Little Babel
reviews:
Visited twice while I was in Paris.

Service is some of the best I received while in Paris. Very welcoming and friendly. Great atmosphere and decor. And most importantly a lot of effort and love goes into their food.
Would recommend!; The food was absolutely delicious and we can confidently call it one of the best pizzas we‚Äôve ever eaten. The service was supreme and the atmosphere was cozy. We 100 percent recommend this place and would come back every time!!
merci beaucoup; Absolutely the best pizza we have ever eaten!  We are from Connecticut which is viewed as having the best pizza in the USA and this totally tops it!  Perfectly delicious!; Nestled in the heart of Paris, Little Babel Pizza is a culinary treasure. This quaint establishment, though small in size, delivers a gastronomic experience that is both delightful and memorable. Their pizza, crafted with a perfect blend of flavors and cooked to crispy perfection, stands out as a must-try for any food lover. But the delights don‚Äôt end there ‚Äì their pasta and spaghetti dishes are equally commendable, each plate offering a taste of authentic Italian cuisine.

What makes Little Babel Pizza truly special is the worthiness of the wait. Each dish is prepared with care, ensuring that every bite is a testament to their dedication to quality and taste. To top off the dining experience, their coffee is exceptional ‚Äì rich in flavor and the perfect endnote to a satisfying meal. Little Babel Pizza is more than just a restaurant; it‚Äôs an experience that encapsulates the essence of Parisian charm and culinary excellence.; AWESOME PIZZA!!! This is most likely the best pizza in Paris! We have been all over Italy and this is right up there with the best pizza in Italy. In a quiet cozy part of the city. The owners are super nice and fun! Its a must go to!

name: La Poulette de Grain
formatted_address: 261 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
Top Service and good food in this exquisite Parisienne Bistro.

The waiter was very acommodating, extraordinarily friendly and helpful with our requests and explained the menu nicely.

The onion soup was very good.
The steak was okay, but they have nice fries & sauces. The creme brul√©e was delicious!

Can recommend!; As a New Yorker coming to Paris coming to this restaurant was simply fantastic. It was great fast service and the waiters were kind funny and gracious. I will definitely come back here again and they say open after midnight, which is fantastic.; The most delicious onion soup I've tried! Must have to order!
The rest of the food was tasty as well.
Prices are also very good.
I will definitely come back.; Very cozy atmosphere, friendly and passionate staff. Food quality is all we could ever ask for. Roast chicken is extremely tender and juicy, paired with flavorful sauce. We also have the duck parmentier, ribs and sea bass, all of them are delicious! We were served with an aromatic mint tea afterwards, which soothed our full bellies.
Overall, very good experience, 200% will come again when we travel to Paris!; Highly recommend. Delicious food, excellent service and great prices. Merci!

name: LES TRIPLETTES DE BELLEVILLE
reviews: We highly recommend this restaurant because the food and atmosphere are excellent plus the service is exceptional! Our server and the chef went above and beyond to ensure that our dining experience was five stars. Thank you very much üòä; Okay. I just arrived in Paris after being in Italy for 2 weeks, and this was honestly better than anything I had there! Don‚Äôt tell Italy, but this place is sooo good. I had the coquillettes pasta with ham. They use truffle gouda and it‚Äôs to die for! I ate the whole thing. Finished it with the chocolate cake. The server Juliette was very kind to me and gave me recommendations for things to do while I‚Äôm in Paris. Highly recommend! ; Went here for breakfast. The design looked quite cool and the food was pretty good but we noticed a lot of mouse / rat droppings on the sofa and and on the counters which put us off a lot also the toilet wasn't nice and didn't have any soap which didn't help with the cleanliness feeling.; The breakfast menu consisting of a hot drink, croissant, and fresh orange juice was great. Especially the croissant that was just fresh out of the issue. While the cafe au lait was delicious, the peppermint tea consisted of fresh mint leaves and a bag of green tea. This wasn't great for people who order mint tea specifically because they don't enjoy green tea.; Had a lovely time here. Two friends and I ordered a menu (Formule) and they took a bit too long. They forgot my starter and brought it after the main dish which was messed up too; the steak was half-raw when I like it done. So to compensate, they gave me free desert and only charged me for one dish. Altogether I really appreciate this gesture and I would return.

name: L'Atelier de LiLi
reviews: The place is small and charming with very good food if you need something for a fast snack‚Ä¶ their concept is cute, like you are entering someone‚Äôs kitchen. A home made Mango juice was super, I like a lot their muffins, so far the best one I‚Äôve tried in Paris‚Ä¶other things we ordered were good as well.; Amazing macarons and coffee. The owners are so friendly, would love to come back next time I'm in town!; Great value, warm welcome as you are part of the family, comes much recommended !!!! Well done guys, see you soon !; The sweetest owners! You can tell the food is made with love üíúü•∞; Short story: despite a good dish the owner tried to steal money from us. She will be very kind to clients she likes probably but she decided to snap at us constantly for no reason. / Long story: The woman who runs this place scams people. All the bad reviews you see are people who have been scammed and who have been scolded at for no reason. She tried to steal 10 euros from us for the mess we left because we were eating with a 1 year old and 3 year old and they spilled crumbs (maybe don‚Äôt run a restaurant if you can‚Äôt handle it?). We were 3 adults sharing 2 expensive meals and an overpriced muffin and two coffees and she charged us 52 euros with an imaginary extra 10 euros for a ‚Äúcocktail‚Äù. We returned to get refunded and she even tried to justify it because of the crumbs. She said ‚ÄúI added 10 euros because of the mess you left‚Äù ‚Äî acknowledging this theft. Imagine you were charged 10 euros extra everywhere you ate because you or your kids left crumbs on the floor? Completely absurd. She chooses to run the place this way scamming those she doesn‚Äôt like. She was super nice to the table next to us and actually telling them she didn‚Äôt like our table‚Ä¶ ?! We even apologised and mentioned the food was good and she said she didn‚Äôt appreciate our ‚Äúpicnic‚Äù (because we shared ‚Ä¶.) and that the crumbs were not ‚Äúserious‚Äù ‚Äî I think some people should change careers if they can‚Äôt handle the most mundane happenings of a restaurant, and be the opposite of kind. Especially if you‚Äôre the owner.

name: Caf√© Restaurant L‚ÄôArrosoir
reviews: Quite big portion for regular Asian. For me the dish is better with a bit of salt and pepper. 1 salad and 1 steak should be fine for 2 person. They offer free drinking water.; Lovely place under the arches of the Promenade Plantee. Good value, very friendly service and lovely food. The fried goats cheese is amazing. And so is the cr√®me camarel!; Excellent place to sit on the patio and enjoy a fantastic meal. Started with croque-monsieur on brushetta followed by a salad Cesar and croque-monsieur, salad. All with a paname barge du canal IPA to wash it down.; Very pleasant staff. Good location. Nice vibe. Bad food. It was unfortunately most unpleasant. Avoid unless you're starving.; Very nice place to eat. Food here is very fresh and good quality. Very good selection deserts and wine. Definitely worth to step in and try.

name: Le kiosque "M√©nagerie" jardin des plantes
reviews:
During my visit to the food kiosk, I was pleasantly surprised by some aspects that I think are worth highlighting despite the negative reviews I had read before.

First of all, the variety of the menu is impressive. There is a wide choice of dishes, which allows you to satisfy different desires and tastes. I particularly enjoyed the toasted chicken sandwich, which was well seasoned and cooked to perfection. The freshness of the ingredients was also notable.

The service was friendly and welcoming. Although the booth was quite busy, the staff was professional and courteous. My meal was served in a timely manner, and I appreciated the team's efforts to ensure customers were satisfied.; Very pleasant setting. The kiosk is well placed, and I ate very well. Contrary to what I read in the comments, for my part everything went very well. The waiter who took my order was kind and smiling throughout our exchange. I was served quickly and in a polite manner. I recommend this kiosk.; Very very slow because it is disorganized, the service is shared between the menagerie and the rest of the park. the ‚Äúfresh daily‚Äù bagel bore the date of the day before and was dry and very lightly filled. In short, don't waste your time, go get a salad at the nearby supermarket, it will be better and cheaper.; Opinions are not taken into account but, it is not clean, very long and the only waiter works without health protection...And as a bonus, at 12:45 p.m. there are no more sandwiches...0; To flee. Waffles not made at home, very very expensive, that's why the terrace is empty, the sun is beating down but the young lady closes the parasols under the authority of her manager.
Going to a nearby Monoprix is ‚Äã‚Äãbetter.

name: DICE Caff√®
vicinity: 11 Rue du Pas de la Mule, Paris
formatted_address: 11 Rue du Pas de la Mule, 75004 Paris, France
reviews:
This place is a hidden gem next to more well known restaurants. We were lucky enough to walk in, unlike most other spots in the area. The service is amazing and the food is incredible. It‚Äôs a small menu, but it‚Äôs perfect for a date night. The ambiance is superb. I would totally recommend this place to everyone, but we don‚Äôt want it to get overrun like everything else in this neighborhood. Go here before it gets too famous.; It was really nice lunch with two of my friends. Healthy and light, and I loved that there are selected menu for a few days. I have issues with choosing the menu, but there were not too many options, so it was easier. I had the haddock fish with aubergine caviar, and it was really tasty and good portion than it seemed. The place was cute and the staff was nice. I'd like to come back :); Had a great customer experience. Simple, tasteful menu. Good food, wine selection and friendly atmosphere. I'll be back!; 4,9/5
EXCELLENT ! EXCELLENT ! EXCELLENT !
Wandering the streets looking for a nice address, we found this cozy joint next to place des Vosges, with a sunday brunch menu !
Very nice and not-cramped restaurant, few tables with spacious seating, wood decor, simple and heartwarming !
The owner (Diego) is a super friendly Italian from Parma, he handles the bar, his wife is the kitchen boss (super friendly as well, graced me with the honour of best client of the week ;)
We tried the 3 brunch main courses, and they were all 3 DELICIOUS !
Eggs with salmon, potato galette with cream cheese.
My favourite was the bun with mozzarella and coppa di parma ; incredibly tasty
and the 3rd and most original was pupkin pancakes with cheese, topped with beets and salad !
Simple, tasty, and copious !
Their juices were really good too ; I tried the refreshing apple, cucumber, lemon shake !
A must try address, e !ven if to grab a simple coffee.; A lovely place. We stumbled upon it for lunch and for 23 EUR had a 3 course menu with generous portions. The food is delicious and the staff lovely. The place is also nicely decorated and definitely worth a visit :)

name: Crepolog
reviews:
Hi Crepolog!
Nice galettes. Very fast service. The ingredients were fresh, I was surprised by the oregano (great touch on the recipe in my opinion). Maybe one note would be the butter amount, which as we all know can never be enough!
Okay, another note for possible improvement: the menu. The font isn‚Äôt really readable, in my view at least :)
Plus points for the sitting, spacious and not crammed (üëç) and the location‚Äîconvenient!
I would like to leave 5 stars to award the work and encourage the future improvements. I would like to come by Crepolog again for a galette in the future again to update my review :); Some of the best food we had in Paris! The staff was very attentive and the crepes and galletes were delicious!; Not bad, exactly how I expected them to taste like; Cr√™pes are the focus of this place and they‚Äôre very good. I tried two sweet ones ‚Äì the traditional lemon, and the dark chocolate. Both were very good. I‚Äôm going to go back and try the savory ones. Also, the men there were very welcoming. It was a nice experience on a rainy day in Paris!; This lovely owner owned restaurant allows you to create your own galettes and crepes from a list of ingredients. The waiters are super helpful. We tried different galettes and dessert crepes all were excellent! The prices are reasonable.

name: Little Parmentier
reviews:
I had the fish and chips and my wife had the Carnard.  Food was delicious but I am going to echo what others have said, the owner is super friendly, warm and welcoming.  I would gladly come back based on that alone.  Highly recommended for both food and atmosphere.; Am not sure I went to the right Little Parmentier if all the reviews are true!
The steak was rubbery, the salad was manky and the small glass of red was ‚Ç¨7. A real tourist trap! I shouldn't have entered when I saw the place completely empty!
Serves me right for placing my trust in these reviews!; Our first dinner experience in Paris and it was wonderful. The gentleman that was front of house was so nice and helpful. Food itself was also wonderful, cook on the beef was absolutely perfect.; The food is  very good and familiar.
The boss is nice and friendly and the ambiance is calm and relaxed...
The prices are moderate and we can choose some good artisanal beers. We feel at home!; One of the best restaurants in Paris

name: Brunch Paris
reviews: Correct, lots of choice, good products and unlimited üòâto do for Brunch lovers; Several incredible addressesü•∞;

name: Wonderland brunchy Notre Dame/ Restaurant Brunch
reviews:
Super good food ! Yummy and looks so pretty. We were well received and served with a smile (so important in Paris right ? üòá)
It‚Äôs a little more expensive than we thought but you get what you pay for. Around 18‚Ç¨ for a main. We shared pancakes after so it came out to about 28‚Ç¨ pp for a drink a main and a shared dessert.
Toilets clean, coffee is pretty good, I got a very original drawing on line which made me very happy !; Absolutely amazing brunch spot! We went here every day during our trip in Paris because it was so good. The staff was so kind and friendly to us, especially the server (wish we had asked her name). Highly recommend the eggs Benedict, purple pancakes, and purple french toast. If you want to avoid waiting, go on weekdays or get there when they open on weekends. We loved it!; Best impressions! Food is always delicious, my favorite place for brunch dishes in Paris! Located in the great spot as well! The service is very kind and friendly. Thank you for your always welcoming attitude and honesty.; Food was excellent! Everything that we tried was tasty. Portions were big. Staff was friendly and helpful. But it was 26 degrees outside, you can sit only inside and it was too hot.
All in all it was a very pleasant experience! Thank you!; Me and my friend had the purple french toast, which was amazing!! She already had it before and had to come back to get it.

Also the staff were so lovely and gave us great tips for Paris as a first-timer ü§ç

name: Le Gourbi Palace
reviews: Amazing charm local little spot to have a enjoy a beer listening to live music. A gem ! Family and kids friendly!; Stellar little spot full of charm and good times. Relaxed atmosphere and interesting space. Good selection and decent prices!; Eat and drink with the locals. Very friendly staff, small but interesting menu and great food.; Pleasant honest and friendly. Best Mojito in Paris ? üòâ; Top

name: Les Enfants Rouges
reviews:
This is a cozy little, very compact restaurant in a busy little street of Paris. The food (in my opinion) is good but did not blow my mind nor did I have a gastronomical experience. Its just one of those places that gets popular I guess. The restaurant is really compact and space is scarce to move around. The service is very good, attentive, helpful and prompt. The five stars are for the great service really and not so much for the food - I have had better. Reservations are required in advance as it gets busy. It seems overpriced to me.; Our second time in Les Enfants Rouges was interesting. Definitely reserve your table in advance, the place is packed. Cozy atmosphere. Staff is super nice. Best dish-desert. Both Pavlova and Cheese cake were superb. Lamb chops were delicious. Neither of the entries deserve a mention, thus 4 stars.; Definitely a 5-star and particularly at the reasonable price. Dishes from Les Enfants Rouge and chef-patron Da√Ø Shinozuka.
