He takes classic French ingredients and adds Japanese flair. Each dish worked well with balanced, nuanced flavours that excited the palate. The rum baba is the best in the world. With one bottle of wine, the cost was just under ‚Ç¨100 a head.
The first time we came was about ten years ago. Standards have not dropped and its popularity is understandable - so book in advance. Five stars! (And the service was good too.); A must stop by place if you‚Äôre in Paris. Modern French cuisine, with a Japanese twist. Everything was absolutely delicious, and the dishes were art pieces. Very friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. Reservation recommended! Great selection of drinks including Japanese cocktails and sake üëå; Blown away by the quality of the lunch course, especially compared to the price. This place at least deserves a bib gourmand imho. The grapefruit lychee dessert was such an ideal assembly of tart, crisp, and sweet - and the textures! All very interesting flavour combinations from both Japanese and French influences. Highly recommended!

name: Breakfast in America - Marais
reviews:
I found this place while looking for a good Full English Breakfast in Paris. Spoiler alert: instead of finding an English breakfast, I found an American one.

The products don't exactly match the UK ones 100%, but I shouldn't have expected that anyway. The food was good and full of calories ‚Äî as it should be! ;) The burger and desserts were also nice, and the restaurant has a great American vibe. If that's what you like, you should definitely visit.; Potatoes were crispy, eggs scrambled perfectly, the banana french toast was delicioussss. Much needed breakfast satisfaction.; We went to a small, charming breakfast place with our baby. The staff was polite, friendly, and helpful. However, the prices were a bit high for some items. We had asked for coffee, and they brought it with milk. They also refilled the second cup for free. I think it was a nice gesture of good service to refill the coffee twice.; A small but very welcoming place to have American dinner.
A very fluke that our waiter forgot my milk for my coffee but totally understandable as the place was really busy and he was on his own I believe.
Overall our family would highly recommend this place if your looking for  English speaking breakfast and have a usual American breakfast; Good restaurant overall. Server was very nice and polite.
Quesadilla was a little overcooked and didn‚Äôt have much cheese.  Salad was very tasty and chicken bowl was good.

name: Les Ni√ßois
reviews:
We found this place randomly and it was a nice surprise
Great staff, good food and beer with a reasonable price
Definitely recommend; A mediocre food, combine but a worse service ever, a nasty woman, who refused t serve my table based on her mood. Menu  eclectic not original neither interesting, Overprice and not worth a penny, is a pity they waste such a good location; Quite unusual place, with a real p√©tanque playground and table soccer board game in the basement. The food is nice for lunch, and prices are reasonable. The waiters' kindness and waiting time are greatly varying. For 16 euros, you get a 2 course set (entry + main dish or main dish + desert), with quite good, nice and fresh food, well cooked and well presented. Soups are way too salty though. The interior design is based on French southern style, the city of Nice especially. The window-roof makes the place quite bright.; Good place for brunch but also tapas in the evening. Chill place, very friendly staff, tasty food. Highly recommended for a nice evening with friends (you can play the typical french "P√©tanque" downstairs) or for couples. Will definitely go again !; Small but rather cozy place. Service was good. Food was decent and a really good price for lunch set (according to Paris standards). I paid 16 euros for an appetizer and a main course. They also have a sand pit for petanque and a foosball table downstairs.

name: La Poulette de Grain
formatted_address: 261 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
Top Service and good food in this exquisite Parisienne Bistro.

The waiter was very acommodating, extraordinarily friendly and helpful with our requests and explained the menu nicely.

The onion soup was very good.
The steak was okay, but they have nice fries & sauces. The creme brul√©e was delicious!

Can recommend!; As a New Yorker coming to Paris coming to this restaurant was simply fantastic. It was great fast service and the waiters were kind funny and gracious. I will definitely come back here again and they say open after midnight, which is fantastic.; The most delicious onion soup I've tried! Must have to order!
The rest of the food was tasty as well.
Prices are also very good.
I will definitely come back.; Very cozy atmosphere, friendly and passionate staff. Food quality is all we could ever ask for. Roast chicken is extremely tender and juicy, paired with flavorful sauce. We also have the duck parmentier, ribs and sea bass, all of them are delicious! We were served with an aromatic mint tea afterwards, which soothed our full bellies.
Overall, very good experience, 200% will come again when we travel to Paris!; Highly recommend. Delicious food, excellent service and great prices. Merci!

name: M.A.D Waffles Chicken Burgers
reviews:
Delicious food in good price and amazing, friendly, English speaking staff! Also special order request for pregnant ladies taken into account! üôå; Fantastique! food was amazing as well as the price. Great and fast services. English speaking. Very welcoming. Burgers, chicken wings, chicken tenders, and fries ordered, we didn't have room to try the waffles, but they looked very good.
Highly recommend.; Found this restaurant the day before I leave France!!!! So good and tasty TT never thought waffle would be great as burger buns!!!!! üçî gonna miss'em back home TT; Very good place for a nice burger or chicken tenders and the waffle and chicken is amazing!!; It was so great there! Burger, Fries & a Drink for a very fair Price! It was super Taste and the Service was sooo friendly:) loved it there

name: Jango
reviews:
We just didn't like the food, and the service was bad as well. It seemed everyone is way too busy to attend everyone else, and even giving a menu is a task for them. The menu almost thrown at the table, which seemed very impolite. The food lacked any kind of flavour for us, didn't like it at all. The pizza with artichokes and aubergine tasted awful.; We sat out on the terrace where there was a great atmosphere of local Parisians eating and drinking, many with their children. The steak and chips that our children shared came quickly and they loved it. They happily swapped potatoes for chips for them. Our starters and main courses were classic french cuisine and were delicious. The standout was the pasta shells with mushrooms and truffles. The truffles were extremely vibrant tasting. Worth going out of your way for this, especially with kids.; Highly recommend the brunch 26$. Big portions and really fresh ingredients. I loved everything I had and the price was just right. We stayed on the covered terrasse. It was nice to people watch.; Authentic delicious food !; Beautiful decor !
Great food, wide selection of dishes. Special mention to the pizza‚Äôs fluffy dough and tiramisu.
Service could be better though

name: Good Lunch
reviews:
Very good quality and tasty food, above else better than the competition in that intersection (those big franchises), that's something!
Friendly and polite personnel.; Good food, good people; The worst kebab I ever had in France‚Ä¶.; I got what I was looking for - good food for good price, nothing fancy.; Corerect

name: Le Zarafa
vicinity: parc zoologique de paris, 306 Avenue Daumesnil, Paris
formatted_address: parc zoologique de paris, 306 Av. Daumesnil, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
I found the food of high pricing considering the taste and quality of ingredients. The beef burger platter was not tasty . The chicken strips pieces were not fulfilling i had to request to add an extra piece . The ch√®vre salad was tiny . The veggie soup with croutons was a healthy option.
Its sort of cafeteria in a zoo for kids and families they should consider lowering prices to make it affordable‚Ä¶; Impossible to find a place to sit outside, because visitors of the zoo come with their own food and take the places, for example, mother and 2 kids take 2 tables!  Either need to add more tables or reserve tables only for guests of the restaurant.; On the expensive side for what's offered, this restaurant charges around ‚Ç¨12 for a main and drink, on a pay first, then collect basis. There is no table service, and you are expected to clean up after yourself, putting your organics in bin #1, plastics in bin #2 and so forth, and the forks with the forks and the knives with the knives etc.

Cheese pasta was tasteless and mostly free of cheese, while the croque-monsieurs were mushy and cold. Fries were good, though it's hard to mess up deep frozen ones. On the plus side, ketchup, mustard and mayonnaise aplenty and at no charge.

Staff were friendly enough. It gets busy at the food collection point so be prepared to wait a short while.; It's not fine dining, but the fish and chips were amazing, and the burger and omlette were good too!

Prices aren't cheap, but they aren't as unfair as a lot of reviews make it seem. The food was hot and tasty. Can't complain.; Good to have such a nice restaurant inside the zoo ..
It was a little bit expensive
But considering the location,  it was predicted..

name: Monument Caf√© Zoo de Paris
vicinity: Parc zoologique de Paris, Avenue Daumesnil, Paris
formatted_address: Parc zoologique de Paris, Av. Daumesnil, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
Even animals in the cafe ü§Ø
They serve good coffee; Delicious food, friendly stuff, family friendly environment.; Ras; Lovely food; A quick stopover to grab a coffee, the staff is super friendly, the location is quiet and the setting is very pretty.

name: Danieli Caff√®
reviews: Decent restaurant with tasty food and friendly service üëåüèæ Got my new spot in Vincennes; We have terrible french and the waiter was lovely and accommodating, and although it was quiet there was a great atmosphere. Big pizzas with lots of toppings and big drinks too (the Pina colada mocktail was lush); I think I came on a bad day, it came highly recommended from colleagues. Waiter got the order wrong and pretty much insulted us (it wasn't that complicated, only 5 of us) and the two pasta dishes weren't quite right and we didn't finish them. I don't like giving bad reviews and this restaurant came highly recommended from colleagues so let's assume it was just a bad day in the office.; Great pizza and pasta, perfect for business lunch. Very nice staff, not fancy though, and always packed.; Never disappointed here. Very good dishes & friendly atmosphere

name: Un Instant de R√™ve
vicinity: Route de Ceinture du Lac Daumesnil, Paris
formatted_address: Rte de Ceinture du Lac Daumesnil, 75012 Paris, France
reviews: We had a Reine pizza, it was good! 14 euros, we split in 4 and had 2 slices each. We then shared a cr√™pe with miel et citron. The dude can be a bit intimidating but he's actually really warm and nice (if you're also warm and nice that is!).; Much needed lovely cafe with excellent menu, good prices and nice service. Just what we needed after a long walk; Awful place, avoid. Undercooked pizza, bad atmosphere.; This lawyer is very kind and knowledgeable and helped my daughter a lot through a rough phase. He helped her get the compensation she deserved. He was great to work with.; A regular place nothing fancy, has everything you need especially in a hot summer day.

name: Wakanda factory Paris nation
reviews:
Round of applause üôå this place blew my mind. Firstly the food. 10/10 flavourful, well cooked and huge portions. I have never seen so much ripe plantain in my life. Juicy and just so on point. The decor was fitting, well done and tasteful. I feel to return to Paris just for this food.; Phenomenal

Some food shortages in the menu; Hello its me Damba Hollande for the 3 days in Paris The only restaurant i ate was Wakanda Factory I ate atieke poulet and my 2 kids today i promised you i wil give u a good review Very good service funny people and i enjoyed eating at your restaurant next time i Will come.; I was in Paris for 4 days and I casually found this place. I ordered dinner twice: soooo good. Big portions, very tasty, cool place and also not expansive! Recommend it!!!!; Quaint, vibrant, and intimate restaurant that is full of Afro Flavor. A bit of heat, salt, acidity, balanced to perfection. My experience with Bakary the host was exceptional, he ensured I received the highest quality of service. I will definitely return to this restaurant and recommend you try their numerous meal selections!

name: On D√Æne √† la Chemin√©e
reviews: Pizza was delicious owner was more than friendly to us, I would recommend üëå; Huge (homemade, mostly) pasta portions, great wood oven pizza, also "healthier" options such as salad & carpaccio. Great for lunch if you're in the area but wouldn't travel from far for it.; Best Salmon Pizza I have had in the Paris Area!  This place caters to the business local business crowd during lunchtime but if you are near by and want some good italian for (which is not so readily available in this part town) it is well worth stopping in.; Food is Ok. Nice place for a quick lunch. It was a bit cold inside. Pizza is Ok. The viel and beef are quite nice as well.; Wonderful pizza and pasta, lovely atmosphere, inexpensive, takeout pizza cooked to order in about 10 minutes tops!

name: New Chalet du Lac
vicinity: Bois de Vincennes, 2 Avenue Anna Politkovska√Øa Or√©e du, Paris
formatted_address: Bois de Vincennes, 2 Av. Anna Politkovska√Øa Or√©e du, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
Brunch Review.

First impression at the door was horrible, security guy seemingly forgot that it‚Äôs not a nightclub. Once in you need to pay in advance, then if you want something extra (second glass of juice etc) you need to pay again on the spot. That seems redundant.

Staff is nice and welcoming, food was great and lots of different foods were available. Strong point: entertainment for children is available and included and they‚Äôre supervised.

The building is aging and many things are neglected it seems (toilet seat broken, doors to electrical safety equipment left open, spiderwebs everywhere and some chairs visibly not in good condition - also some ‚Äûblack mystery dust‚Äú on the napkins). Parking is difficult on the weekends due to the closure of the park, toilets are not stroller - wheelchair accessible.

For the price it must be better I think, the food can only make up for so much and then some.; Beautiful park area. The building is a little need of some upkeep. I went to attend a new years eve event. The meal was just OK, and the service quite slow, even by relaxed Paris standards. I noted that a large group seated almost 30 minutes after me were served their full course first. They may have been thinly staffed that night, but it seemed off.; A very scenic spot to host any event. The fees for depositing is slightly elevated but overall the service is on par.; Very lame Club! We were here at Silvester Party. First of all the bouncers were so unprofessional and unfriendly that i would gove them a minus -10.
They pushed my friend as if he were a garbage bag while checking him. Even though we had biught tickets in advance for about 50‚Ç¨/person - they wanted to froce us to buy bottles so they can let us in. After i complained and showed them their website, another bouncer came and told them that i am right and the were wrong.
Anyways we got inside and damn what we see? No age class, from teenager to old people of +60 are there.
The party was so lame! So please , if you want to have fun, go somewhere else. And hit the like if you had same bad feeling here.; The whole family was disappointed. Average food, high price (but all brunch prices in Paris are extremely high). Hygiene is not high on their list. We went in order for the children to have fun in the kids corner but it was of no interest to them. No planned activities other than face painting. However the staff is very friendly and helpful!

name: L¬¥Ang√©lique Caf√©
reviews:
The most expensive cappuccino ever :)) 6‚Ç¨. But We liked the atmosphere, cleanness of the place & the bathroom, politeness & warmness of the staff, knowing English,
I recommend here. I wish I had time to go there for lunch.; Delicious food and great service at an incredible venue; Nice ambience and nice place for breakfast. They have the classic ‚Äòglobetrotter‚Äô option which has a juice, hot drink, scrambled eggs and bread.
The staff is also very nice.; An excellent place to go.
Bread, jelly, and caf√© for a fair price.
The staff doesn't speak English, however, the service is good and they will try to serve you in the best way possible.; We had an amazing experience at L‚Äô Angelique! We were treated like personal guests, the atmosphere was vibrant yet relaxing and the food was exquisite. We can‚Äôt wait to return to dine again with our new friend!

name: Chez Yach Restaurant
vicinity: 2 Avenue du Docteur Arnold Netter, Paris
formatted_address: 2 Av. du Dr Arnold Netter, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
We spotted this place during a Sunday walk on the Coul√©e verte Ren√©-Dumont. We stopped and took a table on the sidewalk. The waiter was kind and didn‚Äôt mind that we don‚Äôt speak French well. The house burger was super good and cooked perfectly. The salmon tartare with avocados and mangos was also excellent. The desserts looked good, even though we didn‚Äôt try them.; It's a very nice restaurant. The staff is very pleasant. To try.; I can't put zero so I put 1. Restaurant reserved on La Fourchette, confirmation email + reservation reminder email the day before and arrivals in front of the restaurant: closed! Really not serious at all. The least we can do is prevent; There are 4 of us coming to the restaurant after a long walk in Paris this October 27, 2023.
The waiter received us very well, clean classy place :)
Very nice touch in the toilets where they were very clean and there were sanitary towels, tampons, and baby towels available to customers. And also coloring for my friend's son :D
We have a drink during happy hour from 4 p.m. until 11 p.m. ;) accompanied by a small pot of salted sugar popcorn.

Go there with your eyes closed :)
Thanks again for the welcome we had a good time; Nice place. Nice room. We are very well received there and we manage to prepare what suits you. I am vegetarian and I was able to have a beautiful custom-made board. Thanks, I'll come back.

name: La Fontaine Cuvier Restaurant
reviews:
Everyone knows French food is delicious but I wasn't expecting to get fantastic burgers in Paris! Stopped in randomly for dinner and this burger and fries was perfection. There's a whisper of garlic on the fries that's soooo good and the caramelized onions in the burger were delicious. Definitely recommend.; I have eaten here twice in the last two nights and found the staff to be very friendly and the food was delicious . I had salmon in a crispy pastry with beautifully cooked vegetables in a sumptuous sauce and a medium rare beef dish with excellent fries and salad. The white wine and rose were wonderful too. Great atmosphere and music. I will be back :-); Great resto just next to the Jardin des plantes. Our 2nd time here and food was good and service right on.; We had amaizing evenings in this restaurant with real parisian view and vibe.
We had french fries and mousse au chocolat which was delicious but contained a little bit of lumps.
But we would definetely come back.; Delicious burgers. Close to the Jardin de Plants. The restaurant is on the corner of a street and easy to miss if you're coming from the north side. But if you do spot it, you'll will find a small restaurant that cooks your meal where you can see it from the outside terrace. The burgers are to die for, great taste. The lady serving us was very eager to help and explained everything to us in English. The restaurant is on a corner of a busy street though, which is not ideal, but probably worth it.

name: Caf√© Baby Foot
reviews:
One water (50cl)  and one orangina (23 cl ) 9 euros. Too expensive and so bad attention from the waiter. Never will come back.; Good food to a really cheap price; Priceless vestige of a Paris that almost disappeared. A thousand miles from faux-authentic marketing, this is a neighborhood caf√© where you immediately understand that you are not the umpteenth customer to be fleeced. It's precious. We just regret that it is not open more.; Very pleasant and original caf√© located a few steps from the station: Port-Royal...and the magnificent garden of the great Explorers...!

In addition, it is allowed to cultivate oneself and she sells second-hand books, all at a flat rate of ‚Ç¨2...allowing you to nourish your mind as well as your body...
Caf√© that deserves to be discovered for its original and diverse atmosphere...!
There is a real table football in the caf√© (the English say: "Table football" for table football...I think...)..an out of tune piano (for the moment)..guitars.... a slightly bohemian caf√©, in a way, as we like them on the Boul'mich to relax without problems...; Discovered by chance, an atypical place in the heart of Paris. Authentic, no fuss. If you're a fan of rigor and pseudo Parisian chic, don't worry, it's a real neighborhood bar.

It‚Äôs located in a nice place in the park though with plenty of seating there and nearby and a nice view of the lake.; I visit this place multiple times to get a coffee or to have some crepes with friends. Unfortunately the lady (owner) is really not respectful and is serving people as she is doing it for free. She took it personally when i told her that i ordered a lungo and got an expresso, and she didnt want to fix (add hot water) my drink until I insisted.

The location is good, the crepes are good, but the service is a shame.; Never ever am I going to pay 4.5‚Ç¨ for an ice cream like Magnum or Calippo, these prices are a shame!; Not only the guy at the left who hates his job destroyed the Nutella crepe concept by minimizing the quantity he pours to the point where it could be called just crepe, he dares to be rude and ironic at the same time. Well, your food is terrible and your service deserves 0 stars. Avoid this place and leave your euros outside the park.; The creep is amazing üëè and the hot chocolate üç´ is the pest they sells honey üçØ it's from the garden

name: Il √©tait un square
reviews:
Everything was delicious. Highly recommend egg mayonnaise and goat cheese salad as starter, followed by steak tartar and a hamburger.

Better to make a reservation, because it was full when we arrived and the owner was kind enough to helping us find a table outside.; The Cheddar Burger is next level, clocked medium rare just perfect! We tried also the Hungarian Tartar and was delicious, people and atmosphere are super nice! 5*; Stumbled on this place by accident on the Internet.  I nooked it as was more towards East of city so great place to stop if going in city from Disney.  Its kinda out of town, and we parked nearby. I was a little nervous that we would be the only people on a Tuesday evening, but when I got in there, it was fully booked.
It's super casual but awesome food. My wife and I shared a burger and a salmon tarta, and kids had burgers. The cheff clearly had a love for cheese, and developing tastes at the food was fantastic.  If you want fine dining, this is not for you, but great burgers and food in a casual atmosphere is for you.  The staff are super cool and speak English.  Book, and loads of nearby parking...
My photos are rubbish, but the ones on their website are a true reflection; My absolute favorite tartare place in Paris! Went there twice in June 2024. Had different tartare creations. Both were really nice. The meat was so fresh. Would keep coming back every time I visit Paris. The service was great. The staff were cool.; Many images already but here you have another one of the Roman. It was very good but what stood out for me were the atmosphere and service. The guys were so casual, helpful and fast in delivering our food. Very very good value for the money, can‚Äôt wait to come back. Also notice the Reserve button in google and use it, they are fast at confirming that also.

You have a great business there, congratulations and vest wishes to you all.

name: Coffee Club
reviews:
Came here for dinner since I wanted a ceasar salad. It was decent but a little pricy for what it offered. Also had a cocktail and that was good. There was a book event going on but I was just there for the food and there was no issues.; Nice little brunch place next to the Jardin du Luxembourg. There is a nice menu with diverse choices from burgers, to toasties, to classic American breakfasts. The taste is good but I didn‚Äôt feel it was anything crazy neither. Prices are alright and not too expensive neither which is nice.; The place is nice and the food is good. The staff is ok. It is overall a nice place, where you better take your time, and reasonably priced.

The French fries where really good.
Unfortunately, we had some half burnt pancakes and too cooked crispy chicken.

We were a party of 7 + a child, ate plentiful and paid around 280‚Ç¨.; I would rate this as a solid ‚Äúfine‚Äù. It‚Äôs a place that has potential, the atmosphere is good and the service is excellent.
But the food is really ‚Äúmid‚Äù,
It feels like they are charging as much as a normal portion but giving you kids portions. The food wasn‚Äôt even that good or that bad it‚Äôs just not really what you‚Äôre expecting with the menu, the prices and the American style.

I would stay away from the heuvis rancheros, the tortilla was impossible to cut through.; I don't get homesick as much as many American expats, but I have to admit this place rang some nice bells for me. High-quality American diner cooking, which I sometimes still crave.

Hamburgers without pretense, milkshakes that taste like real milkshakes, and much better fries than I'm accustomed to in Paris.

The service is very friendly, bordering on jovial.

All around, a solid spot.

name: YUMAN bar et restaurant
reviews:
The waitstaff was very courteous and happy to accommodate French or English.  The drinks were are standouts and very refreshing.   It was easy to enjoy our conversation and our food.  I highly recommend the cucumber gazpacho.   Excellent!  We ordered different dishes and enjoyed them immensely.  Thank you for a fresh and delicious meal! I‚Äôd definitely come again.; Given the many choices Paris offers concerning places to eat dinner, choosing the place to settle can be quite the challenge. Luckily the Fork helped us out with an amazing deal. At first caution is advised when deals seem too good to be true, however, we were pleasantly surprised by the food, atmosphere and charming server (and probably owner). In regards to the actual dinner, the food consisted of classics presented in a modern way whilst also offering some newer dishes. Luckily this restaurant understood the importance of A-grade ingredients as simple recipes were very tasteful. Given the size of Paris, accessibility is very important as well. Given that there is a metro station just across the street, reaching Yuman should give little issues even when situated in the centre like we were. In our eyes, the owner and staff of Yuman understood the message of what good food and service meant and thus we could absolutely recommend this restaurant!; As someone who isn't really into vegan and organic restaurants, I gotta say I really loved the food here, good portions and the price was reasonable; Very healthy and tasty food. They use only biological ingredients. I find their prices are quite expensive compared to other places I know.; Very nice place, with stunning atmosphere and decoration. Super nice staff, that chatted with us and answered our million questions!
Great place, both for the organic food and suitable aura.

name: Le Pot O'Lait
reviews:
The place is nicely decorated in a nautical theme. The menu has plenty of options to choose from, both sweet and savory. The crepe that I ordered was fine but the galette was definitely the star of the show.

3 stars mostly for the service. The waiter was quite nice but he was running around like crazy between the tables and it was hard to get his attention. As a result my coffee that I had to remind him about twice never came and I had to finish my meal without a hot drink. I think this place could definitely benefit from hiring one more waiter.; Nice food, excellent service from a very nice host and situated on a quiet corner.; Cozy family business with friendly staff able to serve you in several languages! Good traditional French galettes which we loved. Definitely recommended! Also the prices quite ok for Paris!; This is one of the tastiest places with cr√™pe that I have tried in Paris. They are both good, either galletes with bacon, egg and cheese, or the sweet version. This time I have tried cr√™pe flamb√©, the one with calvados spilled on it and burned. Delicious, as usual, and I find this place a great choice to try.
That said, and amazing service, as the others have noticed; Always delicious crepes, both savory and sweet, and very friendly staff.

name: Plan Libre - Caf√© - Restaurant - Coworking - Paris
reviews:
Incredible coworking! Spacious, luminous, great coffee at 1,30‚Ç¨ and strong social and environmental mission. There is a cozy place for kids to play. Highly recommend! :); Very delicious food, vegetarian and anti-gaspillage, very good concept. The curry is very tasty. The service is good, everyone is very nice here. The restaurant is in the cit√© du refuge. Not so far from the RER station biblioth√®que Fran√ßois Mitterrand.; Young and cool atmosphere very friendly and nice people üòçüòçüòç; I like the Plan Libre site because above all it is user-friendly and the food is very good. It allows for a cultural mix through its diversity, ages, origins, cuisine, and the whole thing means that every time I go there I have the impression of completing a journey (journey). The only thing I'm missing is background music.; Very pleasant place to work, very well located and a warm atmosphere. Absolutely lovely staff.
I will come back with pleasure!

name: La Place
reviews: We had a fabulous meal here (Normandy chicken and the Oc√©ane salade). Both were great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful. I think she was surprised that anyone might want a savoury cr√®pe!; My wife and I were looking for a place to have breakfast and found La Place. The staff was willing to try to understand English and helped us select a perfect breakfast.; Staff is English-speaking and friendly. Nice to tourists and helpful as well. They even gave us an English menu without us asking :) Breakfast is delicious and their croissant is prolly the best I‚Äôve ever had!; My first meal upon arriving in Paris! Excellent outdoor seating to watch the people on the move. Enjoyed the escargot, bread, and beer!; We stumbled in here by chance. We didn't have much time, just wanted a quick drink. The lady behind the bar conjured up two super tasty non-alcoholic cocktails for us. A Virgin Mule and a Virgin Spritz. They were delicious. We asked if there was any alcohol in them because they were so good. But they really were alcohol-free

name: Chez Nicos
reviews:
The staff was really nice, helped us with our order because we didn‚Äôt understand French.
The salt crepe was really really delicious! We‚Äôre used to sweet crepes, but the combination with the salty fillings was perfect. We were really full after üòÖ the crepe was very big and well served!
I really wanted the sweet crepe for dessert, but I couldn‚Äôt get anything after üòÇ
Highly recommend this place! It wasn‚Äôt expensive at all!

Edit: we came Back twice after this review and it exceeded our already high expectations. The nutella and banana crepe is to die for! ü§§; Made-on-demand crepe with lots of options for fillings. We went savory this time with ham and cheese, they were super generous with the filling. Thing with it having tomatoes though is the bottom gets a bit soggy. Nonetheless a very enjoyable and filling midnight snack.; Great crepe, I tried banana and nutella crepe. Really yummy üòã
Then I went ahead and had one more, dark chocolate with coconut. Equally good. I also had a coffee shot to have a good combination of sweet and bitter.; This is the most surprisingly tasty and filling meal. I went twice in one day because it was so good! Best food!! Wish I could go back it was that great. The chef crepe was my favorite. The Nutella banana was also great; We came to Paris for 6 days and we came to Nicos on our second day here. We came back today because the first time was that good (and we might be coming back tomorrow for lunch as well üòÇ). This time was even better. Freshly made salted crepes‚Ä¶ even more delicious than the first time. Very well served, we get out of here with our tummies full and happy.
The staff is very kind and thoughtful.
We will make sure to come back here next time we‚Äôre in Paris.

10/10!! Highly recommend.

name: L'√élot B√©b√©s - Fondation de Rothschild
reviews:
I've been looking for a place like this since my daughter was born, its perfect for those long dark winter days where the parks close early and theres nothing to do. Its only free the first time, after you must subscribe. Its small but well organized. So many games and toys. My 2 year old loved it.; Excellent welcome :)
Caring staff who care about the well-being of parents and children. A variety of games available, in a calm and relaxed atmosphere.
A place that I order!; A spacious place, the staff are friendly, smiling, gentle, etc. The toys are suitable for children. My children are very happy. I invite all parents to come and just take a look; A great space for babies! Everything is there, very well maintained premises and games. Think about it on rainy days :); Alright! Great place for baby to have fun, socialize and develop their motor skills. Offering a variety of workshops and lovely staff.

name: Jardin Burger
reviews: Amazing food! Huge portion even for the kids meal which came with juice + fruit pur√©e + chocolate! Price was so worth it. I had the fromager, and it was DELICIOUS! There was a lovely lady who was so welcoming and friendly. When we arrived, the line for ordering was so long but she cleared it so fast and had the most amazing service despite the very crowded restaurant. She was also fluent in English and it was very easy to order with her. May God bless her. Alhamdulillah for such a lovely experience. InshaAllah will come again next time when we visit Paris!; This store sells halal and hygine-certified fast food. Located between the metro station and Paris Grand Mosque, it's a perfect stop by for travelers, particularly the muslim ones. They employees speak fluent English. The price is also moderate compared to many fast food restaurant in Paris.; Amazing burgers, cooked to perfection with full beef taste. The people are very welcoming and friendly. A must try if you‚Äôre visiting or a regular spot if you live near by.; Food is good (burger gourmet, not the low quality industrial bread or steak of 2mm) but the staff is very rude (I think it‚Äôs the owner herself who was on the counter). I was their with my kids and their cousins after visiting the Jardin des plantes. Although we were a big group of 7, the person who served us was visibly frustrated when we asked for napkins or takeaway boxes for the left over. They are a perfect tourist trap and are not interested in having customers coming back again as no effort was done in that regard. It‚Äôs a pity as the rude behavior spoiled our whole experience and the kids totally forgot about the quality of food which was above average for a burger place.; Amazing cuisine, service, and great vibes

name: Les P√©pites, maison d'artisans - Restaurant Paris 15
reviews:
Les P√©pites, Maison d'Artisans is a fantastic spot for a satisfying lunch. I visited during lunchtime and was immediately greeted by the friendly owner and waiter, who made me feel welcome. The atmosphere was relaxed and inviting, perfect for a midday break.

For lunch, I enjoyed a Grilled Cheese Pastrami, an omelette, and a tartlette for dessert. The Grilled Cheese Pastrami was delicious, with the perfect combination of melted cheese and flavorful pastrami. The omelette was light and fluffy, just right for a lunchtime dish. The tartlette was a delightful way to finish the meal, with its balanced sweetness and fresh ingredients.

I reserved my table through TheFork and received a 20% discount, which was a great bonus. Overall, Les P√©pites offers excellent food and warm service, making it an ideal choice for lunch in Paris. Highly recommended!; Amazing brunch! One of my favorite restaurants in Paris. Amazing quality, good food and they are really friendly. 100% recommended; Really beautiful rooms to hire, expat friendly. Very warm welcome and excellent food and drinks. There's always something exciting going on here so you have to keep an eye out not to miss anything. Parking is really good here too.; Very kind staff and also good foods.
It seems that they are selling the eco-friendly products.
The taste of pasta isn‚Äôt strong, rather a little bit weak but I like that.; Amazing Brunch !!! (Check my insta food account @_takeyourseat_ ) üíó

name: La Bonbonni√®re
vicinity: Parc Montsouris face au lac, Paris

name: Aire de Jeux pour Enfants
reviews: A good enclosed play area within Parc Montsouris. There is a big sandpit, slides, rocking rides and climbing frames. This play area is from age 2years to 8 years. There is a water tap but no toilets in the premises . There are benches all around too.; It is a huge park for children having number of facilities such as, theatre, toy trains, restaurants, ice-cream parlour, toilets etc.; Inside the Parc Montsouris,this space is dedicated for children in the middle of greenery and trees.all they need to spend a good moment is there; Super; My son's favorite park, very pretty, well maintained, well frequented, we love it

name: Terry's Caf√©
reviews:
I found this adorable cafe in my neighborhood when I visited Paris. The dishes are fresh and tasty. The steak was especially good. The staff were courteous with great service. Highly recommended!; It‚Äôs the kind of restaurants that offer 10 pages menu with many different types of cuisine, so, many of the food is frozen food and not homemade.
The snails are almost tasteless, no butter neither sauce.
The hamburger XXL was okay, but not worth the 28‚Ç¨! The cr√®me br√ªl√©e was not br√ªl√©e and soggy. The tiramisu is good tho.
The service is very good, and the staff so nice.
However it is very pricey for the quality of the food!; This is a cosy place with a good selection of food. The cocktails are average. Do give it a try if you're in that area. Their menu option is the best.; Quieter local restaurant - food is fine and reliable. Ate here times in the past 4 months (May-September). French onion soup better than most on Montparnasse and staff work well as a team.
The BEST lemon cheesecake of my life, but it‚Äôs not always available.
It would be nicer if they would do something about the fact that the whole restaurant smells of cigarettes, given that the smoking veranda pulls all the smoke into the space.
Some days I didn‚Äôt come because I knew I wouldn‚Äôt be able to deal with the smoke that day.; The italian chef's specials are amazing, the sauce and the melted cheese were very tasty, I recommend, plus for the view ü§å

name: Coffee Club
reviews:
Came here for dinner since I wanted a ceasar salad. It was decent but a little pricy for what it offered. Also had a cocktail and that was good. There was a book event going on but I was just there for the food and there was no issues.; Nice little brunch place next to the Jardin du Luxembourg. There is a nice menu with diverse choices from burgers, to toasties, to classic American breakfasts. The taste is good but I didn‚Äôt feel it was anything crazy neither. Prices are alright and not too expensive neither which is nice.; The place is nice and the food is good. The staff is ok. It is overall a nice place, where you better take your time, and reasonably priced.

The French fries where really good.
Unfortunately, we had some half burnt pancakes and too cooked crispy chicken.

We were a party of 7 + a child, ate plentiful and paid around 280‚Ç¨.; I would rate this as a solid ‚Äúfine‚Äù. It‚Äôs a place that has potential, the atmosphere is good and the service is excellent.
But the food is really ‚Äúmid‚Äù,
It feels like they are charging as much as a normal portion but giving you kids portions. The food wasn‚Äôt even that good or that bad it‚Äôs just not really what you‚Äôre expecting with the menu, the prices and the American style.

I would stay away from the heuvis rancheros, the tortilla was impossible to cut through.; I don't get homesick as much as many American expats, but I have to admit this place rang some nice bells for me. High-quality American diner cooking, which I sometimes still crave.

Hamburgers without pretense, milkshakes that taste like real milkshakes, and much better fries than I'm accustomed to in Paris.

The service is very friendly, bordering on jovial.

All around, a solid spot.

name: Buffalo Grill
formatted_address: 117 Av. du G√©n√©ral Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews: I recently visited Buffalo Grill in Paris 14 and was thoroughly impressed. The steaks were cooked to perfection‚Äîtender, juicy, and full of flavor. The staff were warm, friendly, and attentive, ensuring a great dining experience. The restaurant's cozy, rustic ambiance added to the charm, making it perfect for both family dinners and casual outings. Highly recommended!; Excellent place, pleasant atmosphere, excellent service.  The waitress was called Nana, delicious food, big portions.  Reasonable prices.  recommended. We came twice to the restaurant, and the second time they did not disappoint, including Nana the waitress; The place is very clean and inviting, the food was very tasty, we also came the next day.  Our waitress NANA was amazing, smiling and very helpful.  Definitely worth coming; An excellent place our serve sas David great guy talks three languages and great service overall; A little pricey, added extras cost more too which is a little unusual for foreign travellers. Food itself is reasonable to very good. About 22- 25 euro per person incl drink and pudding.

name: square du Serment-de-Koufra
formatted_address: 187 Rue de la L√©gion √âtrang√®re, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
Lovely open playground for kids. Not hugely crowded and best part - no dogs allowed!; It is really nice place to sit and relax and is well maintained. It has a board skating rink and is greatly used by the children of all age groups. Then there is play ground for kids as well. The park has some common facilities like toilets as well. It is a beatiful sight in spring time, with nice colorful flowers and greenery.
Nice small park, for the family, kids and to stroll.; It's a calm place near porte d'Orl√©ans; A place for relaxing and physical activities for all ages. Properly maintained and very clean.; Good place for kids and someone who want a quiet place to enjoy the summer.

name: Food Society Paris
reviews:
Ordered the mozzarella pesto crepe. It was very tasty and the salad was fresh. Would definitely go again!

The place is very cool and well air conditioned.; Great concept and ideas. Similar to USA food court. I like the concept where you can order everything from different foods kiosk in a single order. When done, you can go pick up your food. Price is good. Food is ok, so don‚Äôt expect typical gourmet food like in Paris.; Very cool food court with many different cuisines and food options, including coffee, ice cream, and alcohol. You can order on your phone using a QR or, pro tip, you can order at the main bar in the center of the space if you rather order through a person and not create an online account (which you need to order on your phone). Highly recommend if you are in the area!; Soir√©e champions league. It‚Äôs perfect to watch football matches and have variety of food and drinks.

I ordered a burger and hot dog from ‚Äúburger society‚Äù. It was not bad but it can be better. The prices are very reasonable.

I recommend it to watch football games but not to have exceptional food.; üéâ Absolutely thrilled with my experience at Food Society! What a fantastic concept! üôå The setup where you navigate between different food stands works seamlessly. The app for ordering food is a game-changer - super quick and efficient. The staff are friendly and helpful, which is always appreciated. The only downside is that the central bar can be a bit slow. Now, let's talk about the decor - industrial vibes all the way! It's refreshing to find such innovative spots in Paris. Major applause! üè≠üëè Opted for the chicken dish, and it was excellent - no complaints there. Overall, a new spot with a fresh atmosphere, and I'm absolutely loving it! Can't wait to go back for more! üçóüòç

name: UMAMI BURGER PARIS
vicinity: 19 Rue du Commandant Ren√© Mouchotte, Paris
formatted_address: 19 Rue du Commandant Ren√© Mouchotte, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
Tried their Sam‚Äôs crispy chicken burger, Truffle cheese fries, Bacon fries, K-town pok√© bowl and Peanut butter pie. Chicken burger was deliciously flavourful, and so was pok√© bowl (although it did come with hair eww). Fries were not crispy although truffle ketchup was good. Peanut butter pie was mousse-based so it was quite light while still being decadent.; Friday night, my wife and I were looking for a burger, as we were craving for one !
We found this place, which is actually a restaurant of the Pullman hotel near Gare Montparnasse.

I must say, the place is gorgeous ! The decoration is absolutely beautiful, and super quiet. The waiters are super nice, and quick. I loved that our order was taken rapidly and always with the proper words, love that ! Huge thanks to the guys who served us yesterday !

When it comes to the burgers themselves, well‚Ä¶. Those are not the best burgers in town, they are decent. Who had the classic burger and the crispy chicken. Nothing fancy here, no special sauce, the buns are ok, and the crispy chicken was probably over fried as it came out almost black.
The fries are good, don‚Äôt get me wrong they are probably home made, but again not something I would come again for.

All in all, we had a nice evening but we won‚Äôt probably come back, as the food was just ok, and the prices are pretty high for that. 2 burgers, 2 fries and 2 coke = 48 euros.; Don‚Äôt let the name fool you‚Ä¶Umami Burger at the Pullman Hotel is a great spot!  Our server Alexandru was both friendly and attentive‚Ä¶making our dining experience all the more special.  Great food, burgers could be cooked a little less well done but overall still great‚Ä¶and the sweet potato fries are simply fantastic!; The burgers are ok. The fries are very good. Servers were very friendly and it's a cute place. I was staying in the hotel so it was very convenient, I would go back.; Pros: friendly staff and good atmosphere.
Cons: food took too long and then when it did, the burger was cold and dry - didn‚Äôt enjoy it. Sweet potato fries were quite good. Milkshake was very watery and had like 3 tbsp of peanut butter just sitting at the bottom of the glass - not fun.
Cheesecake and chocolate cake were just ok.

name: Le Petit Broc
reviews:
Absolutely amazing restaurant! I luckily found this place four years ago as a tourist and it was so good that I noted this place on my list and revisited today with my parents! All the food were incredible and just mindblowing!!!!! The onion soup was divine - the best I ever had and the fish dishes were so soft and flavorful. We had a very pleasant and memorable lunch thanks the friendly service as well. I‚Äôll come back again when I visit Paris next time.; Food was so delicious and surely Frenchy authentic. We love everything we ordered.
Definitely will return on the next visit.; Best breakfast we had during our 3 day stay in Paris.  Service was excellent; This restaurant is such a gem! The location and atmosphere are so enjoyable. The service is top notch- very friendly, approachable, and very kind to have English menus and English speakers!  We loved getting to know them. Food was out of this world. We got the French onion soup, cheese souffl√©, beef carpaccio, and molten chocolate cake. All were 10/10, extremely delicious, unique takes, generous portions , and very reasonable prices . Plus happy hour wine was amazing! Will definitely return and could not recommend enough.; This place is AMAZING!!!!!  I have no words to describe. We ate here 2 nights in a row.
Absolutely delicious EVERYTHING WE TRIED.

name: Indiana Caf√© - Denfert Rochereau
vicinity: 1 Bis Avenue du G√©n√©ral Leclerc, Paris
formatted_address: 1 Bis Av. du G√©n√©ral Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews: Its a very nice restaurant at the corner of the street and the view is very nice. The staff was very helpful.  We had cheeseburger and steak hach√© and liked them but it would a little bit nicer if they seasoned the meat better.; We have ordered alcohol drinks and desserts. There was  no alcohol taste in our drinks. The service was very slow. The taste of the dessert was normal.; Pretty much an average chain. American, tex-mex cuisine. Food ok, but doesn't blow you away. A bit overpriced for quantity and quality. Service fine. If you have time, find a nice independent place instead with a bit more character.; Went here before visiting the catacombs. The ambiance of the restaurant was noce and the staff was very friendly. The prices were fair and the service was very fast. I had a chicken fajitas salad and it was very good, I was so satisfied with my choice. My friend has the chicken nuggets and they were very tasty as well. We left nothing in our plates! Afterwards, we ordered a brownie and it was sweet, decadent and delicious!; Indiana Cafe was just a random choice for me as a pleasant and useful time to wait for a friend. Nice staff, no big wait for the food ordered, which was really very tasty, and reasonable prices due to the location in which the pub is located. I will definitely recommend to friends if they are in this part of Paris.

name: Square Lionel-Assouad
reviews: Nice and simple park. A great variety of plants and a kids play area. Not too large or complex.; Not bad; Nice place to zat chawarmas; Quiet park with a playground; Nice and quiet garden

name: Les P√©pites, maison d'artisans - Restaurant Paris 15
reviews:
Les P√©pites, Maison d'Artisans is a fantastic spot for a satisfying lunch. I visited during lunchtime and was immediately greeted by the friendly owner and waiter, who made me feel welcome. The atmosphere was relaxed and inviting, perfect for a midday break.

For lunch, I enjoyed a Grilled Cheese Pastrami, an omelette, and a tartlette for dessert. The Grilled Cheese Pastrami was delicious, with the perfect combination of melted cheese and flavorful pastrami. The omelette was light and fluffy, just right for a lunchtime dish. The tartlette was a delightful way to finish the meal, with its balanced sweetness and fresh ingredients.

I reserved my table through TheFork and received a 20% discount, which was a great bonus. Overall, Les P√©pites offers excellent food and warm service, making it an ideal choice for lunch in Paris. Highly recommended!; Amazing brunch! One of my favorite restaurants in Paris. Amazing quality, good food and they are really friendly. 100% recommended; Really beautiful rooms to hire, expat friendly. Very warm welcome and excellent food and drinks. There's always something exciting going on here so you have to keep an eye out not to miss anything. Parking is really good here too.; Very kind staff and also good foods.
It seems that they are selling the eco-friendly products.
The taste of pasta isn‚Äôt strong, rather a little bit weak but I like that.; Amazing Brunch !!! (Check my insta food account @_takeyourseat_ ) üíó

name: COCO
reviews:
Quintessentially French Caf√© at a reasonable price and good, central location. Quiet during the Sunday we went, but livened up a lot at night. Staff and atmosphere were fantastic. Everything was very reasonably-priced for a Parisian restaurant too. Will defintely go back when I'm next in Paris.; Very small portions for what you get. 15.5‚Ç¨ the poke full of rice, 6 euros the very small detox juice ? Too expensive.
The burger was good.
And the staff lied when asked for more ice cube because I‚Äôve asked twice.; The place was absolutely crammed, but I appreciate they fitted us in. If you hate kids yelling don't goü§£ very loud, felt like a kindergarten, but I'm sure it's a lovely place for parents/people with children to enjoy an excellent meal and have your child preoccupied. The food was delicious, so any tiny inconvenience is erased really. Servers were running around trying to take care of everyone. There was one man specifically who brought out loads of food, he seemed to be the most caring and fastest one. Lovely lovely food. If you have kids, go here. We don't, but I would come back for the food.; The hostess/owner was absolutely wonderful. We had great food and cocktails. Will come back next time I'm in Paris!; Very good! Open recently we wanted to try and we have been happily surprised. Waiters were very polite and friendly. Food is not expensive, is good quantity and on top of that is good!! We will be back!

name: MELTING POPOTE
vicinity: 2 Rue du Pic de Barrette, Paris
formatted_address: 2 Rue du Pic de Barrette, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
Great Food and very nice Vibe!
The owner was soo nice and she made us feel very welcome. The menu was in French but she will offer to help to translate it if you need it. The food was very good and made fresh. I would come again :); I was visiting France from Boston, Massachusetts and stumbled upon this little cozy restaurant, decided to try it out. I walked in and was immediately impressed of how fast the Host came to greet me. The smell was quite pleasant definitely smelled aromatic like herbs and spices. I got to the table and immediately was asked if the host wanted to translate the menu for me and I was very impressed the first restaurant that someone who would actually translate for me. Moving to the dish I got the Egyptian Chicken I was skeptical at first because I thought it would be over seasoned but no it was perfectly seasoned and cooked fresh salad on the bottom and a side of sauce wish was rich in flavor. I was blown away how not heavy the food, how flavorful and aromatic it was. I‚Äôd recommend anyone to give this place a shot if you‚Äôre in the area friendly, small, aromatic establishment. (Mind you I‚Äôve eaten at many different places in Paris and so far this has made my top 3 list).; The food was very yummy and has good flavour and left the 4 of us very satisfied. The lemonade was great too, especially on a hot day. The host was very friendly and chatty and gave me the lemonade recipe too! Would 100% recommend!; Kitchen is filled with burnt oil aroma. Risotto was not properly cooked, yet it was drenched in fat. Saut√©ed veggies dish was drenched in oil. Salmon was overcooked. Service is friendly and very good. Overall, not impressed at all.; We had a fabulous time thanks to Rosa and her husband in this family-owned restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious (please try the fries!!), the service adorable and the atmosphere super friendly. A neighborhood gem!

name: La famille & cie
reviews:
The food was perfect. We ordered duck, chicken, and beef and it was so delicious, and good pairing with the recommended wine. The chef is a very kind person and he kept caring our table. Recommended for everyone in Paris! It's a good restaurant I want to visit again :); The food was incredible, really good quality ingredients cooked to perfection. The portions are really generous and the service could not be better. A really pleasant surprise,  excellent attention to details and friendly atmosphere. Also very reasonable price, will definitely come back in future visits to Paris, without a doubt; Wonderful experience in a local bistro. From the welcome to the food we could not have had such an amazing experience. Charlie runs front of house and the drinks, and only two chefs out the back.

Food service is perfectly paced and allows you to enjoy the food and the company.

We loved it so much we went twice in five days. Merci Charlie!; Outstanding small place in the 15th Arr. We had great food starting with roast St Marcelin cheese. Mains were roast Angus beef, crusted chicken and the ‚Äúfamily‚Äù burger. Each had an outstanding sauce to enhance the flavor. The beef was tender, the chicken moist and the burger was tall and tasty on a brioche. The desserts were a tiramisu of whipped cream, Oreos and raspberries; chocolate lava cake, and saut√©ed plums. The whipped cream was delicious but the plums were the stand out of the evening, drenched in warm sugar caramel sauce. Great service despite one man handling all duties. Search this place out!!; We stumbled upon this French restaurant by chance, and what a delightful surprise it was! From the moment we walked in, we were warmly welcomed by the lone waiter, who, despite managing all the tables on his own, was incredibly professional and friendly. His attention to detail and kindness really added to our experience

The meal was simply amazing. We started with two appetizers: rillettes and terrine. We loved the option to share these dishes as a family, which made the experience even more enjoyable. Even though we're Irish, we absolutely fell in love with these authentic French flavors

As for the main courses, both the parents and the young adults were equally impressed. The tagine was beautifully aromatic, with perfectly balanced flavors and excellent cooking. The ribs were unbelievably tender, falling off the bone effortlessly, and with an excellent sauce. Every dish we tried was outstanding, prepared with great care and passion i think !!

Whether you're with friends or family, this is the perfect spot to enjoy authentic cuisine, all complemented by impeccable service, even when the waiter is handling the whole room on his own. Hats off to them, and thank you for an unforgettable evening !!!

name: Pop's
reviews:
Fantastic service, very very welcoming and friendly.  The food was even better. Black risotto as well as the day's special risotto with Coquille saint jacques and asparagus.
Both risottos were creamy, one of the best we've ever had.  Tasted really good.  The Coquilles were a tiny bit too hard but still very tasty.  Finished it all up with a tiramisu which was very big and very good!; Had a lovely time here. The waiter was so friendly and the food was amazing, especially for the price. I definitely recommend the squid ink risotto. It is in a quiet spot so not too busy. Would go again; Manager/owner has created a welcoming and inviting place to come for a bite to eat (pasta, tuna, or pizza). The inside or outside seating is quaint.; Excellent! Peaceful environment, great food and friendly staff which makes your experience very enjoyable! It‚Äôs worthy to highlight the high level of the desserts‚Ä¶ amazing! Also to remark, the great value for money since we paid less than 30‚Ç¨ each including dinner with a bottle of wine; Had an absolutely amazing experience here tonight. We ordered the entrec√¥te, with a bottle of red wine with tiramisu and chocolate mousse for dessert. The entrec√¥te was perfect made with an amaaazing bernaise sauce, with 10/10 crispy fries. The desserts were also super good, I really can recommend them both!

But the best thing about this experience was the amazing service we got here. Everyone working there cared about our well being and made sure everyone was okay. We got a read through of the menue, recommendations, taste of the wine and just big smiles from everyone. Very genuine people. Strongly recommend you to take a visit here! The pizza also looked amazing from here.

Thank you for amazing service, and delicious food and wine, we will be back! -Couple from Norway

name: L'EXPOSITION
reviews: I got a ribeye steak. The peppercorn sauce is the best I've had, and the fries were amazing too.; Excellent service and delicious good. Very welcoming and friendly staff. Impossible to reconcile our experience  with the single negative review I read, seems completely unfair to this business. Will definitely return when in Paris; Amazing food and very friendly customer service nice traditional style; I wouldn‚Äôt feed this food to my dog. Absolutely disgusting. Fatty, overcooked, no flavour. Rude staff. Avoid at all costs.; Booked a table through TheFork, arrived at the restaurant, got told it was completely full and then got completely ignored by the staff.

name: Frame
reviews: I had a delightful dining experience here during my recent Paris visit. The restaurant is a beautifully decorated space with a warm and inviting ambiance, ideal for a memorable evening. The menu seems thoughtfully curated, bursting with flavor, and pairs perfectly with the restaurant‚Äôs vibrant atmosphere. Conveniently located just steps from the Eiffel Tower and connected to the Pullman Hotel, it‚Äôs the perfect spot for both tourists and locals alike. A must-visit for those seeking great food in a prime location.; An amazing restaurant with a perfect location if you get a nice table you can have a nice view with Eiffel Tower. The steak was delicious and juicy, it was cooked perfectly. They also had one of the best services, the service was fast and professional. I really enjoyed the food and the service. Thank you üôè; It was a very nice experience. the food was really good, i had a beef fillet and as an entry we shared a burrata. the burrata was way too small to share and so was my meat. the portion was pretty small for that price and on the side was only one pasta. the taste was amazing tho...; Good quality buffet, lot of choices! Service is on point, many thanks Dave for your kindness and professionalism! Great environment as well with the Eiffel Tower nearby!; Outstanding restaurand! Verry professional and attentive staff! Mr. Simon was super great and made sure we felt home, he gave us an experience of a life time! Steak was grilled to perfection! Ambiance was at it's finest! I Highly recomand this place for the best fine dining experience in France Paris!

name: Aux Cerises
reviews: highly recommend! Had the sirloin and the chocolate cake for dessert and no complaints, such friendly staff very quick service and such good value for money ‚Ç¨13 meal and was ‚Ç¨21 each! First time in Paris and would recommend and would definitely come again!; My husband and I didn‚Äôt have a reservation but they made room for us anyway! The staff was so kind and the food was the best I‚Äôve had in Paris so far!!! 10/10 and will be back before the end of our trip!! üíõ; This is probably the best place you can go to in a neighborhood filled with tourist traps. Even then, the food is mediocre and incredibly overpriced for what you get. Menu is quite limited, especially for vegetarians or those looking for a light/healthy meal. Service is perfectly fine and it‚Äôs a nice place to sit at, but ultimately it‚Äôs also the food that matters.; Great food, awesome service.  Absolutely no complaints from me.; Super cute place and friendly service. We got the brunch formula and everything was excellent.

name: Birdy
reviews:
Birdy offers high quality American-style burgers, it was hard to choose one from the menu so we got The Nola and The Yankee, along with an avocado spring salad and chicken tenders. The burgers were so good, so the salad but there was something with the chicken tenders, the coatign has a strong flavor of cumin, I couldn‚Äôt bother it so I removed the coating to at least eat the chicken. Besides that I like the concept of this place, their menu and their burgers.; Came for lunch with my partner. We both left very full and happy. The burgers were made quick and were very tasty. The chips were crisp. Their lunch deal with burger, fries and a drink is a pretty good deal; If you like remnants of fries from the bottom of the bag, recooked after the lunch rush, then this is the perfect spot for you. Tasteless rubbish. Image pictured is after we had eaten the 8 half-decent fries served.

For context, on our first day in Paris, we excitedly looked up on Google Maps ‚ÄúFrench fries‚Äù - Birdy was recommended with fries as a ‚Äúmenu highlight‚Äù. There was no one else in the restaurant when we ordered, so can‚Äôt blame any sort of rush. Very disappointing.

On the burger front, the chicken burger was decent. The falafel burger was very dry.

The owner/manager who initially greeted us was nice and friendly. The server was totally impartial.

If you‚Äôre only spending a few days in Paris, don‚Äôt waste your time here.; Good hemade burgers, quick service, reasonable prices, and 600 mts from Eiffel tower.

Its a small cafe with limited space but good enf for a quick bite.; honestly a bit sad about the place, we were really looking forward to trying their burgers but were left disappointed. maybe it was a bad evening for them but burger was very raw and meat tasteless and french fries were cold and very soft (felt like they were made a while ago). home made ketchup is brilliant and milkshake was quite nice, service is friendly too. maybe as I said it wasn't a good day for them.

name: Zia
reviews:
Everything was good!. We had the avocado toast that my husband  really liked, and I had the Dutch  baby pancake which was excelent.

The coffee was also very good.

The Service was very friendly; Great service and friendly staff. Delicious and fresh orange juice; we loved our meals: chicken burrito and shakshuka. It was a spontaneous stop after the game and we were pleasantly surprised! Would come back and recommend to friends and family.; Very nice coffee shop type of atmosphere. The chicken burrito is great. Fresh orange juice.c latte and granola bowl are also very good.; After a 45-minute wait for my order, my food finally arrived, with others who came later already finishing theirs. Feeling extremely hangry, I had to remind the waitress once. She was polite but could sense my frustration, so she kindly gave me a discount on the bill. They don't normally include a service charge.

As for the food, my pancake was mediocre, but my husband loved his burrito.

Despite the hot weather, the lack of air conditioning inside the restaurant was disappointing. We wanted to order cold drinks, but the ice machine was broken. However, they did offer ice water, which was appreciated.; An amazing brunch experience. Definitely have the full brunch. At ‚Ç¨28 it may seem a bit steep for breakfast but it‚Äôs an experience not to be missed. The coffee is excellent. Fresh juice. Delicious homemade granola starter and a main of your choice all included. I had the burrito and it was fantastic. Nice big portions. Avocado toast and the pancakes were to die for also! Friendly staff and they speak English. Owner is friendly dude from New Mexico in the US. We thoroughly enjoyed it here. Perfect stop around the corner from the Eiffel Tower. Go here!

name: 750g La Table
reviews:
I had dinner at 750g.

The atmosphere is relaxed and casual, perfect for a dinner with friends. The decor is eccentric, kitsch, but cozy.

The food was good. I had egg with a mix of fried mushrooms and veg couscous. Both definitely tasty and well-prepared.

The menu is often changed, but vegetarian options are always available.

Service was friendly and efficient.

Overall, 750g is a reliable choice for a casual meal in Paris. It's a good option if you're looking for a comfortable place to eat with good food.; An excellent budget bistro.

I've had multiple entrees, mains and desserts and everything I've had has been very good to excellent.

On several occations there has been room for 2-4 without reservations.

Includes options of entree+main or main+desert for 22‚Ç¨, full 3 course for 26‚Ç¨, excellent value for money.

The pictures include a 'perfect egg', steak and fries and a rice pudding, all very good and tasty.

Can strongly recommend if you do not have a reservation for the night after a day at the expo center.; Food was good, not the best I‚Äôve had in France but it was pretty good, and the atmosphere was really great and cute! About half of the menu was gluten-feee or was able to be done gluten-free, which was nice but there wasn‚Äôt much detail provided in French or English on the dishes and how they were served.
Additionally, I will preference this next part by saying that we were there during the Olympics and it was probably 80% full, but our service was pretty bad. We ordered a bottle of wine when we sat down and had to ask 3 different people for it and it still took about 30 min to get it. We also asked for bread multiple times and it still took about 15 min, and our food was cold by the time the bread got there.; I really liked this restaurant. We were quickly seated just before 20:00, and the staff of young waiters was very friendly to my American colleagues who do not speak French (it's my first language). One co-worker was vegetarian, which is always a challenge in Paris, and she enjoyed a nice vegetable curry. I was happy that they had magr√®s de canard (duck breast) on the menu of specials. It was very good. Not great or awesome, but satisfying enough and I had a very pleasant meal. The ambiance is really nice. The glass-door terrace gives the place an outdoor feel while staying inside, away from the incessant French smokers. The decor is super lively and fun, quite refreshing with vibrant decorations and greenery. Definitely a recommended spot for a nice French dinner and a good break from the traditional Brasserie.; Good for value restaurant and obviously very popular among locals. We were quite amused to see that the local police also visits them and one even got a rousing birthday celebration.
The food is decent though some are obviously better than others.

name: In Casa - Paris
reviews:
Incredible food and exceptional service! The ambiance was fantastic as well. We tried both pasta and pizza, and they were absolutely perfect‚Äî10/10. Although the restaurant closes at 11 PM, we arrived around 10 PM and placed a dessert order at 11 PM, and they graciously accommodated us. The staff was incredibly kind and ensured we had a wonderful experience. This is added to my go-to Italian place.; We spent a few days in Paris and visited them twice - lunch and dinner. The staff are very friendly, we feel easy to communicate and dine in the restaurant. On the day for lunch, we need to go to airport and request them to serve the dishes quicker, it is very nice that they can do it.; We walked in to this place by accident after giving a miss to the tourist traps located near the Eiffel Tower and this was the best wrong turn we took. Amazing food and amazing ambience. Located in a quiet street, it was a perfect dinner. Staff was super friendly and helpful, plus very fluent in English. Definitely would come back of we are in Paris!; Food was incredible, service was really friendly and restaurant had a good atmosphere. Best food we‚Äôve eaten in Paris and for a good price. Definitely recommend.; Restaurant was located near the tower but the street was nice and quiet and very safe. Restaurant was not full at all when we arrived around 18:00, the service was good but most importantly the food was delicious and well priced with many options.
Highly considered as a nice quiet option that won‚Äôt break your bank!

name: Playdate Montevid√©o
reviews: After I moved to Paris from Germany, I needed a place where my son will see other kids before finding a place at creche. If you have the same reason, it‚Äôs perfect. They also provide ecole preparation courses. The place is not big but it provides enough things for kids or babies. Out of all lessons I‚Äôve been to, I recommend 11000% baby art class. Every week different theme and amazing teacher. I wish other classes can adopt and change from time to time :); We had a great time with my daughter singing all her favorite nursery rhymes! Playing with some props. The instructor was great, had a wonderful voice and very attentive towards all the babies in attendance.; I visited the centre with my 6 months old baby. I really liked the play its beautiful & very active. The problem was the playtime session was mentioned for 6-36 months but there was not much to do there.. it is more for 18 months onwards.. I would really suggest if they can mention it clearly; Amazing team and very clean space. The kids and parents had a great time. Will definitely come back.; Nice ,spacious place with beautiful colors, clean and welcoming! Friendly stuff English speakers! Love it very much !

name: Playgreen
formatted_address: 113 Rue de la Faisanderie, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
It's a great experience! The game is well designed, a great chance to discover and rediscover Montmartre with a different perspective. Our game master is Pierre-Alexandre is very nice and warms, giving much help and some nice explanations to the puzzle and the district as well. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED; A hidden gem in Paris.
Definitely one of the experiences one shouldn't miss in Paris. We rediscovered Montmartre while learning all about it's fascinating history. This all thanks to the wonderful game-master Eglantine. She surely puts her heart and soul into the work. The game was fun, educational and professionally crafted.
I highly recommend it!; Eglantine was a wonderful host and we had an amazing time. My 11 year old son said it was his best experience in Paris and we tried to fit a lot in during our visit! It‚Äôs saying something! The puzzles were fun and enough of a challenge to keep our son engaged from start to finish (the parents too)! Eglantine gave us additional history and background during each stop during the game, took photos for us, and was charming and kind. We felt fortunate that Montmartre was ours to enjoy and that we could learn special things about a very special place. We highly recommend Eglantine and her experience.; Excellent hosting of the game by Jeanne and Anthony! Even with a super diverse group of 36 people from France, Italy and Spain they managed the activity well. Would highly recommend it as a team-building exercise!; The Escape game was very fun and informative. The game master setup the experience so we could solve clues and see many attractions and hidden aspects of Paris. We enjoyed the experience very much and she is highly recommended to provide a personalized adventure.

name: Il Cottage
reviews:
We drove by on a weekday and the terrace looked cozy and funny for an Italian Restaurant that pretended to be a ski club in summer in Paris.

I noticed they had a buffet with salads, pizza, cheese, vegetables and pasta‚Äôs. Looked great, so we decided to take it. Two drinks were included for a pretty decent price.

We were not disappointed. The food was good and very tasty. There were also some slices with Pizza Bianca left. These were great! I trust that the rest of their menu was good as well.; We wandered in off the street and we're pleasantly surprised by this offbeat restaurant. Good pizza and calzone. Good crust, fresh arugula, great prices. We liked it.; The only thing saving this place from a lower rating is the fact that food is really good at a nice price and and the outdoor terrace is super nice on a sunny day. The service is super slow (only two severs on a busy Saturday afternoon - seems like a management scheduling error ?) It‚Äôs also child friendly but menu options are limited on the weekend ..; Great location and amazing concept. As an Italian living in paris I explore all the food places claiming a relation with Italy. Food wasn‚Äôt bad at all to be honest but the two stars are for the service : slow and not very attentive to the customers needs and demands. After a walk in the nearby park de boulogne it‚Äôs a nice place to stop for some food and some drinks especially in a sunny day; A really extraordinary spot near the Boulogne Forest :-) Hans among customers is really what one would not expect in the central Paris :-)

name: Jardin d'enfants
vicinity: Jardins du Trocad√©ro, Place du Trocad√©ro et du 11 Novembre, Paris
formatted_address: Jardins du Trocad√©ro, Pl. du Trocad√©ro et du 11 Novembre, 75016 Paris, France
opening_hours: ['Monday: Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday: Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday: Open 24 hours', 'Thursday: Open 24 hours', 'Friday: Open 24 hours', 'Saturday: Open 24 hours', 'Sunday: Open 24 hours']
reviews: The beautiful park near eiffle tower 24 h open so close view for photos of tower; Great place for kids to play while parents can enjoy the beautiful Eiffel Tower view!; If you are traveling with kids make sure to walk by this park during your visit. Great view with a play area for the kids and place to take pictures.; A great shaded area for kids preferably 4 and older.; Nice place for the kids to play while the tourist parents take photos of the Eiffel from whichever angle they please

name: Cr√™pe Station
reviews:
**Hole-in-the-wall**

Place is very small so order for take out!!

Food was Delicious!! They have both savory and sweet crepes along with hotdogs and paninis!

I ordered the
-Bombay Crepe (savory) - non spicy, eggs, chicken, sauteed bell peppers, cheddar cheese
-and the build your own Bubble Waffle with Nutella, crunch and banana 10/10!!
That was for both me and my fiance and we are satisfied!! It only took like 5 mins for them to make and bring out! I will definitely come again before my trip ends!

They have English speaking crew but definitely learn some french!

10/23/24
Opens at 11am
No bathrooms
Small sitting area (order for take out)
No parking enjoy the walk
Literal hole in the wall; We went to this place to get some dinner for evening. Sadly the waffles were not available, but they had other options that did not disappoint. We ordered a hotdog and some crepes to go. The wait was less than 10 minutes for the food to get prepared. It was presented in some nice paper containers and a bag to carry the food back to the hotel. I appreciate when businesses use environmental friendly materials like paper and not styrofoam.

The crepes were delicious and the hotdog was a hit for my son. I would definitely eat here again when I‚Äôm in Paris again.; Roaming the streets of Paris, exhausted us.
Finally found this little place in the crowded lanes of Paris.
The guy was amazingly friendly. Humble and patiently explained all the items
We ordered XL Tachos and Crepe.
Frankly it was just average food. Nothing special.
It just did the job.; Really nice Crepe! I chose the Kentucky one! Good price for a really tasty crepe! Also, I took the milkshake and it was one of the greatest I have drunk! The employee was very kind! I would recommend it to everyone!; Tiny but cozy crepe place! We went twice already, once for dinner and another time for dessert. You can choose your own toppings.
