Service is quick and polite. The crepes itself are fresh and crispy. Loved every bite! We plan to go again for another dessert crepe üòÅ

name: Pop's
reviews:
Fantastic service, very very welcoming and friendly.  The food was even better. Black risotto as well as the day's special risotto with Coquille saint jacques and asparagus.
Both risottos were creamy, one of the best we've ever had.  Tasted really good.  The Coquilles were a tiny bit too hard but still very tasty.  Finished it all up with a tiramisu which was very big and very good!; Had a lovely time here. The waiter was so friendly and the food was amazing, especially for the price. I definitely recommend the squid ink risotto. It is in a quiet spot so not too busy. Would go again; Manager/owner has created a welcoming and inviting place to come for a bite to eat (pasta, tuna, or pizza). The inside or outside seating is quaint.; Excellent! Peaceful environment, great food and friendly staff which makes your experience very enjoyable! It‚Äôs worthy to highlight the high level of the desserts‚Ä¶ amazing! Also to remark, the great value for money since we paid less than 30‚Ç¨ each including dinner with a bottle of wine; Had an absolutely amazing experience here tonight. We ordered the entrec√¥te, with a bottle of red wine with tiramisu and chocolate mousse for dessert. The entrec√¥te was perfect made with an amaaazing bernaise sauce, with 10/10 crispy fries. The desserts were also super good, I really can recommend them both!

But the best thing about this experience was the amazing service we got here. Everyone working there cared about our well being and made sure everyone was okay. We got a read through of the menue, recommendations, taste of the wine and just big smiles from everyone. Very genuine people. Strongly recommend you to take a visit here! The pizza also looked amazing from here.

Thank you for amazing service, and delicious food and wine, we will be back! -Couple from Norway

name: Moli crepes
reviews:
The person behind the counter cleaned the windows and tables in the small store. Then he prepared my crepes without having washed his hands. He touched the crepes with his fingers several times. It did not feel hygienic for me.
It is better if the crepes and all ingredients are ONLY touched with forks and knifes for example.; This place was amazing. The gentleman running it and cooking gave the best customer service. The food!!! AMAZING! Then crepes for dessert. We are from America and was a group of 9 of us, ages 1 month, 2 yrs, 13 yrs, and rest were adults. These kids are picky and next thing I know, the next night everyone wanted to go back. So we did and again, it was GREAT! We even sat out front and they found us an extra chair, I say this was above and beyond for us. So happy with our choice!; Mind blown by how creative and SO YUMMY my curry chicken cheese mushroom crepe was!!! Enjoyed every single amazing bite and melted away with the flavors!!! So so good you must try it!!! I‚Äôll come back again when in Paris!!; Amin attended our order and was extremely friendly from the beginning until the end. We had some extremely delicious chicken crepes and had a nice chat with him as well. Loved the experience. Would recommend everyone to try this place. You won‚Äôt regret!!; it‚Äôs a clean restrestaurant .Owners and employees treat customers with good behavior.I have ever seen it‚Äôs a best best best crepes in paris,go and try this crepes i hope everyone enjoy it

name: Birdy
reviews:
I went to Birdy Burger restaurant before work this afternoon and ordered their special of the month, the Olympic Burger, as a meal with Coke Zero and chips.

Firstly, I need to say the burger came to my table in less than 10 minutes‚Äîthe service was impressively fast! The taste of the burger was good, and I enjoyed it. The chips were normal, nothing particularly special.

They provided a bottle of water with my meal, which was a nice touch, but it didn‚Äôt add much to the overall experience. However, they forgot to give me some napkins, but that wasn‚Äôt a big problem.

Overall, I enjoyed my visit, and I think Birdy Burger is a good option for a quick takeaway.; If you want a classic American styled cheeseburger in Paris, this is it.

Portions were generous and everything about the burger was done to perfection.

And oh yes, don‚Äôt forget to order the peanut butter milkshake.; Take away cheeseburger with sweet potato fries. Had to wait about thirty minutes as they were busy. But oh my gosh, what a burger. Well worth the wait. Chips were ok, but burger was out of this world. Highly recommend.; Amazing experience at Birdy! When you go for a fast food you expect a basic service but the veggie burger was absolutely amazing. Very great burgers, great service, super fun team! Great food I will come back any time I‚Äôm in Paris! +1 for the milkshake; Very friendly service from the staff at Birdy.
They welcomed me very warmly and explained their concept and different type of burgers.

The burger and fries were good but nothing out of the common. I ordered the Yankee and it was Ok.

I feel prices are extremely high for the size and type of the hamburger‚Äôs.

19‚Ç¨ for a burger, drink and fries see to me very expensive.

name: Coffee Parisien
reviews:
Eggs benedict and ceaser salad delicious - great terrasse; Lovely french bistro to grab a quick bite. The crispy chicken sandwich I was awesome. Service was lightening quick and friendly. Glad I stumbled upon this today.; Bbq ribs was big  tasty service good food arrived fast, for kids meal order chicken balls and fries, my kid love it; Super tasty food!
Particularly love their club sandwiches, pecan pie and cheesecake
Overall you won‚Äôt be disappointed by whatever you order; Even though I happen to work for Starbucks, I've never really been a coffee everyday type of person. That all changed while visiting Paris, I fell in love with @coffeeparisien, the coffee and burgers are fantastic. The ambiance was perfect, but what really made it super welcoming was the staff: Alexandra, Julia, Philippe and Mary made me feel as if their home was my home, and definitely gave me something to look forward to when I visit Paris again!

name: Jardin du Ranelagh
opening_hours: ['Monday: Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday: Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday: Open 24 hours', 'Thursday: Open 24 hours', 'Friday: Open 24 hours', 'Saturday: Open 24 hours', 'Sunday: Open 24 hours']
reviews:
Beautiful jardin/parc just across the street Rue Louis Boilly and just nearby Musee Marmottan Monet.
I‚Äôm just taking rest and drinking rest my feet after long walks and enjoying the museum then sitting on the bench here.
There‚Äôs also little soccer or futsal field for kiddos playing around.; Nice park, quite quiet. Lots of benches, an outdoor gym and play park. Lots of shade; Nice open spaces. It has 2 playground areas for children, separated by a street with cars passing by, so you have to choose. It also has an outdoors fitness area for adults. Passing cars across the middle keep it from being truly quiet. There is puppet theatre with sessions at 3:15pm and 4:15pm for EU3.50. And there are ponies available for rides in the afternoon.; Great place to hang out with the kids, have a picnic or just workout. Although it's open 24/7, it's safe to bring kids and toddlers.; Very family friendly park with lots of room to picnic, lay in the grass, take a walk. Very nice atmosphere.

Kiosk on weekends for snacks and drinks.

name: Jardin Christiane Desroches-Noblecourt (ex-de la place Rodin)
reviews: Me and my friend enjoy the use of exercising manual machine the place is quiet and with fresh air; Nice and green it is good for family and kids to escape in a close park; Beautiful park for the kids .. perfect for all kind of age ..; It's a nice place, a good playground for the kids...  It's good for sun bathing alsoüòâ; The favourite playground of our 18m kid. Less crowded than Jardin du Ranelagh.

name: Le Chalet des √éles
vicinity: Bois de Boulogne, Embarcad√®re du Chalet des √éles Porte de la Muette Ceinture du lac inf√©rieur du, Paris
formatted_address: Embarcad√®re du Chalet des √éles Porte de la Muette Ceinture du lac inf√©rieur du, Bois de Boulogne, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
Went here for a staff dinner with my coworkers. The setting is beautiful, the tables are out in a garden and everything is gorgeous, tastefully decorated and calming to the soul. Disappointed in the service as it was very very long between each course and they actually forgot about our desserts (apparently they were sent to another table) the food was alright, nothing exceptional, seasonal produce well cooked but not well seasoned and no interesting spices or sauces.. a shame the food and service wasn‚Äôt to the same standard as the setting.; Wait was long despite only a few tables being served. They're under staffed when we visited, but they're pretty nice. Food taste wasn't so special, though pleasing in the eye and cost may be worth the maintenance of the restaurant in a romantic isle setting. I particularly love the cozy raft ride. Relaxing and romantic.; Honestly for the price point, I was quite disappointed by the service. I understand the appeal is the atmosphere, which is undoubtedly magical, but our waitress forgot our order twice and then brought our aperitif with our appetizers which we specifically asked for the two to be served separately. Personally, I don‚Äôt like to sip a fruity cocktail with a ceviche and I probably would‚Äôve ordered white wine with the appetizer had the cocktails not arrived at the same time as the first course. The waitress also completely forgot our table at the end so we did not want to wait around for dessert, although we might have ordered something had she not been so distracted. The lack of attention to detail in the service really brought down the quality of the overall experience, although the food was very good and the atmosphere lovely. For 18‚Ç¨ for an aperitif, I expect more from the service.; Greeted by a very rude waitress,

We asked to sit in the garden but she told us no, you will be sitting on the balcony knowing when we booked we asked for our table to be lower on the terrace.

We asked for water several times and the food was very ordinary,and not delicious; Delicious meals with good ideas in combining flavours. The ambiance is amazing near the lake. You reach the island by water shuttle for 2 euros.

name: Petite For√™t
reviews: So happy to have found this wonderful, much needed, welcoming space for moms and babies in the middle of the hectic (not always child-friendly) city of Paris. Lots of room, clean space, friendly staff, cute children‚Äôs products. And the coffee is always great!!! I also cannot wait to try the classes once my baby is a bit older. Thank you for creating this haven for parents and kids!!!; The perfect cafe if you're in central Paris with small children. Gives the children a chance to run around, play, relax with books and enjoy a meal. Staff very friendly. The menu is a little limited for savoury meals.; Great little cafe if you have little ones. The staff are incredibly friendly! The coffee was good and the food was fantastic. We had a salad and a pesto pasta, while our 1-year-old loved the tomato pasta. The baby change and bathroom facilities are great, especially for kids.; There's no other place like Petite For√™t in Paris. Kids and families are not only welcome but it's a paradise, especially made for them. You can enjoy a hot (!) drink and a cake with delicious berries while the little ones play with the many beautiful and high quality, wooden toys, books etc. There're several stokke highchairs with different seats (yes, infant seats as well!) to make it more comfortable for everyone, playmat for the littlest, lots of space for the kiddos to play and move around, proper parking space for the pushchairs, delicious tea, coffee and cakes on the (expanding) menu, healthy snack and drinks for the children and honestly, I could just keep going on. The founders, Laura and Kaja are very kind and attentive who created the most amazing place for families. Did I mention¬† there's a bf pillow, changing table, several children's size toilets, all in a beautiful, clean and hygienic bathroom? Seriously, the list goes on.; I had the luck to find this lovely caf√© just after they opened. Inside it‚Äôs spacious and full of light, and very family/child friendly. I enjoyed the small touches, like how pretty all of their ceramics (plates/bowls/cups) are. Both my latte and cinnamon brioche were delicious. I‚Äôm curious to see what kind of ateliers they will offer in the future - I‚Äôll definitely be back!

name: Ernestine Caf√©
formatted_address: 72 Rue Joseph de Maistre, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
**5 Stars - Amazing Spot!**

Loved my visit to Ernestine Cafe! The coffee was rich and flavorful, and the pastries were fresh and delicious. The cozy atmosphere and friendly staff make it a perfect place to relax or catch up with friends. Will definitely be back!üíñü§© highly recommend; Was just walking by and decided to give the cafe a chance, I‚Äôm so glad I did!

The cozy interior is very charming, they host a lot of children workshops here in a separate playroom open for them to play in while their parents enjoy their meal / drink. There‚Äôs a large window looking into the playroom so parents can watch their kids but also have a bit of space to themselves, very family friendly and innovative. The atmosphere is very pleasant and welcoming; there‚Äôs mostly locals who stop by here but Ernestine Cafe is also very tourist friendly because the workers speak and understand English well.

The menu is diverse and creative, with all the food being made in house. They have a restroom in the back which makes it convenient to spend some time here. I ordered their brunch and left quiet full and content, will definitely stop by the next time I‚Äôm in Paris!; Ernestine is the caf√© I always wanted. It has delicious and wonderful caf√© options, the food is copious and nicely priced, there are ateliers and storytelling in English and French, and I feel relaxed and at home there. More importantly, so does my baby. Also, Yannis has an intuitive and sentimental capital that really lends the sense there is a love of children; it is not an attention confined to merely the children's section.; It is a very cosy and charming cafe with a special area for children. While our one year daughter is playing we can enjoy excellent macchiato. Don't miss this place if you have young kids and like very good coffee.; Super cosy and relaxing shop.

name: Pari-Grandir Paris 17
vicinity: chez Montessori's Cool, 5 Rue Emile Allez, Paris
formatted_address: chez Montessori's Cool, 5 Rue Emile Allez, 75017 Paris, France

name: Break | Restaurant Paris 17 | Terrasse | Brunch Paris
reviews:
Amazing brunch place with a fabulous atmosphere, amazing decor and delicious food.
We ordered 3 of their brunch items and they were all utterly delicious. The whole place is decorated as an ode to Alice in wonderland in a simple yet creative way.
But the best (out of all good things in this place) was the service. Despite having a full house, the service was quick and smooth, and Laura, the owner always with a bright smile and a kind word, would still manage to exchange a few words with every table. We highly recommend you try this place and next time we are in a Paris we will visit again.; The place was nice and unique and I did enjoy the vibes. The service was great as well. But the food pancakes that I ordered were mediocre and was not worth 17‚Ç¨. However the coffee was extremely good. Would come back for coffee; Burger was good. My girl ordered a BLT w/avocado. Ended up with a strange club type sandwich with egg and chicken and no bacon. Definitely a language barrier in describing what kind of BLT she wanted. They graciously replaced the sandwich.(I described through Google translate a dry toast, bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado sandwich) came back very close but poorly executed blta.; Amazing place and staff aswell.
The food was incredible!; I recently visited this establishment and had a very disappointing experience. The waitress was extremely rude, not even bothering to greet us. As we started to place our order, she abruptly walked away and began setting tables around us. The lack of basic courtesy and attention to customers was unacceptable. We decided to leave without completing our order.

name: Square Sainte-Odile
formatted_address: 9 Bd de la Somme, 75017 Paris, France
reviews: A big Park üèûÔ∏è for kids and Family to create memories,or to past time while breathing the fresh air from the tree's and ‚òòÔ∏è plants the sorrounding, very near as well with the big church of Saint Odile; Large park. Green and calm. Though smoking is not allowed, some people smoke inside.; This is the square with a view of the St Odile church.; Near the sainte- Odile church. Nice park for children filled with trees. Calm place to spend time.; Silent and a place with a welcoming air.

name: VALMA
reviews: We are so lucky to have Valma a few steps from our home. Delicious food, friendly staff, cozy atmosphere. The menu is simple and changes weekly and constantly, pleasantly surprises us. We come here regularly and plan to brings friends, family, and visitors alike. Highly recommend this hidden gem.; Walked in excited and left super annoyed.ü§¨The restaurant had easily 8 tables open, maybe 6 with customers and when the person in the cashier understood we spoke English she told us that all the remaining tables were reserved. Seriously!?! Typical rude Parisian restaurant workers ! AVOID THEM!!!; Cool place for a Sunday brunch, the quality of the food is excellent and simple with good portion, the taste is good, not phenomenal , the juices were very good and original, but it is a bit small and when it gets busy, it gets loud.; Great food and great staff! Highly recommend. Made to feel very welcome; Very nice place for a brunch during weekend. Food is very good, kept simple. Kids friendly place. Best to book.

name: Little Italia
reviews:
pizza is very tasteful and had fresh ingredients on it!  üëç
I loooved it! ü´∂
The burrata was incredible,‚ù§Ô∏è
it was out of this world yummy!!üòä
The price is also very reasonable..üôÇ; Just an excellent place to eat delicious healthy foods! Service admired as super polite, nice. Food is outstanding! Not only me, but all the people were transmitting happy vibes enjoying so much masterpiece on each plate! Big thank for such pleasant experience!!!
Sea food Salad "putipu" was wow!; Great pizza! Very welcoming staff. We got our pizza super quciky and most importantly with a smile. Recommend a 100%; Tasty and fresh pizza in paris 17, the staff and service were brilliant and fast. Definitely recommend this place if you are up to for a pizza.; You may see a nice pizza and you may think it‚Äôs a Neapolitan pizza but it‚Äôs  just extra dough. I am quite surprised with the name little Italia or trying to relate to the Italian pizza. It‚Äôs a big scaaaaaaaam

name: Bistrot M√îM
reviews:
Came to celebrate my birthday.  Lovely atmosphere but my steak was chewy, not great, and I found a hair in my fries. Even though my friends said their pasta and risotto was all right. Wine was good. I don't think I'll come again.; The chef did a great job with the food selection for the New Year's Eve dinner! We enjoyed the sea bass and beef dishes, with elegant presentation and generous portions. Friendly, cozy and chic atmosphere tucked away in a lovely neighborhood. Thank you for making our family's NYE dinner special!; Nice French resto with a lot of options. The prices are reasonable & the service is great. Had a birthday here and did not dissapoint. The only drawback was that it the taste of the food was just good, not great or unbelievable, and this is not a bad thing actually.; Loved the place ! Food and drinks are of good quality and staff is nice and welcoming. Prices might be a bit high but you won‚Äôt regret it.
To top it off the blind test on the first floor and the private room allow you to plan for more than just a nice meal.; Impeccable service and absolutely delicious food. Highly recommended.

name: Omilgout
reviews:
We ate 2 pizzas for 20‚Ç¨, which I think is one of the best prices you can get in Paris. Pizzas were really tasty, one of the best I ate. The only disadvantage is there isn't a place to sit and eat. But if the weather is good you can enjoy your pizzas at a nearby park, which to me sounds like a nice Paris activity. ü•≥; I love this place! I had the Peps pizza and the pasta bolognese. The pizza was excellent. My only complaint is that I didn't buy two! The cheese was tasty and stringy, like good mozzarella should be. The sauce was tangy without being overwhelming and the crust was light with the perfect taste of pizza oven. The thin crust was sufficient to hold the significant cheese and pepperoni topping. The pepperoni was crisp and delicious.

The pasta bolognese was great! There was a lot in that little container. The pasta was perfectly cooked, and the sauce was quite rich (and there was plenty of it). The sauce had quite a bit of meat in it and was very tasty.

Lastly, the cost was very reasonable. I would definitely recommend this place. Note that it's take out only, and there's no place to sit. Don't let that stop you. Great pizza and very friendly owner/staff.; Very tasty pizza and dessert. Excellent service and reasonably priced. Everything for the most part was homemade and fresh. Great experience!; Great pizza, great value and a great welcome. Just a short walk from the Gare Saint Lazare. Highly recommended.; Amazing pizza!!! Crust, sauce and cheese were so delicious! Dough was being made for our pizza fresh. Definitely recommend stopping here!

name: Cage √† poule
reviews: Managed to be one of the first few customers as they just opened upthe staff are super friendly, the Bulgogi burger was amazing and the chicken nuggets were so fresh. I would definitely come again; Very bed parson not good toking Reception menejar; Super smash Burger; Amazing food; Top

name: STREET FOOD ORIGINAL
formatted_address: 12 Rue du G√©n√©ral Lanrezac, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
It's probably a foodie secret that if you want great food, you need to get out of the primary thrufare or main streets and get to side streets and gullies which it turned out to be true in this case. Went with the family for a sit in dinner after visiting 'Arc de triomphe'. It was a 10 min walk and shop's sitting arrangements begs improvements.
But, man the food was quite great, tasty and warm. We ordered few things across the menu like pesto panini, arrabiata pasta, omelet, fries and home made Thiramusu. They got lot of food options.
Food was somewhat quick given there were only 2 people, one taking orders and one cooking in the kitchen, it's a small place with seating for only upto 10 or 12 folks....
I'd give more for service. They both were awesome.
If you are in the neighborhood do plan to visit them for lunch or dinner.; Wonderful experience! We are visiting and this pizza was amazing! Some of the best pizza we‚Äôve had and we are coming from New York. We will eat here again before we leave. The owner was very kind and welcoming!; We ordered different dishes here, pasta, burger, pizza & cr√™pes. The pizza was the best, the rest were plain and not much taste.; Food was just perfect. We ordered a pizza and dessert crepe. Some of the best pizza I've had, and I used to live in NYC. The man (owner?) who was preparing the food was so friendly as well. And to top it off, it was one of the most affordable meals we've had in Paris so far. I highly recommend!!; Great place close to the city visiting area and worth a trip there if you are looking for a mouth watering food üòä. Been to the restaurant with my family and there is food for everyone both kids and grown ups .

name: Waffle Factory
reviews:
This was the waffle factory in the courtyard  of the SO Ouest mall. Kids loved the waffles and we ordered using the self service console, which had an English language option - a member of staff came round to help clarify a query.

They had a plain chocolate option which was good because we have nut allergies and we sat in the clean sitting area next to the ¬¥kiosk‚Äô.  A lovely experience all around and satisfied customers.; (edited update)

I talked with the store manager and he explained to me later that prices increased during the pandemic and it wasn‚Äôt updated on google maps, which created the confusion!

I have changed my rating to reflect the new information provided by ‚Äú Mr. Shakeeb‚Äù the store manager.
‚Ä¶

ASK FOR THE RECEIPT! STEALING CASHIERS! CHECK PRICES

I ordered the nature waffle with lotus topping and I ended up paying ‚Ç¨3.90 while the real price is ‚Ç¨3.50 !! When I suspected that I was charged not the right price, she told me that is the price while it was not true!! Then she went to talk with her colleague!!; Staff was super friendly particulary the dynamic young cashier,  the food was very fresh and fast, Definitely coming back here.No hesitation about this recommendation !; Low quality of waffle, tastes are really so so.; Staff was super friendly

name: Un Air de Famille
formatted_address: 26 R. du Ch√¢teau Landon, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: Really cozy , beautiful and welcoming people at the restaurant, I ate my first desert in Paris and it was goood; Kids friendly great food healthy; Very pleasant place and very nice staff especially for the child care part.; Taste good, all aspects are pretty good; Amazing place and excellent food!

name: All Good Things Paris
reviews:
Spent time browsing through so many other brunch options in Montemarte and settled on this last minute

Came early on a Friday morning, one of their first customers. Their coffee was surprisingly really good! We ordered an americano and latte. My husband and I don‚Äôt drink coffee often but we loved it here. It came with pain au chocolate which were divine with our espressos. We also had the croque madame, good balance of meat, cheese and sunny side up egg but the toast underneath was a little dry. Still good nonetheless. Our waitress was so nice and sweet. Loved the atmosphere of this restaurant! Clean bathrooms.; Location top and staff amazing and super friendly! We had a brunch this morning and WOW! Food is super tasty ! We will definitely come back! Ps: un gracias especial a Federico, que ha sido s√∫per simp√°tico y habla un italiano perfecto! üòâüòâüòâ
A big thanks to everyone.. we will definitely come back! Giulia & Sara from Italy üáÆüáπ; Second visit, the first being brunch.
Very friendly and the place was buzzing for dinner tonight. The host and staff were attentive and even helped with our struggles with french yet made us feel at ease. The menu was available online in English which was greatly appreciated. Food was excellent and the staff even went a little more than needed with service. I Enjoyed three courses and would happily eat here again.; Great place, amazing service, cute interior, very good food. We had the Eggs Benedict with Cheddar and Ham (‚Ç¨15) and it‚Äôs just like you‚Äôd wish them. They have full brunch menu for ‚Ç¨25 with drinks included. There‚Äôs space for improvement for the Home Made Iced Tea, though. The taste is very faded, basically flavoured water and does not correspond to the price (‚Ç¨5). Still this place gets 5 stars from me for everything else.; Went on a Sunday morning for a buffet. It was excellent, pic below is part of what they offered, there was more ‚Ä¶.The food was perfect from the eggs right down to the hot chocolate. 10/10, the price was worth the experience and quality of food and service. Bravo

name: Mignon Caf√©
reviews:
Oh my god, the food here is so good!! The 25‚Ç¨ brunch is well worth it. Incredible value. I had the house lemonade, a latt√©, the avocado tartine, the overnight porridge (a lovely delicate mixture of soaked oats, chia seed and fresh fruit), and a slice of apple caramel cake to finish. The cake was the highlight, though everything was delish. The waitress told me that everything is handmade, and you can definitely taste that in the food.; So delicious - the flavors of the avocado toast with sesame sprinkle all over!! And the pesto was incredible. The eggs - boiled on top of the toast or salad - very fresh and yummy!! We loved the waffle with fruit and enjoyed the juices - Fresh squeezed Ginger, Carrot, Lemon. Apple, Ginger, Lemon..and more!!! Great prices and super friendly staff.; Great carrot cake.
Coffee, really not good at all. I had a coffee earlier the day at the excellent Casa (specialty coffee Paris XII).
Well, the contrast was sad.

Also we waited about ten minutes with few clients for our drinks and the waitress mixed up the cakes also.

Improve the coffee and service and you'll improve your rating.; The best brunch I‚Äôve ever had! Ok, to be honest, I haven‚Äôt had many brunches in my life so far‚Ä¶ and it was my first time in Paris as well. But it was so delicious I don‚Äôt know if anything can be better‚Ä¶ freshly squeezed orange juice - great taste, not acidic, superb pro matcha, overnight porridge I never thought could be so special, extraordinary avocado toast (of those I‚Äôve had quite a lot, so trust me that this one was top notch), and waffle, the waffle!!! with salted caramel‚Ä¶ oh my mouth, stomach, eyes, everything, so happy, super full for 25‚Ç¨‚Ä¶ I didn‚Äôt eat until dinner‚Ä¶ Merci!!! I need to learn French!; Small but lovely place. Very nice service, great selection of food, coffee and tea. Coffee comes with a choice of plant-based milk if you prefer a vegan option.

We had the chai and coffee latte, and a granola, which was awesome. The bowls and toasts looked awesome, too.

Can recommend!

name: Tribu Coffee R√©cr√©atif
formatted_address: 183 Rue du Faubourg Poissonni√®re, 75009 Paris, France
reviews: A fun, friendly environment! They have coffee, tea, snacks for kids as well as a great play area with lots of toys and books. They allow laptops as well so I got to get some work done while my family played in the play area. And Ines was really kind as well!; Great little place to come pass an hour or two, with or without kids! The cafe is clean and has a great energy; friendly, welcoming, come-as-you-are vibe. There are so many events for kids and families in their two rooms in the back and downstairs, plus the space in general is made for little ones running around. Can't wait to come back!; Such a great spot for families! We‚Äôre lucky we live steps away as we just had a baby. The owners are so lovely, the coffee & sweets are delicious, and their activities, like yoga, are so great to have in the neighbourhood.; came here as I was looking for a place to let my 11 month old baby have a safe space to roam while this mum gets to drink a warm cup of coffee. Super good atmosphere, quite a good selection of toys to play with, toilet is clean as well. Felt really safe to let my child play here, owners are super friendly as well! Definitely will be back again; Great little place, we had some time to kill before our eurostar train and this was conveniently located. The menu isn't very large (sweets only) but what we tried was very good (matcha white chocolate cookie and chocolate hazelnut cookie). Prices a little steep - 5 euros for very small latte, 4 euros cookie each but I guess you are also paying for the playarea. It felt a little cold inside too.

name: Ernestine Caf√©
formatted_address: 72 Rue Joseph de Maistre, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
**5 Stars - Amazing Spot!**

Loved my visit to Ernestine Cafe! The coffee was rich and flavorful, and the pastries were fresh and delicious. The cozy atmosphere and friendly staff make it a perfect place to relax or catch up with friends. Will definitely be back!üíñü§© highly recommend; Was just walking by and decided to give the cafe a chance, I‚Äôm so glad I did!

The cozy interior is very charming, they host a lot of children workshops here in a separate playroom open for them to play in while their parents enjoy their meal / drink. There‚Äôs a large window looking into the playroom so parents can watch their kids but also have a bit of space to themselves, very family friendly and innovative. The atmosphere is very pleasant and welcoming; there‚Äôs mostly locals who stop by here but Ernestine Cafe is also very tourist friendly because the workers speak and understand English well.

The menu is diverse and creative, with all the food being made in house. They have a restroom in the back which makes it convenient to spend some time here. I ordered their brunch and left quiet full and content, will definitely stop by the next time I‚Äôm in Paris!; Ernestine is the caf√© I always wanted. It has delicious and wonderful caf√© options, the food is copious and nicely priced, there are ateliers and storytelling in English and French, and I feel relaxed and at home there. More importantly, so does my baby. Also, Yannis has an intuitive and sentimental capital that really lends the sense there is a love of children; it is not an attention confined to merely the children's section.; It is a very cosy and charming cafe with a special area for children. While our one year daughter is playing we can enjoy excellent macchiato. Don't miss this place if you have young kids and like very good coffee.; Super cosy and relaxing shop.

name: La REcyclerie
reviews:
What a beautiful space that‚Äôs many things from cafe to restaurant to work space to pop up space. Decorated with recycled goods and plants, there‚Äôs plenty of places to sit indoor and out. Their chocolate croissants were excellent and staff friendly.; Yesterday morning, I left the house wanting to charge my camera, buy a shirt and listen to Prince and i was able to find it all La REcyclerie. The place was different and interesting,the staff were so nice, my croissant was meh and my pain au chocolate was also meh; This gem of a place goes beyond just good coffee‚Äîit's a sustainability haven. With a plethora of engaging activities from workshops to conversations, it fosters a strong sense of community. The staff is exceptional, and the atmosphere is unparalleled. Plus, their commitment to using organic, locally sourced ingredients for their delicious food adds another layer of charm. It's a must-visit for anyone seeking meaningful experiences and eco-conscious living.; A large and welcoming cafe with a heavy tilt toward sustainable choices. I had lunch here alongside businesspeople, families, and young creative types working on laptops. They had several vegetarian options, and a full coffee and alcohol bar. Prices were reasonable, I paid about 15 euro for a hearty soup with a poached and fried egg, a coffee, and a cookie.; I visited during the weekend, and they provided a weekend brunch special which comes with unlimited tea/coffee/hot chocolate and bread.
The view and vibe was amazing.
Food was delicious.
Staff spoke excellent English too, and explained the concept of the weekend deal kindly to me.
I LOVED this cafe.

name: Maison Milie
reviews:
Big surprise!
I find expect much from this place but I couldn't be more wrong! I think it was one of the best shaksuka I've tried! A bit different then the classic one but full of taste and veggies.

The place is very cozy, not too crowded. The dishswere served quickly and the staff was very nice. I highly recommend trying out for a quick lunch.; The service and location are excellent. I loved the presentation of the food as well as the staff. The food was savory and the experience is second to none. The price point is perfect and I will be back soon.; Good brunch. The Matcha is really tasty. The food is good but nothing special. The cafe is in a really good place if you want to visit the Sacr√©-Couer Basilica.; Ordered a mocaccino and iced americano. Drinks are good but they charged 3 extra euros for a ‚Äúcaf√© frapp√©‚Äù when I ordered and received an ice americano. Refused to compensate despite it being on the receipt. Granted they don‚Äôt understand English so avoid if tourist.; Cute cafe in Paris!

Friendly staff made the experience even better. Great food & coffee.

Perfect spot for a cosy weekend brunch!

name: Le Petit Ney
vicinity: 10 Avenue de la Porte de Montmartre, Paris
formatted_address: 10 Av. de la Prte de Montmartre, 75018 Paris, France
reviews: Fantastic with very helpful staff thank you; Top; A supportive place with a warm atmosphere. The cuisine is simple but tasty and the people are very kind. A place that reconciles with humanity.; Very interesting visit to the Bl√©mont district with a guide from Petit Ney who told us lots of unexpected anecdotes about the history of the district.; An atmosphere that is both simple and exciting, great encounters and a brilliant storytelling show: a great journey in all dimensions!!!

name: LE CHIEN DE LA LUNE
reviews:
I had made a reservation for a group of 28 people, mostly US students. We had hummus, couscous or chakchuka--an excellent vegetarian option, with merguez (spicy sausages) added on request--, panna cotta infused with fennel (a superb dessert) and chocolate mousse. Service was fast although the place was busy on a Friday evening, with a young waitress who speaks excellent English. Prices were inexpensive for a Parisian restaurant and the chef, Christian, is very friendly. I will certainly return with friends anytime.; The concept is nice, but you notice the place is new and just starting. The wine was to expensive for the qualtiy in my experience.
In the weekend you can't take the menu option, this is only durning the week. Unfortantly it isn't obviouse. They aren't many other things to chose from. We could chose from the burger or a vegertarian dishe. Both were ok, but not what we where hoping for.
You can sit outside but the neighborhood isn't cosy.; Cute place, had a nice lunch here. A little bit outside from the central but I prefer because it‚Äôs nicer and quiet.; Google really worries me, I stopped for lunch and here is big brother watching over my shoulder! Now the restaurant was very good, both in taste and value not to mention a friendly staff. I'll stop over again anytime.; Great ! A good place to have a drink by nibbling something. I recommand.

name: La Cr√™perie d'Am√©lie
reviews:
this place took my heart‚ù§Ô∏è the coffee is perfect for my taste, and they have 3 kinds of vegan milk)
they also serve good food, bobble tea, matcha and gelato !; The best crepe in the world , that was delicious. We order a Nutella crepe with chocolate and coffee ice cream omg delicious. And also we order coconut ice was like I was young. Amazing; I tried this place on my last morning in Paris and it was by far the best place to have breakfast! The yogurt parfait was made the same day and was very delicious. The egg sandwich was another hit for me as well as the cappuccino! If I ever come back to Paris I will definitely be coming to this place!; A fairly quiet place in the heart of Montmartre, with quite generous and very very tasty menus. Really easy to order your menu with tablets displayed at the entrance,and such a beautiful,quite and warm place to eat.

We decided to repeat and we went today again for the second time on our first visit to Paris (even though being 1h walkingüòÇ) I will recommend it to my friends and family for sure!

We ordered a bacon smash burger,a hot dog and nuggets both days and they were delicious. All of them served by the staff on table on the second floor.

At last,I would like to thank the person in charge (as he already left when we finished) as he recognized us and gave us churros dessert for free to taste them,really good also.

We were really satisfied with your glad and helpful service and will repeat if we come back,thanks a lot!; Perfect crepe for breakfast with fresh orange juice, hot chocolate and coffee - five stars for faty the chef

name: Koff Burger Montmartre
reviews:
This place is by far one of the best burger places! I almost thought we were back in the states! The burger and hot dog were amazing! Definitely can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. I was surprised that there wasn‚Äôt more people in here. We‚Äôll be returning here if we come back to Paris.; Puts 5 guys to shame.

Absolutely 5 stars burger.
Definitely wish I could be back to try the other burger variations.

Went with cheeseburger & wasn't disappointed; I came across KOFF while strolling around Montmartre and was glad I found it. My daughter and I had lunch there and everything was delicious. I had the hamburger which was cooked perfectly medium as I ordered. The fries were among the best I‚Äôve had during my stay. I highly recommend this place.; The food was super tasty and the service was very friendly and attentive.; Yes I was an American that went to an American burger place in France... It was one of the few places open and we figured wth. We were so glad we did! Definitely come here! This was probably one of the best burgers I have had in my life! The fries were excellent too. The service is lacking and it seemed like only two people were working and one disappeared and the other had to pick up the slack. We are also still learning how service really works in France so it may have been a cultural disconnect. But even with that, just go you will not be disappointed. I got the mcFly and my sisters got the bacon cheeseburger, do not expect American level bacon, it was still fantastic though. I don't think you could get a bad burger here.

name: VALMA
reviews: We are so lucky to have Valma a few steps from our home. Delicious food, friendly staff, cozy atmosphere. The menu is simple and changes weekly and constantly, pleasantly surprises us. We come here regularly and plan to brings friends, family, and visitors alike. Highly recommend this hidden gem.; Walked in excited and left super annoyed.ü§¨The restaurant had easily 8 tables open, maybe 6 with customers and when the person in the cashier understood we spoke English she told us that all the remaining tables were reserved. Seriously!?! Typical rude Parisian restaurant workers ! AVOID THEM!!!; Cool place for a Sunday brunch, the quality of the food is excellent and simple with good portion, the taste is good, not phenomenal , the juices were very good and original, but it is a bit small and when it gets busy, it gets loud.; Great food and great staff! Highly recommend. Made to feel very welcome; Very nice place for a brunch during weekend. Food is very good, kept simple. Kids friendly place. Best to book.

name: Neni Paris
reviews:
What a great find! Right opposite Gare de nord. Up above the hustle and bustle of the busy Paris streets below, a gorgeous haven of beautiful interiors with delicious food! Fabulous combination! All the dishes were delicious. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend.; Went this week for an early lunch with a colleague.
Location is great, especially if somebody has to catch a train from gare du Nord
The food was delicious ‚Äì every dish we chose was full of flavor and a different experience. we chose tapas style by taking several starters: Falafel, artichoke, fish carpaccio, and a side of potato skins.
This was not my first time ‚Äì each time the food has been great.
The service has varied in the past, but it was very good on this most recent visit

The photo was taken from the window so I could help my colleague find the restau.
For first time visitors it can be hard to find as it is inside the hotel

Reservation was v easy to make through their website online; Our whole family of eight enjoyed a delicious meal this evening. The waiter was excellent, funny, charming, prompt and made us all laugh with his personality. We had the best chicken shawarma we've ever had and the kids who had the kebab felt the same. The meal was finished with an unexpected complimentary dessert plate.  The best food we've had in Paris over our 2 weeks stay.; It's SO good! I had very limited time and they recommended what would be the quickest - salmon - and I don't know how, but it was just amazing. Very beautiful, very chill, extremely reasonable prices! I wish I has more time and I will definitely come back üòç It's also quite easy to find - go to the big gate, then up the stairs, then to the left and here you are :) You can also ask for something to go; The whole experience was just amazing, starting from the very professional and polite staff‚Ä¶ to the super tasty food! Mauricio was extremely nice with us and his recommendations made our dinner even more exceptional üëèüèª

We had the entrec√¥te and there were delicious, juicy as it supposed to be and just perfect! üòç üî•

We will be definitely back, as soon as possible ü´∂üèª

name: Caf√© de l‚Äô√âglise
reviews:
Amazing! Came here twice!!! Must stop to eat and drink! The best crispy goat cheese salad I‚Äôve ever had!! Fantastic espresso martini, wine selection and spritz‚Äôs . The staff is very accommodating and pleasant.
Huge French soup portion for lunch served with warm bread.; Great service, excellent food and good atmosphere. Highly recommend! We had the Church board as a light dinner and French toast and pancakes for dessert, all tasted terrific.; Used this place on our last day in Paris to enjoy a leisurely meal before catching the Eurostar home. The cafe is a short distance from Gare du Nord, has a great view of the Church and is popular with Parisiens. The waiter was very attentive and took our orders, even in our school level French. The Cheese and Cold meat selection was ample and tasty. The Croque Madame and Chicken Croque with a side of Frites also went down a storm. The was no pressure to leave the table and we enjoyed the people watching.; We chanced upon this restaurant while looking for a place for French cuisine near our hotel. We had the best meal throughout our trip in Paris here. The food was served nice and hot. The portion was huge and generous too. We ordered french onion soup, escargot, duck confit and mac & cheese with beef. Special mention to the staff who served us this evening, both the lady and the gentlemen were friendly and polite. They were very observant and paid attention to us, ensuring that we finish our entree before serving us with our mains. We had a great time here!; We had such a nice experience here we went back for dinner after having breakfast there with our family of six (parents + four kids). The food is typical brasserie food at good prices and the service is the nicest in all of Paris! They will make you feel like a local and their warmth will make the experience memorable. We were in a rush for breakfast and they delivered high quality food very quickly. So impressed and so happy to have found this great local spot!

name: Cr√™perie Broc√©liande
formatted_address: 15 Rue des Trois Fr√®res, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
Had the most delicious galettes and cr√™pes at Cr√™perie Broc√©liande! The crepe was the lightest and crispiest, fillings were fresh and flavorful, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. The staff was really warm and friendly.

Definitely recommend this spot for a delicious and authentic Parisian experience close to Montmartre!!; These have to be the best crepes and galettes in Paris! The lunchtime set menu is a great option with a drink included.; Excellent little crepery in historical district of Montmartre. We ordered 4 savory and 1 sweet crepes with different fillings. Everything tasted amazing. Service was quick and very friendly. I highly recommend this little gem!; Delicious crepes. The savory one was packed with filling and was really yum. The sweet ones were also delicious and the chocolate one used dark chocolate. Lovely staff and great service.; Not a restaurant you would want to go to when on holiday, but I'm so glad we did! Full of locals, nice quiet vibe. We had the menu midi (lunch deal) for just 15.80 each: we had a drink + savoury crepe + sweet crepe. It was delicious and like nothing we've ever tasted before. You get to choose which crepes from a list. We were first in line around 1pm and only waited maybe 3 minutes to get to our table. Highly recommend!

name: Le Ruisseau
reviews:
OMG‚Ä¶.best burger I have ever had !

The vibes at Le Ruisseau are immaculate, lots of tables outside and a great Happy Hour deal :)

The burgers are delicious and we could tell that all the ingredients were fresh and of good quality.

Service here was also great with friendly staff ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Je reviendrais !; Salad over Fish Burger!
Though the fish burger with added Cheddar cheese was yummy and juicy, it did feel a bit common. So let's talk about the salad...simple, fresh, lightly dressed and just what I needed when every 500 meters you end up sampling some delicious looking pastry in this Effiel Tower city.; We went to this burger place because of the good reviews. The restaurant is spacious and nice and the staff was also very friendly.
The burger was okay, but not that delicious. The flavour was just basic.; Absolutely fab. Prices decent. Good service.

Burger filled me up and was tasty üçî; Amazing service, atmosphere and great fresh food and cocktails.

name: Un Air de Famille
formatted_address: 26 R. du Ch√¢teau Landon, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: Really cozy , beautiful and welcoming people at the restaurant, I ate my first desert in Paris and it was goood; Kids friendly great food healthy; Very pleasant place and very nice staff especially for the child care part.; Taste good, all aspects are pretty good; Amazing place and excellent food!

name: LES FARFADETS PARIS
reviews:
Their salads are fantastic whether you're vegetarian or not!; Very good and cheap food. Friendly staff; üëç; I had a sandwich and a salmon quiche.
the sandwich was good, but the bread seemed industrial to me.

Likewise, for the quiche: bad surprise I came across a bacon quiche when I had ordered a salmon one... a slight disappointment especially since the quiche dough was much too soft to have taken out of the oven.; Having been faithful almost every day I can guarantee you that this place is just great, varied products and very, very good! I'm going to miss the leprechaun! Your former neighbor üòã

name: Food Market | Loisirs | √âv√©nements | Boom Boom Villette
reviews:
The food court has exciting vibe, free arcade game, and yummy foods!!!; Lovely atmosphere - for fun and also great for co-working - incl. places with plugs!
Great coffee and tasty food!
Staff is amazingly friendly and the escape room was really fun!; Nice place for food but could‚Äôve been cheaper than this. ‚Ä¶ the food is a bit costly compared to its taste; This review is for Street Banh Mi at the Food Market. Follow a very good review of Vietnamese community group on Facebook, I gave it a try to support my homeland foods and restaurant owners. I tried their special ‚ÄúB√°nh m√¨ ch·∫£o‚Äù which is kind of double price of a normal b√°nh m√¨ 8,5‚Ç¨. And that‚Äôs already expensive compared to many good banh m√¨ that I have tried in Paris. It was very noisy there and we needed to wait a bit long. And the ‚ÄúB√°nh m√¨ ch·∫£o‚Äù is too far from the b√°nh m√¨ ch·∫£o that I know. Dry, no sauce and quantity is not up to the price 15‚Ç¨. The quality is average. And the bread is under baked, white, too soft not crunchy. I usually don‚Äôt spend time to write negative review. I did this time because it isn‚Äôt correct to serve average quality for high price.
It deserves 2,5 stars.; BOOM BOOM VILLETTE is a big food court. It has almost all type of cuisines. Including Indian Chinese Thai Maxican American African Japanese Korean and many more. Lot of sitting place. Drinks also available on separate shop . It is very near to M7 and T3b station.  Parking is also available. At basement they have a huge bowling place. Also many fun activities for kids. At food court also you can plag Foosball and many other games for kids. You can come here with friends and family. It remain open till late night.

name: Candle Kids
reviews:
This is by far the best coffee shop in town!!!
Staff is super friendly, food is delicious and coffee is just amazing.
Highly recommended.; Adorable coffeeshop with a lot of space and tables both inside and outside. There are two zones for laptops. The coffee is great. Cinnamon roll is recommended!; good neighborhood coffee shop in the 20th arrondissement! we got the hojicha latte & cardamom bun ‚Äî both really good!! great place to catch up with friends.even though the place is full (even outside), the people really come and go so it‚Äôs easy to grab a table in just a few minutes wait!; Great coffee place, can recommend üëç
One of the ¬´¬†new style¬†¬ª chic Parisian cafes that you see here and there, and everywhere if you know what to look for. Which is good.; Friendly and warm little cafe in Belleville! This has been my go-to coffee shop during my stay in Paris, hands down! Best coffee and its made with L-O-V-E.  Fresh OJ, wonderful pastries and a lively environment to read or just people watch. Also, the cutest dogs hang out there. I highly recommend.

name: Folie des vents et des dunes
formatted_address: Gal de la Villette, 75019 Paris, France
reviews: Great space for kids if you are in the area and it's free. Parts of the area was closed when we visited but there was plenty for our aged kids. Definitely recommend if you are in the area with toddlers. Toilets available but they did smell.; We accidentally found this place where children have a lot of stunning possibilities to spend the time and developing their phisicall and sociological skills. Our niece found the place so beautiful ‚ù§Ô∏èüòç as we can't leave the place because she wants and wants to play here. üëåüëçüèÉü•≥; Nice big interesting playground for kids of all ages. You see more than one kid have tantrums when its time to leave. I wish they let us take the strollers in. Some broken equipment. But mostly very nice. Staff friendly and polite.; Kids have had super fun play time here.; Was closed during g olympics.

name: Soc Francaise D Exploitation Restauran
reviews: great value for money for the crazy bar.

name: Le Hang'art
formatted_address: 61-63 Quai de la Seine, 75019 Paris, France
reviews:
Love this place, laid back and very friendly. Huge portions with swift service. Probably our best experiance so far eating out in Paris.

Would 100% recommend. 4.8/5; Spacious repurposed building where the furniture is school desks. Good food and service. I thought the king prawns on my tagliatelle were a bit mushy but otherwise liked it all. Reasonable prices. Loved the banoffee; Well located by the canal, this restaurant is very baby/kid friendly! üë∂ They have high chairs, toys, books and a dedicated area for kids! However you need to pay 8‚Ç¨ to access this area.. The food in general is simple and good, nothing extraordinary but for a high volume restaurant it's fine!; Fun and hip little place, very atmospheric, welcoming staff, food was yummy, overall really great experience!; I came to Paris to eat but with the rain and some fatigue I tried staying closer to my hotel. This was down the street and it‚Äôs had a few things going for it: an menu that had a few intriguing dishes, a hip looking crowd, and the guy that met me at the door was pretty inviting.

I ended getting a cuttlefish and potato salad with an onion dressing and a vegetarian lasagne. Both dishes really hit it out of the park for me. I‚Äôm normally leaning carnivore, but had been overdoing it on the trip so far, and so I was happily surprised that the veg lasagne was possible the best veg one I‚Äôve ever had.

I was also peaking at the tables by me and the burrata avocado tomato salad also looked great, and the frites looked home made and home style with skins and plenty of dark bits on the edges.

name: F√©d√©ration internationale des caf√©s des enfants
vicinity: 92 bis Quai de la Loire, Paris
formatted_address: 92 bis Quai de la Loire, 75019 Paris, France
reviews: Very special place for kids! ‚ù§Ô∏è; The ideal place to get together with your children and adults.; Perfect for taking a breather

name: LES TRIPLETTES DE BELLEVILLE
reviews: We highly recommend this restaurant because the food and atmosphere are excellent plus the service is exceptional! Our server and the chef went above and beyond to ensure that our dining experience was five stars. Thank you very much üòä; Okay. I just arrived in Paris after being in Italy for 2 weeks, and this was honestly better than anything I had there! Don‚Äôt tell Italy, but this place is sooo good. I had the coquillettes pasta with ham. They use truffle gouda and it‚Äôs to die for! I ate the whole thing. Finished it with the chocolate cake. The server Juliette was very kind to me and gave me recommendations for things to do while I‚Äôm in Paris. Highly recommend! ; Went here for breakfast. The design looked quite cool and the food was pretty good but we noticed a lot of mouse / rat droppings on the sofa and and on the counters which put us off a lot also the toilet wasn't nice and didn't have any soap which didn't help with the cleanliness feeling.; The breakfast menu consisting of a hot drink, croissant, and fresh orange juice was great. Especially the croissant that was just fresh out of the issue. While the cafe au lait was delicious, the peppermint tea consisted of fresh mint leaves and a bag of green tea. This wasn't great for people who order mint tea specifically because they don't enjoy green tea.; Had a lovely time here. Two friends and I ordered a menu (Formule) and they took a bit too long. They forgot my starter and brought it after the main dish which was messed up too; the steak was half-raw when I like it done. So to compensate, they gave me free desert and only charged me for one dish. Altogether I really appreciate this gesture and I would return.

name: La Maison Des Sources
reviews:
The best place to welcome children and parents in eastern Paris in my opinion. The only downside: it is sometimes too busy (very variable depending on the day, time, and weather in particular).; The best place to welcome children and parents in eastern Paris!
I tested 4 of them and the Maison des Sources is for sure the best. Great, pleasant team, equipment provided.
Only downside: the place is starting to be a victim of its success and is sometimes a little too busy for my taste.; Mixed reception, depending on the day of the week and the educators present. Some educators allow themselves to make judgments and comments on your attitude with your child, I have put her in her place as a guide and not a moralizing judge.
Otherwise the manager loves children and is very welcoming, needs to see his team again which is very uneven.; I only give one star to this rather beautiful initiative but there are several problems which do not make you want to return to the Maison des Sources. 1. The stock of books and toys is too poor. Many toys are too worn and damaged. 2. In the context of Covid, I have doubts about the proper washing of toys and the place in general. 3. And this is the most unpleasant point. Several times I witnessed the moralizing reflections that the facilitators (although each time different) allow themselves to make to nannies or parents about the education of children. I don't know who trains these employees in this psychology of the counter and who encourages them to behave like a moral police. In any case, what is certain is that those who bring children to play in this place really do not need to make comments in a belittling and childish tone, nor do we need a psychological analysis. straight from the magic hat.; Very warm welcome from the staff and other mothers for the first time as a grandmother with my 2 year old little boy...very pleasant place for the children...relaxation and discoveries

name: La Petite Halle
vicinity: Attenant √† la Grande Halle de la Villette, 211 Avenue Jean Jaur√®s, Paris
formatted_address: Attenant √† la Grande Halle de la Villette, 211 Av. Jean Jaur√®s, 75019 Paris, France
reviews:
We came on a calm weekend (school holidays), for a quick dinner, and left during a concert that had started in the meantime. The place is great (high ceilings, cozy decor and outside space), as are the pizzas üçï and the staff. More the half the tables were removed at 21:15 to give space to the concert, which was clearly indicated from the start. Can add some stress if you are still eating (we had to be on the lookout for tables that wouldn‚Äôt be removed for the concert in order to get one and finish our dinner), but it is what it is. Same for the noise. Overall, good experience.; This place had a really cool vibe and the food was good but the birds were hounding us our entire meal (although they were pretty cute).

The wood fired margherita pizza was great as were the fish and chips.; Are you hanging around with friends in a ‚òÄÔ∏èüòé day in spring üå±üåº Paris and you need a not so quick stop to recover forces, aka, take a beer and a üåØüåÆ, with some fries üçü perhaps? Well you're in the right place, choose your sit ü™ë under a üå¥üå≤ and enjoy a moment in this beautiful place. Price/quality is alright.; Somehow landed here on a Sunday evening & there was live music with an amazing vibe.
Lots of cool people. A bunch of kids too.
Very happy we decided to stay
I also must add that the pizza was great too ! We devoured it.
No service thou. You have to make a queue & order & then pick it up. But worth it; We chose this restaurant for its convenience, as options were limited near the Zenith before a show.

The space boasts a spacious, cozy setting with an industrial vibe. However, the service was notably lacking, possibly due to being understaffed on a busy Saturday evening. Our ability to order food was restricted until 7 PM, although our server accommodated us at 6:50 PM. Despite this, our pizza order, even after several reminders, took over 40 minutes, leading us to cancel it. Both the sweet potato and bruschetta entr√©es were disappointing.

While the ambiance is inviting for drinks, the dining experience was underwhelming. Additionally, seating near the entrance can be uncomfortable in winter, as the cold wind sweeps in each time the door opens.

name: Caf√© Odilon
formatted_address: 16 Quai de la Marne, 75019 Paris, France
reviews:
We had a nice time at this restaurant. The pizzas (mozzarella and burrata) were delicious and the desserts were really good (crumble and cheesecake). Its just a bit noisy at evening. But the service was quite quick for a Saturday night.; I would like to highlight the chia pudding, pudding made of chia seed and coconut milk probably. A nice combination to serve.

The tartare beef is served with peanuts and is gentle in taste. I find it interesting but I don‚Äôt describe it in a surprising way. I expected it rawer as a beef tartare should be. The sauce in the starter amazes me and I hope I would know how they make them so that I could try to do it on my own.; We waited an hour for our food, only to be told they'd completely forgotten about our order. The place was being run by two rather aggressive students, particularly the girl at the counter, who proceeded to shout at us when we calmly expressed our frustration about the service. She seemed to take offence at the notion that we expected to be served.

Now, I believe "service" and "serve" stem from the same root. If serving people isn‚Äôt your thing, perhaps it‚Äôs time to reconsider the profession.

Overall, it was a thoroughly disappointing experience, and our Sunday night was completely ruined.; Very nice place for lunch in the front of the canal St-Martin. The pizzas are delicious. Nice selection of entrees as well.; The customer service here is really bad. Takes forever to get served, a long time for the drinks to arrive and an eternity to pay the bill. Parts of the order was forgotten as well. Cute place, but seriously.

name: Zo√© Bouillon
reviews: Fantastic little bouillon with a local vibe and delicious food. We had the vegetarian blanquette on a cold wintery day and it was pure comfort. Their savory cakes are the perfect accompaniment and the desserts are delish and not too sweet. The staff is friendly and the care they put in their cuisine is apparent. We‚Äôll definitely be back repeatedly!; This is the perfect spot for lunch in this neighborhood! So many delicious options and the staff was so helpful translating the menu into English for me. I would definitely come back here for a delicious, easy lunch (and for the adorable dog who seems to own the restaurant haha).; Very good, hearty meal. Couldn‚Äôt finish all they gave us but really wanted to. Home cooked family style meal. served on plates and bowls. not sure what all the cardboard reviews are about.; this was a little gem during my several month stay in the Belleville neighborhood. I quickly became a regular. It has the warmth & soul of a family run restaurant with healthy reasonably priced meals. (I usually took out the stew) The proprietor helped me with my struggling French as well.. (though I always just said yes to everything she asked) Extra toppings? oui bien sur!  :); Easy, cosy and very good food. Family and kids friendly place, it's just few minutes from Buttes Chaumont Park. The menu is simple, tasty and everything is home made.

name: Les Enfants Perdus
reviews: we came here three times during our stay in the area. the food is absolutely exquisite. everything is cooked to perfection. service is great. i came and got the exact same meal every night, the veal. i tried veal at two other expensive restaurants, and they were not as good as the one here. the pain perdu is also the best desert..EVER. we will miss this place and will be back next time we‚Äôre in Paris.; Great food with a very cozy atmosphere and  dim lightning. Perfect to catch up with a friend or a date!; A very cosy restaurant, very welcoming and friendly staff. Food is great, I had the beef tartare and foie gras and both are amazing. I wish I could try the escargots but it‚Äôs not the seasons.; Les Enfants Perdus is a hidden gem! The salmon and lasagna were amazing. Perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. Great ambiance and service too. Highly recommend; Services and ambience are very nice!!!! But it‚Äôs a bit packed, literally we touched the people‚Äôs arms next to our table. Food is good.

name: La Maison de Doudou
reviews:
Great pizza with a lot of flavor for a great price!; It was closed for construction; Best service ever!; Excellent üëåüèª; Excellent and friendly

We have just eaten there and we came from Nogent to spend a pleasant time in a community area and change a little.

Result: nothing to complain about
There is a lot of life and children, the setting is colorful and attractive and that‚Äôs what made me want to bring the children there.

The 2 young girls on site are adorable, the prices are extremely fair: we ate very well with 3 adults and 2 children and we were completely satisfied for the good eaters that we are with pizza, drinks and very generous desserts for an ultra price down ‚Ä¶

I absolutely don't understand the previous comments: probably coming from angry and embittered people.
But what do those who complain for nothing think?

Let those who complain about the prices go and eat in other, bigger restaurants with a pizza for ‚Ç¨22, that will calm them down.

A person from the kitchen ensured cleanliness and was himself cleaning the tables.

Looking forward to returning to Doudou with our children who love simplicity, conviviality and well-thought-out things!

And congratulations and good luck for the opening in the south üëèüëèüëè

name: Le Gourbi Palace
reviews: Amazing charm local little spot to have a enjoy a beer listening to live music. A gem ! Family and kids friendly!; Stellar little spot full of charm and good times. Relaxed atmosphere and interesting space. Good selection and decent prices!; Eat and drink with the locals. Very friendly staff, small but interesting menu and great food.; Pleasant honest and friendly. Best Mojito in Paris ? üòâ; Top

name: Pomme Home Famille
reviews:
Wonderful place to do yoga and meditation sonore. Very friendly staff. One of the best places to do yoga in Paris.; Pomme Maison is truly the ideal place for your Pilates classes, yoga and many other disciplines for both adults and children.
You can also sit in the beautifully decorated coffee area, have a good coffee prepared by Minerve and above all don't forget to ask for the delicious cookie next to your drink ü•§üç™; Very warm place for women and young mothers who want to do gentle activities.
Varied yoga sessions accessible to all, pilates teacher Mathilde at the top!; Since July 2023, I have been going to Pomme. I tried yoga and Pilates and since September I have been going 3 times a week. Very good teachers, caring and competent in a gentle atmosphere. Having lived in the neighborhood for a long time, thank you to Minerve for this place of relaxation and exchange.; It's a magical place, much more powerful and stronger than a simple caf√© or a yoga room. As a young mother I discovered a bubble of oxygen in my daily life, fleeting encounters with other mothers but which give the strength to face the sometimes difficult daily life with a baby. Precious moments of sharing, kindness, benevolence that I underestimated the need for. And yet I was going backwards... The workshops with babies and other mothers are all great, don't hesitate for a second and push the door!!!

name: ROND - Sarrazin et Calvados -
reviews:
Some of the best pancakes I‚Äôve had in my life - both sweet and sour! Simply delicious. The staff was super kind, and the place has its own vibe. Love it!; Supremely scrumptious galette and crepes!! Tucked away from the hectiness of Paris, the neighborhood is so serene and the crepes super decadentüíì; Not exactly a road trip into Transvaal but still just as worth it were so ! Eclectic dining experience made of home made and genuine products accompanied by Cidre Bio AOC . Everything up to expectations it is definitely a parisian creperie "hors normes" and worth the attention of every food lover tourist or resident. Was our second time and will come back for sure. Strangely no tomatoes in any receipe which questions my taste for Compl√®te üçÖ tomate-oeuf-fromage üòâ prices on top quite moderate. Outdoor tables available seasonly.; Cute little place with homemade Bretagne cr√™pes. The food and cider were amazing.
Around lunch time it got very busy and a bit stressful to eat next to the passing waiters,  but overall it was worth it and I'd go back üëç; I've had a few crepes and galettes in my time, and these are the best I've ever had!
This place is off the beaten track... not the kind of place you'd stumble across. It was kindly recommended to us by our host, when staying at a nearby apartment. And what a great recommendation it was!
A lovely little restaurant with a great atmosphere.
The staff were really friendly and helpful, and very accommodating of our less-than-brilliant French.
There's a good selection of French cidre, which is always a good thing.
And the food was perfect. I had the Bosrobert galette (sausage, egg etc) then the Mi Choco crepe (both pictured).
I hope we'll return to Belleville one day, and if we do, we will head straight to this place!

name: Le Patio
reviews:
A lovely restaurant with wholesome food and impeccable service. All round a wonderful experience. Dessert was delicious too!; Very nice place for a delicious food and wine!; The service was implacable and the food was very good. We can‚Äôt wait to come back.; Very good place for a typical French bistro lunch. The waiter was very helpful translating the menu and we all had lovely food. The Thai steak was amazing - very good sized portions and delicious; Je le fais en anglais pour Adriana et Sutha le chef:
They are first of all the kindness you will never find in the city of love, Paris. BUT HERE the love in serving you to the good food you eat without being ripped off!  Please try the Mille feuilles ch√®vre-betterave and salmon tartare with mango and ‚Ä¶..
just go there and meet Adriana who is at the bare and taking care of everything with Kevin. Do not miss this place in Paris!

name: Au Fond du Jardin
reviews:
Amazing atmosphere, good food, lovely staff; Great place, beautiful garden setting, delicious food and drinks.; Super nice hidden garden, the restaurant is a great place for a quiet dinner.
The food is pretty good, so are the cocktails. The service is efficient, and the food and drinks are fairly priced; Pizzas are good and not too expensive, although not completely filling, you should expect to need a starter or desert. The backyard is calm and nicely decorated, it's awesome during a sunny day.; Cozy place, caring waiter, pleasant general atmosphere. We weren't disappointed by the dinner at this place. Although, they didn't check vaccine certificate. Some other minuses:
- food was mediocre (fish of the day was not well cooked and vegetables was quite watery, still, the fish tasted nice);
- absence of the music is awkward, because you can hear all the talks around.

name: LES FARFADETS PARIS
reviews:
Their salads are fantastic whether you're vegetarian or not!; Very good and cheap food. Friendly staff; üëç; I had a sandwich and a salmon quiche.
the sandwich was good, but the bread seemed industrial to me.

Likewise, for the quiche: bad surprise I came across a bacon quiche when I had ordered a salmon one... a slight disappointment especially since the quiche dough was much too soft to have taken out of the oven.; Having been faithful almost every day I can guarantee you that this place is just great, varied products and very, very good! I'm going to miss the leprechaun! Your former neighbor üòã

name: Restaurant Discovery Food
reviews:
I came here excited to try their food, but once I began ordering that changed (I‚Äôm only visiting so my French is very little) tried to order what I could In French and the rest id point, the lady was so rude mumbling under her breath like ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt speak French‚Äù very rudely which I understood Because I understand French. I so No, sorry. I continued to order and she continued to be very rude to me, so I just Left. Just because you feel miserable doesn‚Äôt mean you have to treat others horribly.; By far the best food place!! Here you can get freshly prepared dishes at fair prices. If you are looking for a delicious and healthy lunch, this restaurant is the best in the area. Moreover, the staff is super friendly!; It looks beautiful and tastes good. The seating is so small and it's crowded as there were only 2 people trying to do everything. Great service though. I bought a sandwich which tasted good. I'll try visiting again !; Finally a restaurant that understands what we really need in Paris!
Being able to eat a balanced diet, with a wide choice, for a reasonable price!
Thanks to the managers, the atmosphere is very pleasant and intimate, I recommend!

@LVS.kid; Excellent place, I highly recommend! Thank you to the very friendly and helpful duo of ladies who received us.

name: Candle Kids
reviews:
This is by far the best coffee shop in town!!!
Staff is super friendly, food is delicious and coffee is just amazing.
Highly recommended.; Adorable coffeeshop with a lot of space and tables both inside and outside. There are two zones for laptops. The coffee is great. Cinnamon roll is recommended!; good neighborhood coffee shop in the 20th arrondissement! we got the hojicha latte & cardamom bun ‚Äî both really good!! great place to catch up with friends.even though the place is full (even outside), the people really come and go so it‚Äôs easy to grab a table in just a few minutes wait!; Great coffee place, can recommend üëç
One of the ¬´¬†new style¬†¬ª chic Parisian cafes that you see here and there, and everywhere if you know what to look for. Which is good.; Friendly and warm little cafe in Belleville! This has been my go-to coffee shop during my stay in Paris, hands down! Best coffee and its made with L-O-V-E.  Fresh OJ, wonderful pastries and a lively environment to read or just people watch. Also, the cutest dogs hang out there. I highly recommend.

name: La Poulette de Grain
formatted_address: 261 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
Top Service and good food in this exquisite Parisienne Bistro.

The waiter was very acommodating, extraordinarily friendly and helpful with our requests and explained the menu nicely.

The onion soup was very good.
The steak was okay, but they have nice fries & sauces. The creme brul√©e was delicious!

Can recommend!; As a New Yorker coming to Paris coming to this restaurant was simply fantastic. It was great fast service and the waiters were kind funny and gracious. I will definitely come back here again and they say open after midnight, which is fantastic.; The most delicious onion soup I've tried! Must have to order!
The rest of the food was tasty as well.
Prices are also very good.
I will definitely come back.; Very cozy atmosphere, friendly and passionate staff. Food quality is all we could ever ask for. Roast chicken is extremely tender and juicy, paired with flavorful sauce. We also have the duck parmentier, ribs and sea bass, all of them are delicious! We were served with an aromatic mint tea afterwards, which soothed our full bellies.
Overall, very good experience, 200% will come again when we travel to Paris!; Highly recommend. Delicious food, excellent service and great prices. Merci!

name: LES TRIPLETTES DE BELLEVILLE
reviews: We highly recommend this restaurant because the food and atmosphere are excellent plus the service is exceptional! Our server and the chef went above and beyond to ensure that our dining experience was five stars. Thank you very much üòä; Okay. I just arrived in Paris after being in Italy for 2 weeks, and this was honestly better than anything I had there! Don‚Äôt tell Italy, but this place is sooo good. I had the coquillettes pasta with ham. They use truffle gouda and it‚Äôs to die for! I ate the whole thing. Finished it with the chocolate cake. The server Juliette was very kind to me and gave me recommendations for things to do while I‚Äôm in Paris. Highly recommend! ; Went here for breakfast. The design looked quite cool and the food was pretty good but we noticed a lot of mouse / rat droppings on the sofa and and on the counters which put us off a lot also the toilet wasn't nice and didn't have any soap which didn't help with the cleanliness feeling.; The breakfast menu consisting of a hot drink, croissant, and fresh orange juice was great. Especially the croissant that was just fresh out of the issue. While the cafe au lait was delicious, the peppermint tea consisted of fresh mint leaves and a bag of green tea. This wasn't great for people who order mint tea specifically because they don't enjoy green tea.; Had a lovely time here. Two friends and I ordered a menu (Formule) and they took a bit too long. They forgot my starter and brought it after the main dish which was messed up too; the steak was half-raw when I like it done. So to compensate, they gave me free desert and only charged me for one dish. Altogether I really appreciate this gesture and I would return.

name: L'Atelier de LiLi
reviews: The place is small and charming with very good food if you need something for a fast snack‚Ä¶ their concept is cute, like you are entering someone‚Äôs kitchen.
