A home made Mango juice was super, I like a lot their muffins, so far the best one I‚Äôve tried in Paris‚Ä¶other things we ordered were good as well.; Amazing macarons and coffee. The owners are so friendly, would love to come back next time I'm in town!; Great value, warm welcome as you are part of the family, comes much recommended !!!! Well done guys, see you soon !; The sweetest owners! You can tell the food is made with love üíúü•∞; Short story: despite a good dish the owner tried to steal money from us. She will be very kind to clients she likes probably but she decided to snap at us constantly for no reason. / Long story: The woman who runs this place scams people. All the bad reviews you see are people who have been scammed and who have been scolded at for no reason. She tried to steal 10 euros from us for the mess we left because we were eating with a 1 year old and 3 year old and they spilled crumbs (maybe don‚Äôt run a restaurant if you can‚Äôt handle it?). We were 3 adults sharing 2 expensive meals and an overpriced muffin and two coffees and she charged us 52 euros with an imaginary extra 10 euros for a ‚Äúcocktail‚Äù. We returned to get refunded and she even tried to justify it because of the crumbs. She said ‚ÄúI added 10 euros because of the mess you left‚Äù ‚Äî acknowledging this theft. Imagine you were charged 10 euros extra everywhere you ate because you or your kids left crumbs on the floor? Completely absurd. She chooses to run the place this way scamming those she doesn‚Äôt like. She was super nice to the table next to us and actually telling them she didn‚Äôt like our table‚Ä¶ ?! We even apologised and mentioned the food was good and she said she didn‚Äôt appreciate our ‚Äúpicnic‚Äù (because we shared ‚Ä¶.) and that the crumbs were not ‚Äúserious‚Äù ‚Äî I think some people should change careers if they can‚Äôt handle the most mundane happenings of a restaurant, and be the opposite of kind. Especially if you‚Äôre the owner.

name: Melting Pot Food Court
vicinity: 43 Avenue du G√©n√©ral de Gaulle, Bagnolet
formatted_address: 43 Av. du G√©n√©ral de Gaulle, 93170 Bagnolet, France
reviews:
A family friendly restaurant which offers a large choice of different meals coming from all over the world for all kind of tastes. The milkshakes & cocktails are extremly good, as well as the deserts! The decoration of the restaurant is very original.; This is a value for money place, good food with good pricing. It‚Äôs near our hotel and closes late so we always drop by here for dinner after a long day of sightseeing. Serves a variety of cuisine and it‚Äôs a chill place. Choose from the self serve terminal, take a table number tent and pay.  They accepts cash at counter too!; It‚Äôs a nice place for us as tourists who ate their breakfasts here!
The egg sandwich was very delicious but there‚Äôs room to improve the coffee and tea!

The staff are nice and friendly!
The Menu is good!
The place and the Jazz music is just lovely!
The price is good as well!; Food is very good, basic dishes but well made, the staff is absolutely delightful. Always a smile and doing their best to give you a great experience. The place is clean, including toilets, we've stayed here for hours without being bothered by anyone, waiting for our flight home. We'll be back.; What a great place for having lunch or dinner, our hotel is just a walking distance from this food court and we have just finished the day trip and was hungry.

The food court catered several restaurants from italian, Thai and Indian ect.

Order is very easy with some tablets for ordering food and drinks just after the entrance. Not ling our order is done and the staff will bring it to your table.

Our food taste great and with a huge portion to.

Nice and clean interior with friendly and helpfull staff.

name: Zo√© Bouillon
reviews: Fantastic little bouillon with a local vibe and delicious food. We had the vegetarian blanquette on a cold wintery day and it was pure comfort. Their savory cakes are the perfect accompaniment and the desserts are delish and not too sweet. The staff is friendly and the care they put in their cuisine is apparent. We‚Äôll definitely be back repeatedly!; This is the perfect spot for lunch in this neighborhood! So many delicious options and the staff was so helpful translating the menu into English for me. I would definitely come back here for a delicious, easy lunch (and for the adorable dog who seems to own the restaurant haha).; Very good, hearty meal. Couldn‚Äôt finish all they gave us but really wanted to. Home cooked family style meal. served on plates and bowls. not sure what all the cardboard reviews are about.; this was a little gem during my several month stay in the Belleville neighborhood. I quickly became a regular. It has the warmth & soul of a family run restaurant with healthy reasonably priced meals. (I usually took out the stew) The proprietor helped me with my struggling French as well.. (though I always just said yes to everything she asked) Extra toppings? oui bien sur!  :); Easy, cosy and very good food. Family and kids friendly place, it's just few minutes from Buttes Chaumont Park. The menu is simple, tasty and everything is home made.

name: Baby Love Burger
reviews:
despite what some reviews say this is a great smash burger ‚Äî your choices are beef, chicken or veg ‚Äî extra bacon? the staff are super friendly and they spoke BOTH French and English!

the decor is all neon with mirrors ‚Äî it‚Äôs a rad spot that you should definitely try if you‚Äôre looking for a quick bite!

I‚Äôd recommend getting either the double or triple burger because it won‚Äôt floor you ‚Äî the portion of fries was huge, and the nuggets are excellent! The buns are brioche and add a buttery flavour to the meal ‚Äî so good.; Love this cute burger joint. Super simple menu and great prices. Fresh and all on brioche buns incase that‚Äôs not for you. Generous serving of great fries with the menu. I had the simple beef burger and it was almost similar to Shake Shack but way fresher and less soft/fall-apart. Love the fit out too.; Was really good loved it!!
Definitely filled up a niche here in Paris.; Such an excellent burger! The meat was tender and juicy, the way a good burger should be. We really loved it. The homemade sauce was also great for the huge portion of fries.; Baby love Burger offers a quick and affordable dining experience with friendly staff. While the burgers and fries are tasty, I found them a bit on the fatty and salty side. Nevertheless, it stands as a great local alternative to the larger burger chains, providing a satisfying option for a quick bite.

name: Caf√© Jeux Natema.
reviews:
A place to discover urgently. A third associative place which offers EXCELLENT, very original catering and good quality products. The atmosphere of this place is an associative atmosphere with workshops, games to borrow... a treat.
Important detail: the prices are very reasonable.; Yannis' cuisine is tasty, with flavors that take you on a journey, the bread is homemade. The smells will make you salivate and your digestion will only be better. Go for it. G; Great atmosphere, fast service and pleasant waiters, excellent and seasonal cuisine; Unique and privileged place!
The welcome is great.

THANKS !; A great association
Or we offer you lots of things
Eat good products
Cheap
Offers you theater tickets and museum outings
And other shows
With culture of heart
We can play board games...
Academic support is offered
The people who take care of it are friendly and professional.
A beautiful place

name: Little Parmentier
reviews:
I had the fish and chips and my wife had the Carnard.  Food was delicious but I am going to echo what others have said, the owner is super friendly, warm and welcoming.  I would gladly come back based on that alone.  Highly recommended for both food and atmosphere.; Am not sure I went to the right Little Parmentier if all the reviews are true!
The steak was rubbery, the salad was manky and the small glass of red was ‚Ç¨7. A real tourist trap! I shouldn't have entered when I saw the place completely empty!
Serves me right for placing my trust in these reviews!; Our first dinner experience in Paris and it was wonderful. The gentleman that was front of house was so nice and helpful. Food itself was also wonderful, cook on the beef was absolutely perfect.; The food is  very good and familiar.
The boss is nice and friendly and the ambiance is calm and relaxed...
The prices are moderate and we can choose some good artisanal beers. We feel at home!; One of the best restaurants in Paris

name: Les Ni√ßois
reviews:
We found this place randomly and it was a nice surprise
Great staff, good food and beer with a reasonable price
Definitely recommend; A mediocre food, combine but a worse service ever, a nasty woman, who refused t serve my table based on her mood. Menu  eclectic not original neither interesting, Overprice and not worth a penny, is a pity they waste such a good location; Quite unusual place, with a real p√©tanque playground and table soccer board game in the basement. The food is nice for lunch, and prices are reasonable. The waiters' kindness and waiting time are greatly varying. For 16 euros, you get a 2 course set (entry + main dish or main dish + desert), with quite good, nice and fresh food, well cooked and well presented. Soups are way too salty though. The interior design is based on French southern style, the city of Nice especially. The window-roof makes the place quite bright.; Good place for brunch but also tapas in the evening. Chill place, very friendly staff, tasty food. Highly recommended for a nice evening with friends (you can play the typical french "P√©tanque" downstairs) or for couples. Will definitely go again !; Small but rather cozy place. Service was good. Food was decent and a really good price for lunch set (according to Paris standards). I paid 16 euros for an appetizer and a main course. They also have a sand pit for petanque and a foosball table downstairs.

name: ROND - Sarrazin et Calvados -
reviews:
Some of the best pancakes I‚Äôve had in my life - both sweet and sour! Simply delicious. The staff was super kind, and the place has its own vibe. Love it!; Supremely scrumptious galette and crepes!! Tucked away from the hectiness of Paris, the neighborhood is so serene and the crepes super decadentüíì; Not exactly a road trip into Transvaal but still just as worth it were so ! Around lunch time it got very busy and a bit stressful to eat next to the passing waiters,  but overall it was worth it and I'd go back üëç; I've had a few crepes and galettes in my time, and these are the best I've ever had!
This place is off the beaten track... not the kind of place you'd stumble across. It was kindly recommended to us by our host, when staying at a nearby apartment. And what a great recommendation it was!
A lovely little restaurant with a great atmosphere.
The staff were really friendly and helpful, and very accommodating of our less-than-brilliant French.
There's a good selection of French cidre, which is always a good thing.
And the food was perfect. I had the Bosrobert galette (sausage, egg etc) then the Mi Choco crepe (both pictured).
I hope we'll return to Belleville one day, and if we do, we will head straight to this place!

name: Le Patio
reviews:
A lovely restaurant with wholesome food and impeccable service. All round a wonderful experience. Dessert was delicious too!; Very nice place for a delicious food and wine!; The service was implacable and the food was very good. We can‚Äôt wait to come back.; Very good place for a typical French bistro lunch. The waiter was very helpful translating the menu and we all had lovely food. The Thai steak was amazing - very good sized portions and delicious; Je le fais en anglais pour Adriana et Sutha le chef:
They are first of all the kindness you will never find in the city of love, Paris. BUT HERE the love in serving you to the good food you eat without being ripped off!  Please try the Mille feuilles ch√®vre-betterave and salmon tartare with mango and ‚Ä¶..
just go there and meet Adriana who is at the bare and taking care of everything with Kevin. Do not miss this place in Paris!

name: @unr√™ve
reviews:
The savory food is mildly seasoned. I ordered chicken and French toast expecting a syrup or a play between sweet and salty. Maybe the pastries are better. Tried the black sesame flan and the matcha latte as well, it was average and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be returning.; Nice little Caf√© with delicious breakfast üòç. The French toast is a must-try! Our waitress was very welcoming and friendly. We will come back soon ‚ù§Ô∏è; One of the best caf√© in town!!
Before ordering my brunch, I checked for reviews and came across one mentioning that a customer was asked to put her iPad away. As I was arranging my laptop, I noticed signs everywhere stating 'no gadgets allowed on weekends and public holidays.' Thank god it's Wednesday today! üòÆ‚Äçüí®üéâ; Sone of the best brunch places you can try in Paris! Their Egg & Salmon croissants is just wow!! Extra fluffy croissants and soft gooey egg with a generous slice of smoked salmon‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs just heaven. The sweets are also a delight, creative and well balanced.
